  22. Question 22 of 50
    22. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Under which health insurance product IRDAI has made coverage of hospitalization treatment costs of COVID-19 mandatory?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Arogya Sanjeevani
    Explanation:
    Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) has made the coverage of hospitalization treatment costs of COVID-19 mandatory under standard health insurance product “Arogya Sanjeevani”. Apart from this, Indemnity based health insurance products offered by all general and health insurance companies will also cover the costs of hospitalization treatment because of covid-19.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Arogya Sanjeevani
    Explanation:
    Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) has made the coverage of hospitalization treatment costs of COVID-19 mandatory under standard health insurance product “Arogya Sanjeevani”. Apart from this, Indemnity based health insurance products offered by all general and health insurance companies will also cover the costs of hospitalization treatment because of covid-19.

    25. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Gita Ramjee who is in news in April 2020 is _______.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Virologist
    Explanation:
    Gita Ramjee, World-renowned virologist passed away in Johannesburg, South Africa, due to Covid-19. She was the stellar vaccine scientist and an HIV (Human immunodeficiency virus) prevention research leader. In 2018, She was presented with the Outstanding Female Scientist Award in Lisbon by the European Development Clinical Trials Partnerships (EDCTP) for her lifetime contribution in finding new HIV prevention methods.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Virologist
    Explanation:
    Gita Ramjee, World-renowned virologist passed away in Johannesburg, South Africa, due to Covid-19. She was the stellar vaccine scientist and an HIV (Human immunodeficiency virus) prevention research leader. In 2018, She was presented with the Outstanding Female Scientist Award in Lisbon by the European Development Clinical Trials Partnerships (EDCTP) for her lifetime contribution in finding new HIV prevention methods.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) ARMMAN
    Explanation:
    ARMMAN, an India-based non-profit organization (NPO), has been awarded the Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship 2020 in recognition of its exceptional work in the maternal and child health space in India, along with 4 other awardees. ARMMAN is the only organization from Asia and Africa, selected from 700 organizations.
    Following table shows the Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship 2020 winners:

    Organization Founder Coverage
    ARMMAN Dr. Aparna Hegde India
    Center for Tech and Civic Life (CTCL) Tiana Epps-Johnson, Donny Bridges, and Whitney May United States
    Glasswing International Celina de Sola and Ken Baker Central America
    International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) Drew Kodjak Global
    Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP) Drew Sullivan and Paul Radu Global
    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) ARMMAN
    Explanation:
    ARMMAN, an India-based non-profit organization (NPO), has been awarded the Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship 2020 in recognition of its exceptional work in the maternal and child health space in India, along with 4 other awardees. ARMMAN is the only organization from Asia and Africa, selected from 700 organizations.
    Following table shows the Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship 2020 winners:

    Organization Founder Coverage
    ARMMAN Dr. Aparna Hegde India
    Center for Tech and Civic Life (CTCL) Tiana Epps-Johnson, Donny Bridges, and Whitney May United States
    Glasswing International Celina de Sola and Ken Baker Central America
    International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) Drew Kodjak Global
    Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP) Drew Sullivan and Paul Radu Global

    Correct

    Answer – 2) March 31
    Explanation:

This year Transgender Day of Visibility (TDOV) has the theme and hashtag #MoreThanVisibility.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) March 31
    Explanation:
    The International Transgender Day of Visibility is observed every year on March 31 globally since 2009, to celebrate transgender people to raise awareness of discrimination faced by transgender people worldwide and their contributions to society. This year Transgender Day of Visibility (TDOV) has the theme and hashtag #MoreThanVisibility.

  31. Question 31 of 50
    31. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian state which topped all-India level for micro-irrigation (MI), under Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY) for FY20 (2019-20).

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Tamil Nadu
    Explanation:
    Tamil Nadu has topped the all-India level for micro-irrigation (MI), under Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY), with a coverage of 2,06,853.25 ha for the year financial year 2019-20 & It is followed by Karnataka and Gujarat respectively. In the cumulative coverage of MI from 2015-20, Karnataka topped with coverage of 8,15,690.31 ha.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Tamil Nadu
    Explanation:
    Tamil Nadu has topped the all-India level for micro-irrigation (MI), under Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY), with a coverage of 2,06,853.25 ha for the year financial year 2019-20 & It is followed by Karnataka and Gujarat respectively. In the cumulative coverage of MI from 2015-20, Karnataka topped with coverage of 8,15,690.31 ha.

  33. Question 33 of 50
    33. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which among the following railway manufacturing unit has developed low-cost ventilator ‘Jeevan’ to fight COVID-19?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Rail Coach Factory, Kapurthala
    Explanation:
    The Indian Railways’ coach producing unit Rail Coach Factory (RCF), Kapurthala in Punjab has developed a low-cost ventilator ‘Jeevan’ to combat covid-19 crisis. The cost of “Jeevan” is around Rs 10,000 without the compressor and it will not rise over Rs 30,000 even after adding a few more indicators. The ventilator is now awaiting the final clearance from the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Rail Coach Factory, Kapurthala
    Explanation:
    The Indian Railways’ coach producing unit Rail Coach Factory (RCF), Kapurthala in Punjab has developed a low-cost ventilator ‘Jeevan’ to combat covid-19 crisis. The cost of “Jeevan” is around Rs 10,000 without the compressor and it will not rise over Rs 30,000 even after adding a few more indicators. The ventilator is now awaiting the final clearance from the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR).

  34. Question 34 of 50
    34. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    By which year NASA has planned to set up ‘Artemis’ the first human base camp in South pole of moon?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) 2024
    Explanation:
    National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) unveiled its plan to setup ‘Artemis’, the first human base camp on Moon’s South Pole by 2024 through a 13-page report titled “NASA’s Plan for Sustained Lunar Exploration and Development”. The Artemis program aims to land first woman and next man on the moon by 2024. The program is carried out by NASA along with European Space Agency (ESA), the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), Canadian Space Agency (CSA) and the Australian Space Agency (ASA).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) 2024
    Explanation:
    National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) unveiled its plan to setup ‘Artemis’, the first human base camp on Moon’s South Pole by 2024 through a 13-page report titled “NASA’s Plan for Sustained Lunar Exploration and Development”. The Artemis program aims to land first woman and next man on the moon by 2024. The program is carried out by NASA along with European Space Agency (ESA), the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), Canadian Space Agency (CSA) and the Australian Space Agency (ASA).

  35. Question 35 of 50
    35. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Cricketer Stephen O’Keefe who retires from 1st class cricket recently, belongs to which country?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Australia
    Explanation:
    Former Australia Test Spinner Stephen Norman John O’Keefe, 35 years old, has retired from first-class cricket after being omitted from New South Wales’ list of contracted players for the next domestic season.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Australia
    Explanation:
    Former Australia Test Spinner Stephen Norman John O’Keefe, 35 years old, has retired from first-class cricket after being omitted from New South Wales’ list of contracted players for the next domestic season.

  36. Question 36 of 50
    36. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who has written the book titled “How Contagion Works: Science, Awareness and Community in Times of Global Crisis”?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Paolo Giordano
    Explanation:
    To provide better understanding and prevention of novel coronavirus (COVID-19), two new books are all set to release in May 2020. The books are: “How Contagion Works: Science, Awareness and Community in Times of Global Crisis” by Italian physicist Paolo Giordano. “Deadliest Enemy: Our War Against Killer Germs” by epidemiologist Michael Osterholm and author Mark Olshaker. Both books will be published by Hatchette, US.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Paolo Giordano
    Explanation:
    To provide better understanding and prevention of novel coronavirus (COVID-19), two new books are all set to release in May 2020. The books are: “How Contagion Works: Science, Awareness and Community in Times of Global Crisis” by Italian physicist Paolo Giordano. “Deadliest Enemy: Our War Against Killer Germs” by epidemiologist Michael Osterholm and author Mark Olshaker. Both books will be published by Hatchette, US.

  37. Question 37 of 50
    37. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The International Day of Conscience for the year 2020 is observed on ________.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) April 5
    Explanation:
    On April 5, 2020 The International Day of Conscience (IDC) is observed for the 1st time to recognize the need to establish stability, well-being, peaceful and friendly relations on the basis of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms for all, irrespective of race, gender, language or religion & also to remind people to self-reflect, follow their conscience, & do the right things.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) April 5
    Explanation:
    On April 5, 2020 The International Day of Conscience (IDC) is observed for the 1st time to recognize the need to establish stability, well-being, peaceful and friendly relations on the basis of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms for all, irrespective of race, gender, language or religion & also to remind people to self-reflect, follow their conscience, & do the right things.

  38. Question 38 of 50
    38. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the limit for a person reside in J&K to become permanent resident of the UT (as per revised norms)?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 15 years
    Explanation:
    A new definition for domicile for Jammu and Kashmir was introduced which has stated that a person residing in the Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir for at least 15 years or has studied for a period of seven years in Jammu and Kashmir and appeared in Class 10 or 12 examinations will now be eligible to be a permanent resident of the UT. This new rule was issued under the Section 3A of the Jammu and Kashmir Reorganisation Adaptation of State Laws Order 2020, under the Jammu and Kashmir civil services decentralisation and recruitment Act.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 15 years
    Explanation:
    A new definition for domicile for Jammu and Kashmir was introduced which has stated that a person residing in the Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir for at least 15 years or has studied for a period of seven years in Jammu and Kashmir and appeared in Class 10 or 12 examinations will now be eligible to be a permanent resident of the UT. This new rule was issued under the Section 3A of the Jammu and Kashmir Reorganisation Adaptation of State Laws Order 2020, under the Jammu and Kashmir civil services decentralisation and recruitment Act.

  39. Question 39 of 50
    39. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the amount that was granted as loan by Asian Development Bank (ADB) to Aavas financiers to improve women’s access to housing in India?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) $60 million
    Explanation:
    Asian Development Bank (ADB), a regional development bank, has signed a loan agreement worth of $60 million with affordable housing loan provider Aavas Financiers Ltd to provide housing finance to women in low-income communities either as primary borrowers or co-borrowers.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) $60 million
    Explanation:
    Asian Development Bank (ADB), a regional development bank, has signed a loan agreement worth of $60 million with affordable housing loan provider Aavas Financiers Ltd to provide housing finance to women in low-income communities either as primary borrowers or co-borrowers.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Students
    Explanation:
    Union Minister of Human Resource Development (HRD) Ramesh Pokhriyal ‘Nishank’ launched a unique MHRD All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) COVID-19 Student Helpline Portal to address the difficulties faced by students due to closure of colleges & hostels since March 25 because of the national lockdown.

    Explanation:

  44. Question 44 of 50
    44. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Jalila Haider the winner of International women of courage award belongs to which country?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Pakistan
    Explanation:
    Jalila Haider known as the ‘iron lady’ of Pakistan has won the presitigous International Women of Courage Award (given by US state department) for her relentless services to impoverished women and children in Balochistan province. According to a US State Department, the award, now in its 14th year, recognises women around the globe who have demonstrated exceptional courage and leadership in advocating for peace, justice, human rights, gender equality, and women’s empowerment at great personal risk.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Pakistan
    Explanation:
    Jalila Haider known as the ‘iron lady’ of Pakistan has won the presitigous International Women of Courage Award (given by US state department) for her relentless services to impoverished women and children in Balochistan province. According to a US State Department, the award, now in its 14th year, recognises women around the globe who have demonstrated exceptional courage and leadership in advocating for peace, justice, human rights, gender equality, and women’s empowerment at great personal risk.

  45. Question 45 of 50
    45. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Athlete Ruth Jebet is former Olympic champion in which event?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 3,000m steeplechase
    Explanation:
    Kenyan-born Bahraini runner Ruth Jebet has been handed a four-year ban after she was found guilty of testing positive for the banned blood booster r-EPO (recombinant erythropoietin), the Athletics Integrity Unit (AIU) on March 2020. Jebet, the 2016 Olympic 3,000m steeplechase champion, was suspended in February 2018 after she failed an out-of-competition test.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 3,000m steeplechase
    Explanation:
    Kenyan-born Bahraini runner Ruth Jebet has been handed a four-year ban after she was found guilty of testing positive for the banned blood booster r-EPO (recombinant erythropoietin), the Athletics Integrity Unit (AIU) on March 2020. Jebet, the 2016 Olympic 3,000m steeplechase champion, was suspended in February 2018 after she failed an out-of-competition test.

  46. Question 46 of 50
    46. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    The Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) extends the foreign trade policy 2015-20 by 1 year to 2021. DGFT comes under which ministry?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Ministry of Commerce and Industry
    Explanation:
    The Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT), the agency of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry of the Government of India (GoI), has extended the existing foreign trade policy (2015-20) for one year till March 2021.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Ministry of Commerce and Industry
    Explanation:
    The Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT), the agency of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry of the Government of India (GoI), has extended the existing foreign trade policy (2015-20) for one year till March 2021.

  47. Question 47 of 50
    47. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    When was Earth Hour 2020 celebrated?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) March 28
    Explanation:
    Earth Hour is a worldwide movement organized by the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF). The event is held annually encouraging individuals, communities, and businesses to turn off non-essential electric lights, for one hour, from 8:30 to 9:30 p.m. on a specific day towards the end of March, as a symbol of commitment to the planet. For the year 2020 the day was celebrated on March 28.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) March 28
    Explanation:
    Earth Hour is a worldwide movement organized by the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF). The event is held annually encouraging individuals, communities, and businesses to turn off non-essential electric lights, for one hour, from 8:30 to 9:30 p.m. on a specific day towards the end of March, as a symbol of commitment to the planet. For the year 2020 the day was celebrated on March 28.

  48. Question 48 of 50
    48. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Chilika lake is in which Indian state?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Odisha
    Explanation:
    Chilika Lake is a brackish water lagoon, spread over the Puri, Khurda and Ganjam districts of Odisha state.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Odisha
    Explanation:
    Chilika Lake is a brackish water lagoon, spread over the Puri, Khurda and Ganjam districts of Odisha state.

    Explanation:
    Chandoli National Park is a National Park spread over Satara, Kolhapur and Sangli Districts, Maharashtra State, India, established in May 2004.

    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Name the Indian state where Ukai dam is located?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    The Ukai Dam, constructed across the Tapi River, is the second largest reservoir in Gujarat after the Sardar Sarovar.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    The Ukai Dam, constructed across the Tapi River, is the second largest reservoir in Gujarat after the Sardar Sarovar.

  1. Question 1 of 60
    1. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The IRDAI has constituted a 16-member panel to strengthen its guidelines on corporate governance. Name the person who heads the panel.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Pravin Kutumbe
    Explanation:
    The Insurance Regulation and Development Authority (IRDAI) instituted a 16-member
    committee headed by Pravin Kutumbe to strengthen its guidelines on corporate
    governance. The committee consists of a head, six members from the insurance
    regulator besides members from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and the Securities and
    Exchange Board of India (SEBI) along with other industry participants. The committee
    must submit report to IRDAI in three months.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Pravin Kutumbe
    Explanation:
    The Insurance Regulation and Development Authority (IRDAI) instituted a 16-member
    committee headed by Pravin Kutumbe to strengthen its guidelines on corporate
    governance. The committee consists of a head, six members from the insurance
    regulator besides members from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and the Securities and
    Exchange Board of India (SEBI) along with other industry participants. The committee
    must submit report to IRDAI in three months.

  2. Question 2 of 60
    2. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is India’s rank in UN’s 8th World Happiness report 2020 which comprises of 156 countries?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) 144
    Explanation:
    The United Nations (UN) released the 8th World Happiness Report 2020 to measure the happiness of people of 156 countries where India (3.573) ranks in 144th position & Finland (7.809) tops the 3rd time. This is the 1st time the report ranks cities around the world, where Delhi- India (4.011) is positioned in 180th position which is among 10 least happiest cities, Helsinki-Finland (7.828) tops the report were, Kabul -Afghanistan (3.236) is at the bottom place with 186th position.
    Rank table (including top & bottom)

    Rank Country
    144 India
    1 Finland
    2 Denmark
    3 Switzerland
    151 Zimbabwe
    152 South Sudan
    153 Afghanistan
    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) 144
    Explanation:
    The United Nations (UN) released the 8th World Happiness Report 2020 to measure the happiness of people of 156 countries where India (3.573) ranks in 144th position & Finland (7.809) tops the 3rd time. This is the 1st time the report ranks cities around the world, where Delhi- India (4.011) is positioned in 180th position which is among 10 least happiest cities, Helsinki-Finland (7.828) tops the report were, Kabul -Afghanistan (3.236) is at the bottom place with 186th position.
    Rank table (including top & bottom)

    Rank Country
    144 India
    1 Finland
    2 Denmark
    3 Switzerland
    151 Zimbabwe
    152 South Sudan
    153 Afghanistan
  3. Question 3 of 60
    3. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Scientists of University of Cambridge have discovered the fossil of world’s
    oldest known modern bird skull dating to about 66.8m – 66.7m years ago. What is
    the name of the creature?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) WonderChicken
    Explanation:
    Scientists at the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom (UK) have discovered a
    fossil of the world’s oldest known modern bird skull dating to about 66.8m – 66.7m
    years ago- means the birds lived alongside dinosaurs for around a million years before
    the latter died out. Scientists dubbed the creature as ‘Wonderchicken’, which is thought
    to be a common ancestor of modern chickens and ducks. The findings were published in
    the journal Nature.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) WonderChicken
    Explanation:
    Scientists at the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom (UK) have discovered a
    fossil of the world’s oldest known modern bird skull dating to about 66.8m – 66.7m
    years ago- means the birds lived alongside dinosaurs for around a million years before
    the latter died out. Scientists dubbed the creature as ‘Wonderchicken’, which is thought
    to be a common ancestor of modern chickens and ducks. The findings were published in
    the journal Nature.

  4. Question 4 of 60
    4. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The International Day of Forests (IDF) is observed annually on March 21. What is the theme for IDF 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) “Forests and Biodiversity”
    Explanation:
    The International Day of Forests (IDF) is observed annually on March 21 to raise awareness of the importance of all types of forests and of trees outside forests. Theme of the year 2020: “Forests and Biodiversity”. The UN (United Nations) General Assembly proclaimed March 21 as the International Day of Forests (IDF) in 2012 and the day has been observed since 2013.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) “Forests and Biodiversity”
    Explanation:
    The International Day of Forests (IDF) is observed annually on March 21 to raise awareness of the importance of all types of forests and of trees outside forests. Theme of the year 2020: “Forests and Biodiversity”. The UN (United Nations) General Assembly proclaimed March 21 as the International Day of Forests (IDF) in 2012 and the day has been observed since 2013.

  5. Question 5 of 60
    5. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the organization which launched the capacity building program ‘Tech for Tribals’ to bring technology to tribal entrepreneurs.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) TRIFED
    Explanation:
    A 30- day long capacity building program called “Tech for Tribal” has been launched by the Tribal Cooperative Marketing Development Federation of India (TRIFED), which works under Ministry of Tribal Affairs in association with IIT-Kanpur, IIT-Roorkee, IIM Indore, Kalinga Institute of Social Science, Bhubaneshwar (Odisha) and SRIJAN, Jaipur to provide entrepreneurship skills to the tribal people. The Programme is supported by MSME ministry.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) TRIFED
    Explanation:
    A 30- day long capacity building program called “Tech for Tribal” has been launched by the Tribal Cooperative Marketing Development Federation of India (TRIFED), which works under Ministry of Tribal Affairs in association with IIT-Kanpur, IIT-Roorkee, IIM Indore, Kalinga Institute of Social Science, Bhubaneshwar (Odisha) and SRIJAN, Jaipur to provide entrepreneurship skills to the tribal people. The Programme is supported by MSME ministry.

  6. Question 6 of 60
    6. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the 1st Indian state police in the country to introduce taser guns.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    The Gujarat Police is first in the country to be equipped with taser guns as a part of police weapons to ensure safety and security of the public. Earlier, the taser guns were used in agencies such as the UK Metropolitan Police, the Los Angeles Police Department and the New York Police Department.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    The Gujarat Police is first in the country to be equipped with taser guns as a part of police weapons to ensure safety and security of the public. Earlier, the taser guns were used in agencies such as the UK Metropolitan Police, the Los Angeles Police Department and the New York Police Department.

  7. Question 7 of 60
    7. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian state which signs MoU with Netherland company Flying Car Maker PAL-V to set up the manufacturing plant in the state.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    Flying car-maker PAL-V (Personal Air Land Vehicle) of the Netherlands will set up a manufacturing plant in Gujarat. A Memorandum of Understandings (MoU) was signed in the presence of Gujarat Chief Minister (CM) Vijay Ramniklal Rupani between state industries Principal Secretary MK Das and Carl Maasbommel, Vice President of PAL-V’s international business development. The Dutch car company sets up the firm for the first time in India and has set a target of commencing production by 2021.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    Flying car-maker PAL-V (Personal Air Land Vehicle) of the Netherlands will set up a manufacturing plant in Gujarat. A Memorandum of Understandings (MoU) was signed in the presence of Gujarat Chief Minister (CM) Vijay Ramniklal Rupani between state industries Principal Secretary MK Das and Carl Maasbommel, Vice President of PAL-V’s international business development. The Dutch car company sets up the firm for the first time in India and has set a target of commencing production by 2021.

  8. Question 8 of 60
    8. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Nation which has become the 1st co-chair of the governing council of global climate initiative ‘‘Coalition for Disaster Resilient Infrastructure (CDRI)’ led by India.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) United Kingdom
    Explanation:
    The Government of United Kingdom has become the 1st co-chair of the governing council of global climate initiative ‘‘Coalition for Disaster Resilient Infrastructure (CDRI)’ led by India. The initiative was created by the Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi on September 23, 2019 during the UN (United Nations) Climate Summit in New York, US (United States). The secretariat of the Coalition will be in New Delhi.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) United Kingdom
    Explanation:
    The Government of United Kingdom has become the 1st co-chair of the governing council of global climate initiative ‘‘Coalition for Disaster Resilient Infrastructure (CDRI)’ led by India. The initiative was created by the Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi on September 23, 2019 during the UN (United Nations) Climate Summit in New York, US (United States). The secretariat of the Coalition will be in New Delhi.

  9. Question 9 of 60
    9. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Bank has introduced the pre-paid card ‘Enkasu’?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Karur Vysya Bank
    Explanation:
    In a bid to promote digital India initiative of the central Government, Karur Vysya Bank (KVB), a Scheduled Commercial Bank in India, has launched India’s 1st prepaid wallet card ‘Enkasu’ (My cash in Tamil) in Karur, Tamil Nadu (TN) under its Quit cash movement.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Karur Vysya Bank
    Explanation:
    In a bid to promote digital India initiative of the central Government, Karur Vysya Bank (KVB), a Scheduled Commercial Bank in India, has launched India’s 1st prepaid wallet card ‘Enkasu’ (My cash in Tamil) in Karur, Tamil Nadu (TN) under its Quit cash movement.

    Answer – 3) State Bank of India
    Explanation:
    State Bank of India (SBI), an Indian multinational, public sector bank, became the 1st bank to launch COVID 19 emergency credit line (CECL) to provide funds to businesses affected by the infectious coronavirus.

  11. Question 11 of 60
    11. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the 1st company in India which to begin supply of BS-VI fuel across country.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Indian Oil Corporation
    Explanation:
    Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), the nation’s biggest oil firm, began the supply of the world’s cleanest petrol and diesel across the country. All 28,000 petrol stations of IOC’s across the country are dispensing BS-VI (Bharat Stage- VI) ultra-low sulphur grade fuel to reduce the pollution from vehicles in the air.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Indian Oil Corporation
    Explanation:
    Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), the nation’s biggest oil firm, began the supply of the world’s cleanest petrol and diesel across the country. All 28,000 petrol stations of IOC’s across the country are dispensing BS-VI (Bharat Stage- VI) ultra-low sulphur grade fuel to reduce the pollution from vehicles in the air.

  12. Question 12 of 60
    12. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who among the following are winners of Abel Prize 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Both 1) and 2)
    Explanation:
    The Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters named Hillel Furstenber from Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Israel and Gregory Margulis from Yale University, USA as winners of the Abel Prize 2020. They share the prize & the amount of Norwegian Krone (NOK) 7.5 Million (USD 8.3400).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Both 1) and 2)
    Explanation:
    The Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters named Hillel Furstenber from Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Israel and Gregory Margulis from Yale University, USA as winners of the Abel Prize 2020. They share the prize & the amount of Norwegian Krone (NOK) 7.5 Million (USD 8.3400).

    Explanation:

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) V K Paul
    Explanation:
    The government set up a 21-member high-level technical committee of public health experts to guide the people in preventive & control activities of COVID-19. The committee is headed by NITI Aayog member V K Paul.

  14. Question 14 of 60
    14. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is India’s rank in the 26th edition of Economic Freedom Index 2020 released by Heritage Foundation?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) 120
    Explanation:
    The Heritage Foundation published its 26th annual edition of Economic Freedom Index 2020 to measure the level of economic freedom in 186 countries. India (56.5) ranks in 120th position & Singapore (89.4) tops the index for the 1st time.
    Rank Table

    Rank Country
    120 India
    1 Singapore
    2 Hong Kong
    3 New Zealand
    178 Cuba
    179 Venezuela
    180 North Korea
    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) 120
    Explanation:
    The Heritage Foundation published its 26th annual edition of Economic Freedom Index 2020 to measure the level of economic freedom in 186 countries. India (56.5) ranks in 120th position & Singapore (89.4) tops the index for the 1st time.
    Rank Table

    Rank Country
    120 India
    1 Singapore
    2 Hong Kong
    3 New Zealand
    178 Cuba
    179 Venezuela
    180 North Korea

  16. Question 16 of 60
    16. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the medicine which was recommended by National task force for novel coronavirus constituted by ICMR for health care workers who treats COVID-19 patients.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Hydroxychloroquine
    Explanation:
    The National Task Force for the novel coronavirus constituted by Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has recommended the use of hydroxychloroquine for healthcare workers or persons staying with and caring for positive COVID-19 patients. This protocol has been approved by the Drug Controller General of India (DGCI), Dr. V. G. Somani.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Hydroxychloroquine
    Explanation:
    The National Task Force for the novel coronavirus constituted by Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has recommended the use of hydroxychloroquine for healthcare workers or persons staying with and caring for positive COVID-19 patients. This protocol has been approved by the Drug Controller General of India (DGCI), Dr. V. G. Somani.

  17. Question 17 of 60
    17. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the maximum limit of on-lending allowed for NBFCs for ‘term lending’ component under agriculture per borrower as per revised norms of RBI?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) 10 Lakh
    Explanation:
    To boost credit disbursement in the targeted segment like agriculture, Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises (MSME) and housing sector, RBI has extended the priority sector classification for bank loans to Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) for on-lending for Fiscal year 2020-21. As per the revised norms, on-lending by NBFCs for ‘term lending’ component under agriculture will be allowed up to Rs 10 lakh per borrower.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) 10 Lakh
    Explanation:
    To boost credit disbursement in the targeted segment like agriculture, Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises (MSME) and housing sector, RBI has extended the priority sector classification for bank loans to Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) for on-lending for Fiscal year 2020-21. As per the revised norms, on-lending by NBFCs for ‘term lending’ component under agriculture will be allowed up to Rs 10 lakh per borrower.

  18. Question 18 of 60
    18. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Company, which become 1st Indian firm to make diagnostic test kid for COVID-19?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Mylab
    Explanation:
    The National Institute of Virology (NIV) has given its nod to Pune (Maharashtra) based Mylab Discovery Solutions Pvt Ltd to make diagnostic test kits (also known as Mylab PathoDetect COVID-19 Qualitative PCR kit) for novel coronavirus (COVID-19). With this, it becomes the 1st Indian company to develop the first made-in-India test kit for the disease in a period of 6- weeks. Germany-based Altona Diagnostics has also received the approval.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Mylab
    Explanation:
    The National Institute of Virology (NIV) has given its nod to Pune (Maharashtra) based Mylab Discovery Solutions Pvt Ltd to make diagnostic test kits (also known as Mylab PathoDetect COVID-19 Qualitative PCR kit) for novel coronavirus (COVID-19). With this, it becomes the 1st Indian company to develop the first made-in-India test kit for the disease in a period of 6- weeks. Germany-based Altona Diagnostics has also received the approval.

  20. Question 20 of 60
    20. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The World Tuberculosis Day 2020 is Observed annually on March 24. What is the theme for the World TB day 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) It’s Time
    Explanation:
    World Tuberculosis Day is being observed on March 24 globally to raise awareness of Tuberculosis (TB) disease and the efforts made to eliminate the disease. The date marks the day in 1882 when Dr Robert Koch announced that he had discovered the bacterium that causes TB. World TB Day is one of the 8 official global health campaigns marked by the World Health Organization (WHO).
    Theme of the year 2020: ‘It’s Time’.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) It’s Time
    Explanation:
    World Tuberculosis Day is being observed on March 24 globally to raise awareness of Tuberculosis (TB) disease and the efforts made to eliminate the disease. The date marks the day in 1882 when Dr Robert Koch announced that he had discovered the bacterium that causes TB. World TB Day is one of the 8 official global health campaigns marked by the World Health Organization (WHO).
    Theme of the year 2020: ‘It’s Time’.

    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Central government has raised the threshold for invoking insolvency under IBC from 1 lakh to __________.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 1 Crore
    Explanation:
    Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC): The existing threshold of default hiked to Rs1 crore from Rs 1 Lakh under section 4 of the IBC 2016 to protect MSMEs (Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 1 Crore
    Explanation:
    Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC): The existing threshold of default hiked to Rs1 crore from Rs 1 Lakh under section 4 of the IBC 2016 to protect MSMEs (Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises).

The bot is currently available in the US on the CDS website.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Clara
    Explanation:

The bot is currently available in the US on the CDS website.

  27. Question 27 of 60
    27. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the amount that has been approved by the cabinet to enhance the CRAR of RRBs which are unable to maintain minimum CRAR of 9%?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) 1340 Cr
    Explanation:
    In order to enhance the Capital to Risk weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR)of Regional Rural Banks (RRBs), which are unable to maintain minimum CRAR of 9%, as per the regulatory norms prescribed by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) approved Rs1,340-crore to continue the process for their recapitalization for another one year i.e till 2020-2021 from 2019-20.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) 1340 Cr
    Explanation:
    In order to enhance the Capital to Risk weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR)of Regional Rural Banks (RRBs), which are unable to maintain minimum CRAR of 9%, as per the regulatory norms prescribed by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) approved Rs1,340-crore to continue the process for their recapitalization for another one year i.e till 2020-2021 from 2019-20.

    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per 7th Bi-monthly Monetary Policy Statement, 2019-20, What is the current reverse repo rate in India?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 4%
    Explanation:
    Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released the Seventh Bi-monthly Monetary Policy Statement, 2019-20 Resolution of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), RBI under which MPC has decided rate changes with immediate effect due to the current and evolving macroeconomic situation impacted by COVID-19.

    Policy rate New Rate Previous Rate Change in Basis points (bps)
    Policy Repo Rate 4.40 % 5.15% 75
    Reverse Repo Rate 4% 4.90% 90
    Marginal Standing Facility Rate 4.65% 5.40% 75
    Bank Rate 4.65% 5.40% 75
    CRR 3% 4% 100
    SLR 18.25% 18.25% –
    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 4%
    Explanation:
    Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released the Seventh Bi-monthly Monetary Policy Statement, 2019-20 Resolution of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), RBI under which MPC has decided rate changes with immediate effect due to the current and evolving macroeconomic situation impacted by COVID-19.

    Policy rate New Rate Previous Rate Change in Basis points (bps)
    Policy Repo Rate 4.40 % 5.15% 75
    Reverse Repo Rate 4% 4.90% 90
    Marginal Standing Facility Rate 4.65% 5.40% 75
    Bank Rate 4.65% 5.40% 75
    CRR 3% 4% 100
    SLR 18.25% 18.25% –

    Explanation:

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 2.5%
    Explanation:
    Moody’s Global Macro Outlook 2020-21 again slashed India’s Gross Domestic Product (GDP) to 2.5% from 5.3% in 2020 due to rising economic cost of COVID-19 & also due to the lockdown in India.

  35. Question 35 of 60
    35. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian PSU has acquired 74.496 % equity stake in THDC India Ltd & 100% equity in North-Eastern Electric Power Corporation Limited (NEEPCO) in March 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) National Thermal Power Corporation
    Explanation:
    NTPC (formerly known as National Thermal Power Corporation Limited), India’s largest energy conglomerate, has inked a share purchase agreement (SPAs) worth of Rs 11,500 crore with the central government. Under the deal NTPC acquired the latter’s 74.496 % equity stake in THDC India Ltd (THDCIL) for Rs 7,500 crore & its 100% equity in North-Eastern Electric Power Corporation Limited (NEEPCO) for Rs 4,000 crore respectively.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) National Thermal Power Corporation
    Explanation:
    NTPC (formerly known as National Thermal Power Corporation Limited), India’s largest energy conglomerate, has inked a share purchase agreement (SPAs) worth of Rs 11,500 crore with the central government. Under the deal NTPC acquired the latter’s 74.496 % equity stake in THDC India Ltd (THDCIL) for Rs 7,500 crore & its 100% equity in North-Eastern Electric Power Corporation Limited (NEEPCO) for Rs 4,000 crore respectively.

  38. Question 38 of 60
    38. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Country which has joined as the 30th member of North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) in March 2020.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) North Macedonia
    Explanation:
    The Republic of North Macedonia has inducted officially as the 30th and newest member of North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO). This membership comes after North Macedonia’s 2017 deal with Greece under which the former changed its name from Macedonia (a name same as Greek province). After the name change, Greece agreed to drop objections to its NATO and European Union (EU) membership. North Macedonia was granted a protocol on accession to NATO membership in February 2019.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) North Macedonia
    Explanation:
    The Republic of North Macedonia has inducted officially as the 30th and newest member of North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO). This membership comes after North Macedonia’s 2017 deal with Greece under which the former changed its name from Macedonia (a name same as Greek province). After the name change, Greece agreed to drop objections to its NATO and European Union (EU) membership. North Macedonia was granted a protocol on accession to NATO membership in February 2019.

  40. Question 40 of 60
    40. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the amount that was infused into banking system to maintain stability in financial system during COVID-19 Crisis as declared by RBI?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 3.74 lakh crore
    Explanation:
    Reserve Bank of India (RBI) declared an infusion of Rs 3.74 lakh crore into the banking system through three measures viz. targeted long-term repo operation (TLTRO), Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) and marginal standing facility (MSF). The decision has been taken to tackle financial system stress raised due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 3.74 lakh crore
    Explanation:
    Reserve Bank of India (RBI) declared an infusion of Rs 3.74 lakh crore into the banking system through three measures viz. targeted long-term repo operation (TLTRO), Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) and marginal standing facility (MSF). The decision has been taken to tackle financial system stress raised due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

  41. Question 41 of 60
    41. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Bank which is partner bank of PM-CARES, emergency fund that was announced by PM Modi to fight against Coronavirus.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) State Bank of India
    Explanation:
    Prime Minister Narendra Modi has created of assistance and emergency situation relief fund namely Prime Minister’s Citizen Assistance and Relief in Emergency Situations Fund (PM-CARES)where people can contribute and help in the government’s fight against coronavirus.This newly created public charitable trust has PM Narendra Modi as the chairmanand defence minister (Rajnath Singh), home minister (Amit Shah) and the finance minister (Nirmala Sitaraman) as its members. People can visit pmindia.gov.in to make contributions using credit and debit cards, UPI, net banking and RTGS or NEFT. State Bank of India (SBI) is the banking partner of PM-CARES.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) State Bank of India
    Explanation:
    Prime Minister Narendra Modi has created of assistance and emergency situation relief fund namely Prime Minister’s Citizen Assistance and Relief in Emergency Situations Fund (PM-CARES)where people can contribute and help in the government’s fight against coronavirus.This newly created public charitable trust has PM Narendra Modi as the chairmanand defence minister (Rajnath Singh), home minister (Amit Shah) and the finance minister (Nirmala Sitaraman) as its members. People can visit pmindia.gov.in to make contributions using credit and debit cards, UPI, net banking and RTGS or NEFT. State Bank of India (SBI) is the banking partner of PM-CARES.

  43. Question 43 of 60
    43. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The merger of 10 PSBs into 4 PSBs come into force from April 1, 2020. As per the scheme syndicate bank will be merger with which bank?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Canara Bank
    Explanation:
    The mega bank consolidation plan is all set to come into force from April 1, 2020.  The branches of merging banks will operate as of the banks in which these have been amalgamated. Also, the customers of merging banks will be treated as customers of the banks in which these banks have been merged with effect from April 1, 2020. As per the scheme, Oriental Bank of Commerce and United Bank of India will be merged into Punjab National Bank; Syndicate Bank into Canara Bank; Allahabad Bank into Indian Bank; and Andhra Bank and Corporation Bank into Union Bank of India.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Canara Bank
    Explanation:
    The mega bank consolidation plan is all set to come into force from April 1, 2020.  The branches of merging banks will operate as of the banks in which these have been amalgamated. Also, the customers of merging banks will be treated as customers of the banks in which these banks have been merged with effect from April 1, 2020. As per the scheme, Oriental Bank of Commerce and United Bank of India will be merged into Punjab National Bank; Syndicate Bank into Canara Bank; Allahabad Bank into Indian Bank; and Andhra Bank and Corporation Bank into Union Bank of India.

Prize was founded in 2010 to honor writers who have spent the rest of their lives mining the human spirit with their words & ideas.

    Answer – 5) Both 1) and 3)
    Explanation:
    The winners of The Hindu Prize 2019 Fiction and Non-Fiction are Mirza Waheed (Tell Her Everything – Fiction) and Santanu Das (India, Empire, and First World War Culture: Writings, Images and Songs – Non-Fiction) respectively. Prize was founded in 2010 to honor writers who have spent the rest of their lives mining the human spirit with their words & ideas.

  49. Question 49 of 60
    49. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    What is the minimum capital to risk weighted assets (CRAR) that should be maintained in Regional Rural Banks (RRBs)?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 9%
    Explanation:
    As per RBI, RRBs are required to maintain a minimum Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) of 9 per cent on an ongoing basis. The capital funds for capital adequacy purpose shall consist of both Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 9%
    Explanation:
    As per RBI, RRBs are required to maintain a minimum Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) of 9 per cent on an ongoing basis. The capital funds for capital adequacy purpose shall consist of both Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital.

  50. Question 50 of 60
    50. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    What is the current deadline for completion of insolvency resolution processes as per IBBI’s (Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India) amendment?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 330 days
    Explanation:
    IBBI has relaxed the timelines to be followed under the overall 330-day deadline for completion of insolvency resolution processes.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 330 days
    Explanation:
    IBBI has relaxed the timelines to be followed under the overall 330-day deadline for completion of insolvency resolution processes.

  51. Question 51 of 60
    51. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    As per the ‘World Population Prospects 2019’ report, what is India’s population by Mid-2019?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) 136 Crore
    Explanation:
    As per the ‘World Population Prospects 2019’ report, what is India’s population will be
    1.36 Billion (136 crore) by Mid-2019.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) 136 Crore
    Explanation:
    As per the ‘World Population Prospects 2019’ report, what is India’s population will be
    1.36 Billion (136 crore) by Mid-2019.

https://affairscloud.com/march-current-affairs-2020-weekly-test-3/

---
  1. Question 1 of 50
    1. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per the Government of India’s data, the amount spent under Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, (MNREGA) in 2017-2020 is/are Rs. _______.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) 1.83 Lakh Crore
    Explanation:
    The Government of India states that Rs 1.83 lakh crore is spent under Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, (MNREGA) in 2017-2020 which is nearly double the amount of Rs 92,483 crore spent in 2011-14. As on 9th March 2020, 526.97 lakh families have been provided employment, against 603.81 lakh families seeking employment under the scheme.
    MNREGA – enacted on August 25, 2005. It provides legal guarantee of 100 days of employment in every financial year.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) 1.83 Lakh Crore
    Explanation:
    The Government of India states that Rs 1.83 lakh crore is spent under Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, (MNREGA) in 2017-2020 which is nearly double the amount of Rs 92,483 crore spent in 2011-14. As on 9th March 2020, 526.97 lakh families have been provided employment, against 603.81 lakh families seeking employment under the scheme.
    MNREGA – enacted on August 25, 2005. It provides legal guarantee of 100 days of employment in every financial year.

  2. Question 2 of 50
    2. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Cabinet has approved the “Yes Bank Ltd. Reconstruction Scheme, 2020” proposed by RBI for yes bank, which among the following bank will lead the proposed bank?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) State Bank of India
    Explanation:
    The Cabinet approved the reconstruction scheme proposed by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) titled “Yes Bank Ltd. Reconstruction Scheme, 2020” for Yes Bank that will be led by State Bank of India (will hold 45% of stake). Other participants in the plan include HDFC Ltd & ICICI (will hold 6% of stake each), Axis Bank (3-4% of stake), Kotak Mahindra Bank, RK Damani, Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and the Azim Premji Trust (around 3% each).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) State Bank of India
    Explanation:
    The Cabinet approved the reconstruction scheme proposed by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) titled “Yes Bank Ltd. Reconstruction Scheme, 2020” for Yes Bank that will be led by State Bank of India (will hold 45% of stake). Other participants in the plan include HDFC Ltd & ICICI (will hold 6% of stake each), Axis Bank (3-4% of stake), Kotak Mahindra Bank, RK Damani, Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and the Azim Premji Trust (around 3% each).

  3. Question 3 of 50
    3. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person who has been appointed as the MD&CEO of Yes Bank (March 2020).

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Prashant Kumar
    Explanation:
    Government appointed former Chief Financial Officer & deputy Managing Director(MD) of SBI Prashant Kumar as MD & Chief Financial Officer(CEO), the former Punjab National Bank(PNB) MD Sunil Mehta as Non-Executive Chairman, Mahesh Krishnamurthy & Atul Bheda as non-executive directors of the reconstructed board of Yes Bank. State Bank of India (SBI), which has a 49 % stake in Yes Bank, will nominate 2 directors & Reserve Bank could appoint one or more additional directors. The moratorium on Yes Bank to be lifted by March 18 which means depositors will be able to withdraw an amount without a cap.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Prashant Kumar
    Explanation:
    Government appointed former Chief Financial Officer & deputy Managing Director(MD) of SBI Prashant Kumar as MD & Chief Financial Officer(CEO), the former Punjab National Bank(PNB) MD Sunil Mehta as Non-Executive Chairman, Mahesh Krishnamurthy & Atul Bheda as non-executive directors of the reconstructed board of Yes Bank. State Bank of India (SBI), which has a 49 % stake in Yes Bank, will nominate 2 directors & Reserve Bank could appoint one or more additional directors. The moratorium on Yes Bank to be lifted by March 18 which means depositors will be able to withdraw an amount without a cap.

  4. Question 4 of 50
    4. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    WINGS INDIA 2020 an international exhibition and conference based on the theme “Flying for all’, held at which Indian city?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Hyderabad
    Explanation:
    A 4 day (March 12-15) biennial event WINGS INDIA 2020 themed as ‘Flying for All’ is an International Exhibition & Conference on Civil Aviation sector held at Begumpet Airport, Hyderabad, is organized by Ministry of Civil Aviation & Airports Authority of India(AAI) & Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Hyderabad
    Explanation:
    A 4 day (March 12-15) biennial event WINGS INDIA 2020 themed as ‘Flying for All’ is an International Exhibition & Conference on Civil Aviation sector held at Begumpet Airport, Hyderabad, is organized by Ministry of Civil Aviation & Airports Authority of India(AAI) & Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI).

  5. Question 5 of 50
    5. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The RBI has revised the exposure limit for Urban Cooperative Banks (UCBs) of Tier-I capital to a group of borrowers from 40% to _____%.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) 25
    Explanation:
    The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has revised exposure limits for urban cooperative banks (UCBs) of tier-1 capital to a single borrower to 15% and a group of borrowers to 25%. The revised exposure limits shall be applicable to all types of fresh exposures taken by UCBs. The RBI had earlier permitted UCBs to have exposures up to 15% and 40% of their capital funds to a single borrower and a group of borrowers, respectively.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) 25
    Explanation:
    The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has revised exposure limits for urban cooperative banks (UCBs) of tier-1 capital to a single borrower to 15% and a group of borrowers to 25%. The revised exposure limits shall be applicable to all types of fresh exposures taken by UCBs. The RBI had earlier permitted UCBs to have exposures up to 15% and 40% of their capital funds to a single borrower and a group of borrowers, respectively.

  6. Question 6 of 50
    6. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person who has been appointed as the officiating Chairperson of National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) in March 2020.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Bansi Lal Bhat
    Explanation:
    According to the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, Government of India (GoI), Justice (Retd.) Bansi Lal Bhat has been appointed as the officiating Chairperson of the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) for a period of 3 months with effect from March 15, 2020 or until a regular Chairperson is appointed, whichever is earlier. The first Chairperson of NCLAT, Justice SJ Mukhopadhaya has retired on March 13,2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Bansi Lal Bhat
    Explanation:
    According to the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, Government of India (GoI), Justice (Retd.) Bansi Lal Bhat has been appointed as the officiating Chairperson of the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) for a period of 3 months with effect from March 15, 2020 or until a regular Chairperson is appointed, whichever is earlier. The first Chairperson of NCLAT, Justice SJ Mukhopadhaya has retired on March 13,2020.

  7. Question 7 of 50
    7. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The RBI has increased the overall Priority Sector Lending (PSL) target for Urban Cooperative Banks (UCBs) from 40% of Adjusted Net Bank Credit (ANBC) to ___% of ANBC.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 75
    Explanation:
    RBI has revised the priority sector lending (PSL) target for UCBs from 40% to 75% of the adjusted net bank credit (ANBC), or credit equivalent amount of off-balance sheet exposure (CEOBSE). These norms will also have to be fulfilled by 31 March 2024.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 75
    Explanation:
    RBI has revised the priority sector lending (PSL) target for UCBs from 40% to 75% of the adjusted net bank credit (ANBC), or credit equivalent amount of off-balance sheet exposure (CEOBSE). These norms will also have to be fulfilled by 31 March 2024.

  8. Question 8 of 50
    8. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    PM Modi has proposed the creation of COVID-19 Emergency fund in SAARC region during video conference meet of SAARC representatives. Also, India has offered _____ (USD) for the fund.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) 10 million
    Explanation:
    PM Modi has proposed the creation of COVID-19 Emergency Fund through voluntary contributions from all SAARC Nations. This fund can be used by any of the partner countries to meet the cost of immediate actions. India has offered the US $10 million for the fund.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) 10 million
    Explanation:
    PM Modi has proposed the creation of COVID-19 Emergency Fund through voluntary contributions from all SAARC Nations. This fund can be used by any of the partner countries to meet the cost of immediate actions. India has offered the US $10 million for the fund.

  10. Question 10 of 50
    10. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian Table Tennis player who has won singles title in ITTF (International Table Tennis Federation) Challenger Plus Oman Open 2020.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Sharath Kamal
    Explanation:
    Achanta Sharath Kamal (37), a professional table tennis player from Tamil Nadu (TN) has ended the title wait of a decade by winning the ITTF (International Table Tennis Federation) Challenger Plus Oman Open 2020 men’s singles title by defeating Portugal’s top seed Marcos Freitas with 4-2 scores in the final played at Sultan Qaboos Sports Complex in Muscat, Oman.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Sharath Kamal
    Explanation:
    Achanta Sharath Kamal (37), a professional table tennis player from Tamil Nadu (TN) has ended the title wait of a decade by winning the ITTF (International Table Tennis Federation) Challenger Plus Oman Open 2020 men’s singles title by defeating Portugal’s top seed Marcos Freitas with 4-2 scores in the final played at Sultan Qaboos Sports Complex in Muscat, Oman.

  11. Question 11 of 50
    11. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    the person who has won the men’s singles title in the 112th edition of All England Open 2020 (March 2020) badminton tournament.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Viktor Axelsen
    Explanation:
    2020 All England Open (officially known as the Yonex All England Open Badminton Championships 2020), was the 112th edition of oldest badminton tournament organized jointly by Badminton England & Badminton World Federation (BWF), held at Arena Birmingham in Birmingham, England from March 11 -15, 2020. Viktor Axelsen became the 1st Denmark player to win the All England title for 21 years.
    List of Winners:

    Event Winners Runners
    Men’s Singles Viktor Axelsen (Denmark) Chou Tien-chen (Chinese Taipei)
    Women’s Singles Tai Tzu Ying (Chinese Taipei) Chen Yufei (China)
    Men’s Doubles Hiroyuki Endo (Japan)
    Yuta Watanabe (Japan)    		 Marcus Fernaldi Gideon (Indonesia)
    Kevin Sanjaya Sukamuljo (Indonesia)
    Women’s Doubles Yuki Fukushima(Japan)
    Sayaka Hirota (Japan)    		 Du Yue (China)
    Li Yinhui (China)
    Mixed Doubles Praveen Jordan (Indonesia)
    Melati Daeva Oktavianti (Indonesia)    		 Dechapol Puavaranukroh (Thailand)
    Sapsiree Taerattanachai (Thailand)
    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Viktor Axelsen
    Explanation:
    2020 All England Open (officially known as the Yonex All England Open Badminton Championships 2020), was the 112th edition of oldest badminton tournament organized jointly by Badminton England & Badminton World Federation (BWF), held at Arena Birmingham in Birmingham, England from March 11 -15, 2020. Viktor Axelsen became the 1st Denmark player to win the All England title for 21 years.
    List of Winners:

    Event Winners Runners
    Men’s Singles Viktor Axelsen (Denmark) Chou Tien-chen (Chinese Taipei)
    Women’s Singles Tai Tzu Ying (Chinese Taipei) Chen Yufei (China)
    Men’s Doubles Hiroyuki Endo (Japan)
    Yuta Watanabe (Japan)    		 Marcus Fernaldi Gideon (Indonesia)

    13. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    percentage of road accident deaths in India has decreased within five months of the enactment of the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act 2019?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) 10%
    Explanation:
    The Minister of Road Transport & Highways and Shipping Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Nitin Gadkari revealed that the number of deaths caused due to road accidents has been reduced by 10% in India after the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act 2019.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) 10%
    Explanation:
    The Minister of Road Transport & Highways and Shipping Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Nitin Gadkari revealed that the number of deaths caused due to road accidents has been reduced by 10% in India after the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act 2019.

  14. Question 14 of 50
    14. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Along with which software company, NASSCOM Foundation has launched the ‘Innovative for accessible Indian campaign’ aimed to empower people with disabilities.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Microsoft India
    Explanation:
    Microsoft India Private Limited, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corporation & NASSCOM Foundation, the social arm of NASSCOM (National Association of Software and Service Companies), have jointly launched the ‘Innovate for Accessible India campaign’, a nation-wide innovation challenge aimed at empowering people with disabilities with the new technologies required for better integration into society and access to equal opportunities.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Microsoft India
    Explanation:
    Microsoft India Private Limited, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corporation & NASSCOM Foundation, the social arm of NASSCOM (National Association of Software and Service Companies), have jointly launched the ‘Innovate for Accessible India campaign’, a nation-wide innovation challenge aimed at empowering people with disabilities with the new technologies required for better integration into society and access to equal opportunities.

  15. Question 15 of 50
    15. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had attended the 100th Birth anniversary of Bangabandu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman. Mujibur Rahman was the founding father of _______________ country?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Bangladesh
    Explanation:
    Prime Minister Narendra Modi has taken part in the 100th birth anniversary celebrations of Bangladesh’s founding father Sheikh Mujibur Rahman through video conferencing. Rahman, who is the first President of Bangladesh, was born on March 17, 1920, in Tungipara village in Faridpur district and also referred to as ‘Jatir Pita’.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Bangladesh
    Explanation:
    Prime Minister Narendra Modi has taken part in the 100th birth anniversary celebrations of Bangladesh’s founding father Sheikh Mujibur Rahman through video conferencing. Rahman, who is the first President of Bangladesh, was born on March 17, 1920, in Tungipara village in Faridpur district and also referred to as ‘Jatir Pita’.

    18. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Central government has included Konark Sun temple & Statue of Unity in iconic tourism sites list. Where does Konark Sun temple & Statue of Unity located at?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Odisha, Gujarat
    Explanation:
    According to the Union Minister of State (Independent) for tourism and culture, Prahlad Singh Patel, the central government has included grand Konark Sun Temple, the UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) world heritage site in Odisha & Statue of Unity in Gujarat in the Iconic Tourist Sites list, taking the total number of such places from 17 to 19.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Odisha, Gujarat
    Explanation:
    According to the Union Minister of State (Independent) for tourism and culture, Prahlad Singh Patel, the central government has included grand Konark Sun Temple, the UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) world heritage site in Odisha & Statue of Unity in Gujarat in the Iconic Tourist Sites list, taking the total number of such places from 17 to 19.

  20. Question 20 of 50
    20. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the 1st country in the world which shuts the Financial market due to COVID-19 outbreak.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Philippines
    Explanation:
    Philippines become the first country to close its financial markets due to the COVID 19 (Coronavirus) outbreak. It resumed its trading on March 19, 2020.  This measure was taken to ensure the safety of their employees and the people they interact with.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Philippines
    Explanation:
    Philippines become the first country to close its financial markets due to the COVID 19 (Coronavirus) outbreak. It resumed its trading on March 19, 2020.  This measure was taken to ensure the safety of their employees and the people they interact with.

  21. Question 21 of 50
    21. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per RBI’s new guidelines for Payment Aggregators (PAs), what is the minimum net worth required for entities to be set up as PAs (earlier it was 100 crore)?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) 15 Crore
    Explanation:
    Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has issued new guidelines for the payment aggregators (PAs) to provide an ease for payments industry players with effect from April 1, 2020. The guidelines are issued under Section 18 read with Section 10(2) of the Payment and Settlement Systems Act, 2007. RBI has reduced the minimum capital requirements (MCR) for PAs at the time of application for the licence to Rs 15 crore from Rs 100 crore. However, the net worth needs to be increased to Rs 25 crore within three years of operations. Means the PAs who apply for authorisation on 01/04/2020 they need to achieve Rs 25 cr net-worth by March 31, 2023, and thereafter.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) 15 Crore
    Explanation:
    Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has issued new guidelines for the payment aggregators (PAs) to provide an ease for payments industry players with effect from April 1, 2020. The guidelines are issued under Section 18 read with Section 10(2) of the Payment and Settlement Systems Act, 2007. RBI has reduced the minimum capital requirements (MCR) for PAs at the time of application for the licence to Rs 15 crore from Rs 100 crore. However, the net worth needs to be increased to Rs 25 crore within three years of operations. Means the PAs who apply for authorisation on 01/04/2020 they need to achieve Rs 25 cr net-worth by March 31, 2023, and thereafter.

  22. Question 22 of 50
    22. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The RBI has opened a six-month dollar-swap window infusion of Rs. ________ through LTRO (March 2020).

    Correct

    Answer – 1) 1,00,000 Crore
    Explanation:
    Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has opened a six-month dollar sell-buy swap window and will also inject Rs 1,00,000 crore additional Long-Term Repo Operations (LTROs) at the policy repo rate. These measures taken by RBI are to boost liquidity in the foreign exchange market of India and will serve the requirement of U.S. dollars in the market.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) 1,00,000 Crore
    Explanation:
    Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has opened a six-month dollar sell-buy swap window and will also inject Rs 1,00,000 crore additional Long-Term Repo Operations (LTROs) at the policy repo rate. These measures taken by RBI are to boost liquidity in the foreign exchange market of India and will serve the requirement of U.S. dollars in the market.

  23. Question 23 of 50
    23. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian Institute signed MoU with L&T technology services for research in cybersecurity programs (March 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) IIT Kanpur
    Explanation:
    In March 2020, L&T Technology Services (LTTS) signed a multi-year Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur (IIT-Kanpur) to collaborate on research industrial and infrastructure cybersecurity.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) IIT Kanpur
    Explanation:
    In March 2020, L&T Technology Services (LTTS) signed a multi-year Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur (IIT-Kanpur) to collaborate on research industrial and infrastructure cybersecurity.

  24. Question 24 of 50
    24. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Adnan al-Zurfi has been appointed as the Prime Minister of which of the following country?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Iraq
    Explanation:
    On March 17, 2020, Barham Salih, President of Iraq appoints 54- year- old Adnan al-Zurfi as Prime Minister (PM) of Iraq who has 30 days to form his cabinet in an attempt to resolve a months-long political crisis. He will succeed Mohammed Allawi, the 1st politician named by the president as PM-designate who withdrew his candidacy for the post.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Iraq
    Explanation:
    On March 17, 2020, Barham Salih, President of Iraq appoints 54- year- old Adnan al-Zurfi as Prime Minister (PM) of Iraq who has 30 days to form his cabinet in an attempt to resolve a months-long political crisis. He will succeed Mohammed Allawi, the 1st politician named by the president as PM-designate who withdrew his candidacy for the post.

  25. Question 25 of 50
    25. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The World Cities summit is going to be held at which among the following cities in the month of July (5-9), 2020.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Singapore
    Explanation:
    The 7th World Cities Summit (WCS) is to be held from July 5 to 9, 2020 at Sands Expo & Convention Centre, Marina Bay Sands, in Singapore. It is organized by Singapore’s Centre for Liveable Cities and the Urban Redevelopment Authority.  The theme for WCS 2020 is” Liveable and Sustainable Cities: Adapting to a Disrupted World”.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Singapore
    Explanation:
    The 7th World Cities Summit (WCS) is to be held from July 5 to 9, 2020 at Sands Expo & Convention Centre, Marina Bay Sands, in Singapore. It is organized by Singapore’s Centre for Liveable Cities and the Urban Redevelopment Authority.  The theme for WCS 2020 is” Liveable and Sustainable Cities: Adapting to a Disrupted World”.

  26. Question 26 of 50
    26. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The scientist of which university developed starch-based ‘hemostat’ material to stop rapid blood loss during accidents?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Institute of Nano Science and Technology
    Explanation:
    Scientists from the Institute of Nano Science and Technology (INST), an autonomous institute under the Department of Science & Technology, developed a starch-based ‘hemostat’ material which absorbs excess fluid by concentrating the natural clotting factors in the blood that stops the rapid blood loss.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Institute of Nano Science and Technology
    Explanation:
    Scientists from the Institute of Nano Science and Technology (INST), an autonomous institute under the Department of Science & Technology, developed a starch-based ‘hemostat’ material which absorbs excess fluid by concentrating the natural clotting factors in the blood that stops the rapid blood loss.

    28. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Find the messaging app which launched Coronavirus information hub in partnership with WHO-UNICEF-UNDP and donated $1million to International Fast-Checking Network (IFCN) to avoid fake information about the disease.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Whatsapp
    Explanation:
    Facebook-owned messaging app WhatsApp launched the “WhatsApp Coronavirus Information Hub” globally, in partnership with WHO (World Health Organization), UNICEF (United Nations Children’s Fund) and UNDP (United Nations Development Programme). WhatsApp also donated $1 million dollars to Poynter Institute’s International Fast-Checking Network (IFCN) in order to avoid fake information about the disease.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Whatsapp
    Explanation:
    Facebook-owned messaging app WhatsApp launched the “WhatsApp Coronavirus Information Hub” globally, in partnership with WHO (World Health Organization), UNICEF (United Nations Children’s Fund) and UNDP (United Nations Development Programme). WhatsApp also donated $1 million dollars to Poynter Institute’s International Fast-Checking Network (IFCN) in order to avoid fake information about the disease.

  29. Question 29 of 50
    29. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the private sector bank which entered into partnership with Bharati AXA insurance company to roll out insurance plan covering covid-19.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) DBS Bank India
    Explanation:
    DBS Bank India Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of DBS (Development Bank of Singapore) Bank Ltd, has entered into the partnership with Bharti AXA General Insurance Company Ltd to launch a complimentary insurance for customers of DBS treasures. The plan covers all medical conditions including Novel Coronavirus (Covid-19), under which a cover of Rs 5000 per day is available for a period of 30 days if DBS customers are hospitalized for 10 days.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) DBS Bank India
    Explanation:
    DBS Bank India Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of DBS (Development Bank of Singapore) Bank Ltd, has entered into the partnership with Bharti AXA General Insurance Company Ltd to launch a complimentary insurance for customers of DBS treasures. The plan covers all medical conditions including Novel Coronavirus (Covid-19), under which a cover of Rs 5000 per day is available for a period of 30 days if DBS customers are hospitalized for 10 days.

  30. Question 30 of 50
    30. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    How much amount the RBI is going to infuse through Open Market Operation (OMO) to maintain liquidity in banking system (on March 20, 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 10,000 Crores
    Explanation:
    The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is all set to infuse ₹10,000 crore liquidity in the banking system by buying government securities through open market operations (OMO) on March 20, 2020. The securities will be purchased through a multi-security auction using the multiple price method with tenor between two and five years. RBI will offer to buy four set of sovereign papers maturing between February 2022 and May 2025.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 10,000 Crores
    Explanation:
    The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is all set to infuse ₹10,000 crore liquidity in the banking system by buying government securities through open market operations (OMO) on March 20, 2020. The securities will be purchased through a multi-security auction using the multiple price method with tenor between two and five years. RBI will offer to buy four set of sovereign papers maturing between February 2022 and May 2025.

  31. Question 31 of 50
    31. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who among the following Indian Umpires (Women) are being part of International panel of ICC Development panel?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) All the 1), 2) and 3)
    Explanation:
    Janani Narayanan from Tamil Nadu (TN) and Vrinda Rathi from Mumbai were named in the International Panel of ICC (International Cricket Council) Development Umpires. After the inclusion of Janani and Vrinda, the count of females from India in ICC panel becomes 3 after the appointment of GS Lakshmi as the International Panel of Match Referees. The women officials across the ICC panel consists of 12 members.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) All the 1), 2) and 3)
    Explanation:
    Janani Narayanan from Tamil Nadu (TN) and Vrinda Rathi from Mumbai were named in the International Panel of ICC (International Cricket Council) Development Umpires. After the inclusion of Janani and Vrinda, the count of females from India in ICC panel becomes 3 after the appointment of GS Lakshmi as the International Panel of Match Referees. The women officials across the ICC panel consists of 12 members.
