    Explanation:
    The Defence Acquisition Council (DAC) under the chairmanship of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has approved the procurement of 83 Tejas Mark-1A jets from HAL for the Indian Air Force (IAF), marking a boost to the government’s flagship “Make in India” programme. The proposal will now be sent for consideration of Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Hindustan Aeronautics Limited
    Explanation:
    The Defence Acquisition Council (DAC) under the chairmanship of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has approved the procurement of 83 Tejas Mark-1A jets from HAL for the Indian Air Force (IAF), marking a boost to the government’s flagship “Make in India” programme. The proposal will now be sent for consideration of Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS).

  35. Question 35 of 50
    35. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Find the non-life insurance company which introduced 1-yr long ‘COVID-19 Protection cover’ for COVID positive cases for the age group of 18-75yrs.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) ICICI Lombard
    Explanation:
    ICICI (Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India) Lombard, a private sector non-life insurance company has introduced a 1 year long “COVID-19 Protection Cover” at a premium of Rs. 149. Launched in group insurance mode, this policy will pay 100% of the sum insured to the COVID-19 positive individual, irrespective of hospitalization expenses. The age group of 18-75 years is eligible for COVID-19 protection cover.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) ICICI Lombard
    Explanation:
    ICICI (Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India) Lombard, a private sector non-life insurance company has introduced a 1 year long “COVID-19 Protection Cover” at a premium of Rs. 149. Launched in group insurance mode, this policy will pay 100% of the sum insured to the COVID-19 positive individual, irrespective of hospitalization expenses. The age group of 18-75 years is eligible for COVID-19 protection cover.

  36. Question 36 of 50
    36. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the 1st Indian who climbs highest Volcanoes of all the 7 continents and entered into ‘Limca Book of Records’.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Satyarup Siddhanta
    Explanation:
    Indian mountaineer Satyarup Siddhanta hails from Kolkata, West Bengal, 37 years old, entered ‘Limca Book of Records’ (LBR) for his extraordinary achievements, as the first Indian to climb the highest volcanoes of each of the 7 continents. He also holds the record as the youngest mountaineer in the world to climb both 7 peaks and 7 volcanic summits.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Satyarup Siddhanta
    Explanation:
    Indian mountaineer Satyarup Siddhanta hails from Kolkata, West Bengal, 37 years old, entered ‘Limca Book of Records’ (LBR) for his extraordinary achievements, as the first Indian to climb the highest volcanoes of each of the 7 continents. He also holds the record as the youngest mountaineer in the world to climb both 7 peaks and 7 volcanic summits.

  37. Question 37 of 50
    37. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The PM Modi has declared the formulation of COVID-19 Economic task force to tackle economic challenges arise during COVID-19 outbreak. Who heads the task force?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Nirmala Sitharaman
    Explanation:
    Prime Minister Narendra Modi has declared the formulation of COVID-19 Economic Response Task Force, to be led by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. Its objective is to tackle the economic challenges arising out of novel coronavirus outbreak. In this regard, Sitharaman held a meeting with the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Minister Nitin Gadkari, Animal Husbandry Minister Giriraj Singh, Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri and Tourism Minister Prahlad Singh Patel to assess the situation.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Nirmala Sitharaman
    Explanation:
    Prime Minister Narendra Modi has declared the formulation of COVID-19 Economic Response Task Force, to be led by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. Its objective is to tackle the economic challenges arising out of novel coronavirus outbreak. In this regard, Sitharaman held a meeting with the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Minister Nitin Gadkari, Animal Husbandry Minister Giriraj Singh, Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri and Tourism Minister Prahlad Singh Patel to assess the situation.

  40. Question 40 of 50
    40. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Theme for World sparrow day is ‘I LOVE Sparrows’, The World Sparrow day is celebrated annually on?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) March 20
    Explanation:
    World Sparrow Day (2020) is observed every year on March 20 and was first celebrated in 2010 initiated by the Nature Forever Society (NFS). This day is celebrated globally to spread awareness about the importance of sparrows and their major functional conservation values. The theme of the World Sparrow Day is I LOVE Sparrows. The theme aims to highlight the love that people have for sparrows. This day is also celebrated to use it as a platform for conserving sparrows and urban biodiversity. House sparrow was declared the state bird of Delhi in 2012.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) March 20
    Explanation:
    World Sparrow Day (2020) is observed every year on March 20 and was first celebrated in 2010 initiated by the Nature Forever Society (NFS). This day is celebrated globally to spread awareness about the importance of sparrows and their major functional conservation values. The theme of the World Sparrow Day is I LOVE Sparrows. The theme aims to highlight the love that people have for sparrows. This day is also celebrated to use it as a platform for conserving sparrows and urban biodiversity. House sparrow was declared the state bird of Delhi in 2012.

    Answer – 2) Uttarakhand
    Explanation:
    Uttarakhand Chief Minister (CM) Trivendra Singh Rawat celebrated the traditional harvest festival “Phool Dei”. The festival also showcases the inner bonding between the communities who all are residing in the hills.

  50. Question 50 of 50
    50. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Military Exercise African Lion is conducted between?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) United States & Morocco
    Explanation:
    As per the reports, the 2020 US-Morocco joint military exercises “African Lion” will see parts of the training operations taking place in Senegal, Tunisia, and Spain. African Lion is scheduled from March 23 to April 3 for the year 2020 but now the US Africa Command (AFRICOM) have decided to postpone the exercise due to COVID-19 pandemic.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) United States & Morocco
    Explanation:
    As per the reports, the 2020 US-Morocco joint military exercises “African Lion” will see parts of the training operations taking place in Senegal, Tunisia, and Spain. African Lion is scheduled from March 23 to April 3 for the year 2020 but now the US Africa Command (AFRICOM) have decided to postpone the exercise due to COVID-19 pandemic.

  1. Question 1 of 50
    1. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the e-Commerce company, which signed MoU with Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana- National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY- NULM) for e-Marketing of products made by Self Help Groups across the Country.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Amazon
    Explanation:
    Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana- National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY- NULM) functions under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs(MoHUA) signed MoU (Memorandum of Understandings) with Amazon for electronic marketing (e-Marketing) of products made by Self Help Groups (SHGs) across the Country.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Amazon
    Explanation:
    Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana- National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY- NULM) functions under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs(MoHUA) signed MoU (Memorandum of Understandings) with Amazon for electronic marketing (e-Marketing) of products made by Self Help Groups (SHGs) across the Country.

  2. Question 2 of 50
    2. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Under which scheme the Inter Ministerial Approval Committee (IMAC) headed by Harsimrat Kaur Badal approved 8 projects worth Rs 230 Crores in TamilNadu.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Pradhan Mantri Kisan Sampada Yojana (PMKSY)
    Explanation:
    The Inter-Ministerial Approval Committee (IMAC) meeting which was held under the chairmanship of Union Food Processing Industries Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal, sanctioned 10 projects worth Rs 301.54 crore. The projects are sanctioned under the ‘Agro Processing Cluster Scheme’ of Pradhan Mantri Kisan Sampada Yojana (PMKSY) of the Ministry of Food Processing Industries (MoFPI) – Under this scheme IMAC approved 8 projects of Rs 230 Crore for 8 districts in TamilNadu.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Pradhan Mantri Kisan Sampada Yojana (PMKSY)
    Explanation:
    The Inter-Ministerial Approval Committee (IMAC) meeting which was held under the chairmanship of Union Food Processing Industries Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal, sanctioned 10 projects worth Rs 301.54 crore. The projects are sanctioned under the ‘Agro Processing Cluster Scheme’ of Pradhan Mantri Kisan Sampada Yojana (PMKSY) of the Ministry of Food Processing Industries (MoFPI) – Under this scheme IMAC approved 8 projects of Rs 230 Crore for 8 districts in TamilNadu.

  3. Question 3 of 50
    3. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Life Insurance company, which is going to provide football coaching to the under-privileged girls under ‘Bachhpan Ka Rakshakaran’ programme in association with ‘Oscar Foundation’.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) TATA AIA Life Insurance
    Explanation:
    In order to create interest in education for the under-privileged girls aged 12-16 years, by using football coaching as a medium, Tata AIA Life Insurance, a joint venture company formed by Tata Sons Ltd and AIA Group Ltd(AIA), has launched a ‘Bachhpan Ka Rakshakaran’ program in association with Mumbai based Non-profit ‘Oscar Foundation’.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) TATA AIA Life Insurance
    Explanation:
    In order to create interest in education for the under-privileged girls aged 12-16 years, by using football coaching as a medium, Tata AIA Life Insurance, a joint venture company formed by Tata Sons Ltd and AIA Group Ltd(AIA), has launched a ‘Bachhpan Ka Rakshakaran’ program in association with Mumbai based Non-profit ‘Oscar Foundation’.

  5. Question 5 of 50
    5. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per “Wealth Report 2020” released by Knight Frank LLP, what is India’s rank based on number UHNWIs (Ultra high net worth individuals – people who have a net worth of $30Mn or above).

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 12
    Explanation:
    India, according to Knight Frank’s ‘Wealth Report 2020’, ranks 12th and had 5,986 Ultra high net worth individuals in 2019, which is likely to reach 10,354 by 2024. United States ranked top with 240, 575 individuals. The number of billionaires in India, on the other hand, is likely to reach 113 by 2024, up from 104 in 2019. India had 5,986 UHNWIs (Ultra high-net-worth individuals – people who are having a net worth of at least $30 million(mn) and above) in 2019 and they expected to increase by 73% in the coming 5 years. This will almost double the current count to 10,354.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 12
    Explanation:
    India, according to Knight Frank’s ‘Wealth Report 2020’, ranks 12th and had 5,986 Ultra high net worth individuals in 2019, which is likely to reach 10,354 by 2024. United States ranked top with 240, 575 individuals. The number of billionaires in India, on the other hand, is likely to reach 113 by 2024, up from 104 in 2019. India had 5,986 UHNWIs (Ultra high-net-worth individuals – people who are having a net worth of at least $30 million(mn) and above) in 2019 and they expected to increase by 73% in the coming 5 years. This will almost double the current count to 10,354.

  6. Question 6 of 50
    6. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person who has become the first player in the world to play 500 T20 matches.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Kieron Pollard
    Explanation:
    West Indies skipper Kieron Pollard has become the first player in the history of T20 (Twenty20) cricket to feature in 500 matches during the field against Sri Lanka for the first T20I in Pallekele, Srilanka.Dwayne Bravo is second in the list followed by Chris Gayle.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Kieron Pollard
    Explanation:
    West Indies skipper Kieron Pollard has become the first player in the history of T20 (Twenty20) cricket to feature in 500 matches during the field against Sri Lanka for the first T20I in Pallekele, Srilanka.Dwayne Bravo is second in the list followed by Chris Gayle.

  7. Question 7 of 50
    7. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    ‘Chapchar Kut’ is the biggest and oldest festival of which Indian state (celebrated on March 6, 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Mizoram
    Explanation:
    March 6 2020 “Chapchar Kut”, a biggest and oldest festival of Mizoram, is celebrated on March 6 2020. The pre-celebration started on 5th March 2020, with the mega event held at the Assam Rifles Ground at Aizawl.This festival is considered as the most popular spring festival celebrated on Mizoram.It is originated in- 1450-1700 A.D at Suaipui village.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Mizoram
    Explanation:
    March 6 2020 “Chapchar Kut”, a biggest and oldest festival of Mizoram, is celebrated on March 6 2020. The pre-celebration started on 5th March 2020, with the mega event held at the Assam Rifles Ground at Aizawl.This festival is considered as the most popular spring festival celebrated on Mizoram.It is originated in- 1450-1700 A.D at Suaipui village.

  8. Question 8 of 50
    8. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    With which world organization the Ministry of Women and Child Development (MoWCD) had organized a discussion Programme on the topic “The Future of Work: Women in India’s Workforce” at New Delhi.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) World Bank (WB)
    Explanation:
    The Ministry of Women and Child Development (MWCD) & the World Bank organized a discussion Programme on the topic “The Future of Work: Women in India’s Workforce” at New Delhi.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) World Bank (WB)
    Explanation:
    The Ministry of Women and Child Development (MWCD) & the World Bank organized a discussion Programme on the topic “The Future of Work: Women in India’s Workforce” at New Delhi.

  9. Question 9 of 50
    9. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per the Report titled “A New Era for Girls: Taking stock on 25 years of progress”, The global participation of female youth aged 15–24 years in the labour force has declined from 47% in 1995 to ____% in 2020.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 33
    Explanation:
    As per the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) report titled “A New Era for Girls: Taking stock on 25 years of progress” in collaboration with UN Women and Plan International, the global participation of female youth aged 15–24 years in the labour force has declined from 47% in 1995 to 33% in 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 33
    Explanation:
    As per the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) report titled “A New Era for Girls: Taking stock on 25 years of progress” in collaboration with UN Women and Plan International, the global participation of female youth aged 15–24 years in the labour force has declined from 47% in 1995 to 33% in 2020.

  10. Question 10 of 50
    10. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Indian Coastal Guard ‘s 9th edition of rescue exercise “SAREX-2019”, conducted at which Indian state?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Goa
    Explanation:
    Indian Coast Guard (ICG), an armed force that protects India’s maritime interests, has conducted a 2-day 9th edition of national level search and rescue exercise ‘SAREX-2020’ based on the theme ‘Harmonization of Maritime and Aeronautical Search and Rescue (HAMSAR)’ in the sea at Vasco, South Goa district from March 5-7,2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Goa
    Explanation:
    Indian Coast Guard (ICG), an armed force that protects India’s maritime interests, has conducted a 2-day 9th edition of national level search and rescue exercise ‘SAREX-2020’ based on the theme ‘Harmonization of Maritime and Aeronautical Search and Rescue (HAMSAR)’ in the sea at Vasco, South Goa district from March 5-7,2020.

  11. Question 11 of 50
    11. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian state which is 1st in the country to own a separate department for Self Help Groups (SHGs) named ‘Department of Mission Shakti’.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Odisha
    Explanation:
    Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced that Odisha is the 1st state to own a separate department for Self Help Groups named as” Department of Mission Shakti”. It is created for the development of women & is dedicated to all the women of Odisha.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Odisha
    Explanation:
    Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced that Odisha is the 1st state to own a separate department for Self Help Groups named as” Department of Mission Shakti”. It is created for the development of women & is dedicated to all the women of Odisha.

    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the 103-year old Athlete, who got Nari Shakti Puraskar award for 2019 for her achievements in Athletics.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Man Kaur
    Explanation:
    A 104-year old woman Man Kaur will be presented will be awarded the ‘Nari Shakti Puraskar’ for her achievements in athletics on the occasion of International women’s day by President Ram Nath Kovind in New Delhi.
    Awardees List

    S.no Name Key Accomplishment State
    1 Bina Devi or ‘Mushroom Mahila’ Popularizing mushroom cultivation Munger , Bihar
    2 Padala Bhudevi Working for development of Tribal People Through a CAVS (Chinnai Adhivasi Vikas Society), established in 1996. Srikakulam, Andhra Pradesh
    3 Arifa Jan Restored the culture and heritage of Jammu and Kashmir- Numdha handicrafts Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir
    4 Chami Murmu or ‘Lady Tarzan’ of Jharkhand Planted trees & protected local wildlife Rajnagar, SaraikelaKharsawan, Jharkhand
    5 Nilza Wangmo First one to serve Ladhak cuisines in her Alchi Kitchen Restaurant & represented Ladakhi recipes in 5-star hotels in India Leh ,Ladakh
    6 Rashmi Urdhwardeshe Development of automobile technologies Pune, Maharashtra
    7 Sardarni Mann Kaur or ‘Miracle from Chandigarh'(103) Achievements in athletics Patiala, Punjab
    8 Kalavati Devi- ‘lady mason’ Built toilets & created awareness regarding the ills of open defecation Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh
    9 Tashi and Nungshi Malik First female twins to scale Mount Everest in 2013 Dehradun, Uttarakhand

    As per the paper “Rethinking Gender Representation across Value Chains” released during the 3rd Gender Equality Summit 2020, If Women’s labour force is same as Men’s labour force then it can boost India’s GDP by _______.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) 27%
    Explanation:
    As per the paper “Rethinking Gender Representation across Value Chains” released during the 3rd Gender Equality Summit 2020, If Women’s labour force is same as Men’s labour force then it can boost India’s GDP by 27%.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) 27%
    Explanation:
    As per the paper “Rethinking Gender Representation across Value Chains” released during the 3rd Gender Equality Summit 2020, If Women’s labour force is same as Men’s labour force then it can boost India’s GDP by 27%.

  15. Question 15 of 50
    15. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person, who has become the youngest cricketer to play any ICC World Cup finals.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Shafali Verma
    Explanation:
    Indian Cricketer Shafali Verma (16-year-old) on March 8, 2020 has become the Youngest ever cricketer to play any ICC world cup finals. She thus broke the record previously held by West Indies’ Shaquana Quintyne, who was 17 years and 45 days old when she took the field for the West Indies in the 2013 women’s World Cup final. Pakistan’s Mohammad Amir is third on the list as he was 17 years and 69 days old when he played in the 2009 men’s World T20 final.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Shafali Verma
    Explanation:
    Indian Cricketer Shafali Verma (16-year-old) on March 8, 2020 has become the Youngest ever cricketer to play any ICC world cup finals. She thus broke the record previously held by West Indies’ Shaquana Quintyne, who was 17 years and 45 days old when she took the field for the West Indies in the 2013 women’s World Cup final. Pakistan’s Mohammad Amir is third on the list as he was 17 years and 69 days old when he played in the 2009 men’s World T20 final.

  16. Question 16 of 50
    16. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The International Women’s Day (IWD) celebrated annually on March 8. What is the theme for IWD 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Theme: “I am Generation Equality: Realizing Women’s Rights”
    Explanation:
    The United Nations (UN) Women is organizing International Women’s Day (IWD) all over the world on March 8 to recognize women for their efforts in changing the individual lives as well as of nations. The 2020 theme for IWD was “I am Generation Equality: Realizing Women’s Rights”.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Theme: “I am Generation Equality: Realizing Women’s Rights”
    Explanation:
    The United Nations (UN) Women is organizing International Women’s Day (IWD) all over the world on March 8 to recognize women for their efforts in changing the individual lives as well as of nations. The 2020 theme for IWD was “I am Generation Equality: Realizing Women’s Rights”.

  17. Question 17 of 50
    17. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Moody has lowered the India’s Growth projections for the Year 2020 from 5.4% to ____ due to outbreak of Corona Virus.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) 5.3 %
    Explanation:
    Moody’s Investors Service, a rating agency again lowered India’s growth projection to 5.3% for 2020 as a result of Coronavirus (COVID-19), previously on February 17, 2020 it had reduced India’s growth projection from 6.6% to 5.4% for 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) 5.3 %
    Explanation:
    Moody’s Investors Service, a rating agency again lowered India’s growth projection to 5.3% for 2020 as a result of Coronavirus (COVID-19), previously on February 17, 2020 it had reduced India’s growth projection from 6.6% to 5.4% for 2020.

  18. Question 18 of 50
    18. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person who has been appointed as the head of Delimitation Commission for the delimitation of Assembly and Parliamentary constituencies of J&K (UT) & Assam, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur (NE states).

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Ranjana Prakash Desai
    Explanation:
    In exercise of the powers conferred by section 3 of the Delimitation Act, 2002, the Central government has set up a Delimitation Commission, headed by former Supreme Court judge Ranjana Prakash Desai (for 1 year), for the delimitation of Assembly and Parliamentary constituencies of the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) and the northeastern states of Assam, Arunachal Pradesh(AP), Manipur and Nagaland. The Commission will also comprise of members, viz an Election Commissioner (presently Mr. Sushil Chandra) and the State Election Commissioners of the respective States and UT, who will be made ex-officio members of the commission.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Ranjana Prakash Desai
    Explanation:
    In exercise of the powers conferred by section 3 of the Delimitation Act, 2002, the Central government has set up a Delimitation Commission, headed by former Supreme Court judge Ranjana Prakash Desai (for 1 year), for the delimitation of Assembly and Parliamentary constituencies of the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) and the northeastern states of Assam, Arunachal Pradesh(AP), Manipur and Nagaland. The Commission will also comprise of members, viz an Election Commissioner (presently Mr. Sushil Chandra) and the State Election Commissioners of the respective States and UT, who will be made ex-officio members of the commission.

  19. Question 19 of 50
    19. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian state which topped in the list for domestic solar rooftop installations throughout the country (as on March 2, 2020).

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    Gujarat ranks first in the list for domestic solar rooftop installations, throughout the country with 64 percent of domestic solar installations, followed by Maharashtra (2nd).  Nearly 50,915 domestic solar rooftops have been fixed in the state of Gujarat with a capacity of 177.67 MW on 2nd March 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    Gujarat ranks first in the list for domestic solar rooftop installations, throughout the country with 64 percent of domestic solar installations, followed by Maharashtra (2nd).  Nearly 50,915 domestic solar rooftops have been fixed in the state of Gujarat with a capacity of 177.67 MW on 2nd March 2020.

    Category: Current Affairs

    As per progress report of NITI Aayog (September 2019) titled, “Transforming Nutrition in India: POSHAN Abhiyaan”, which Indian state ranked top in the overall implementation of POSHAN Abhiyaan.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Andhra Pradesh
    Explanation:
    Andhra Pradesh (AP) ranked 1st in the country for overall implementation of POSHAN (Prime Minister’s Overarching Scheme for Holistic Nourishment) Abhiyaan as per September 2019 progress report of NITI Aayog, “Transforming Nutrition in India: POSHAN Abhiyaan”. The 2nd anniversary of POSHAN Abhiyaan is recognized by celebrating Poshan Pakhwada from 8th-22nd March 2020.
    Top Position

    Rank Large State Small State UT
    1 Andhra Pradesh Mizoram Dadra & Nagar Haveli
    2 Chhattisgarh Sikkim Chandigarh
    3 Madhya Pradesh Nagaland Daman & Diu
    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Andhra Pradesh
    Explanation:
    Andhra Pradesh (AP) ranked 1st in the country for overall implementation of POSHAN (Prime Minister’s Overarching Scheme for Holistic Nourishment) Abhiyaan as per September 2019 progress report of NITI Aayog, “Transforming Nutrition in India: POSHAN Abhiyaan”. The 2nd anniversary of POSHAN Abhiyaan is recognized by celebrating Poshan Pakhwada from 8th-22nd March 2020.
    Top Position

    Rank Large State Small State UT
    1 Andhra Pradesh Mizoram Dadra & Nagar Haveli
    2 Chhattisgarh Sikkim Chandigarh
    3 Madhya Pradesh Nagaland Daman & Diu

    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the world organization which released the 1st edition of ‘Gender Social Norms Index (GSNI) 2020’.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
    Explanation:
    According to the 1st edition of ‘Gender Social Norms Index (GSNI) 2020’, released by the UNDP (United Nations Development Programme), about 90 % or 9 in 10 of the world’s population has some bias against women.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
    Explanation:
    According to the 1st edition of ‘Gender Social Norms Index (GSNI) 2020’, released by the UNDP (United Nations Development Programme), about 90 % or 9 in 10 of the world’s population has some bias against women.

  22. Question 22 of 50
    22. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian state which launched NIGHA app to control electoral malpractices in the upcoming local body elections (March 2020).

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Andhra Pradesh
    Explanation:
    Andhra Pradesh (AP) Chief Minister (CM) Yeduguri Sandinti Jaganmohan Reddy launched the NIGHA application at Vijayawada, AP. The app is aimed at curbing the use of money and alcohol in the upcoming local body elections & launched in addition to the measures taken by State Election Commission & Police department in order to control the electoral malpractices. The app was developed by Department of Panchayat Raj.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Andhra Pradesh
    Explanation:
    Andhra Pradesh (AP) Chief Minister (CM) Yeduguri Sandinti Jaganmohan Reddy launched the NIGHA application at Vijayawada, AP. The app is aimed at curbing the use of money and alcohol in the upcoming local body elections & launched in addition to the measures taken by State Election Commission & Police department in order to control the electoral malpractices. The app was developed by Department of Panchayat Raj.

  23. Question 23 of 50
    23. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person who has won the BBC Indian sportswoman of the year award 2019.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) PV Sindhu
    Explanation:
    Pusarla Venkata Sindhu has won the inaugural BBC (British Broadcasting Corporation) Indian Sportswoman of the year award 2019 in the BBC award ceremony held in New Delhi. In 2019, Sindhu became the first Indian to win badminton World Championship gold in Basel, Switzerland and she also has 5 world championship medals. Also PT Usha was awarded with Lifetime Achievement award for her contribution to Indian sports in the event.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) PV Sindhu
    Explanation:
    Pusarla Venkata Sindhu has won the inaugural BBC (British Broadcasting Corporation) Indian Sportswoman of the year award 2019 in the BBC award ceremony held in New Delhi. In 2019, Sindhu became the first Indian to win badminton World Championship gold in Basel, Switzerland and she also has 5 world championship medals. Also PT Usha was awarded with Lifetime Achievement award for her contribution to Indian sports in the event.

    Correct

    Explanation:
    Dr Jaimanti Bakshi, Professor & Unit Head II, Department of Otolaryngology and Head Neck surgery at PGIMER (Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education & Research), Chandigarh was awarded with “Best Citizens of India”. The award was given by “GEPRA” (Global Economic Progress and Research Association) during the National Unity conference held in Chennai, Tamil Nadu (TN).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Jaimanti Bakshi
    Explanation:
    Dr Jaimanti Bakshi, Professor & Unit Head II, Department of Otolaryngology and Head Neck surgery at PGIMER (Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education & Research), Chandigarh was awarded with “Best Citizens of India”. The award was given by “GEPRA” (Global Economic Progress and Research Association) during the National Unity conference held in Chennai, Tamil Nadu (TN).

  25. Question 25 of 50
    25. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person who has Authored the Book ‘Lady, You’re the Boss’.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Apurva Purohit
    Explanation:
    Apurva Purohit the President of the Jagran Group, one of India’s largest multi-media conglomerates launched her 2nd book- ‘Lady, You’re the Boss!’, which was published by Westland Publications (an Amazon company). Her 1st book was, ‘Lady, You’re Not a Man! The Adventures Of A Woman At Work’. Apurva is named as one of the Most Powerful Women in Business as per Fortune India in 2018 & 2019 & India Today Group 2016, 2018 & 2019, & also featured in Fortune India’s Most Powerful Women in Business list 2018 & 2019.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Apurva Purohit
    Explanation:
    Apurva Purohit the President of the Jagran Group, one of India’s largest multi-media conglomerates launched her 2nd book- ‘Lady, You’re the Boss!’, which was published by Westland Publications (an Amazon company). Her 1st book was, ‘Lady, You’re Not a Man! The Adventures Of A Woman At Work’. Apurva is named as one of the Most Powerful Women in Business as per Fortune India in 2018 & 2019 & India Today Group 2016, 2018 & 2019, & also featured in Fortune India’s Most Powerful Women in Business list 2018 & 2019.

  26. Question 26 of 50
    26. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian state which approved ‘Happy Hours’ (reducing 15% of fare from 12pm to 4pm) in auto rickshaws as per recommendation of Kathua panel.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Maharashtra
    Explanation:
    Maharashtra Government (govt) has approved the implementation of “happy hours” for auto rickshaws, reducing 15% of fare prices from 12 pm to 4 pm, barring the minimum fare for first 1.5 km, as recommended by Khatua panel. The decision will not be applicable to local taxis and app based taxis.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Maharashtra
    Explanation:
    Maharashtra Government (govt) has approved the implementation of “happy hours” for auto rickshaws, reducing 15% of fare prices from 12 pm to 4 pm, barring the minimum fare for first 1.5 km, as recommended by Khatua panel. The decision will not be applicable to local taxis and app based taxis.

  27. Question 27 of 50
    27. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    In which Indian City, the India post launched India’s 1st digital parcel locker service.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Kolkata
    Explanation:
    For the 1st time in India, the Department of posts(DoP), Kolkata (West Bengal circle), has launched free digital parcel locker service in 2 post offices (the Nabadiganta IT post office in Sector 5 of Salt Lake City & at the post office in New Town’s Action Area I).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Kolkata
    Explanation:
    For the 1st time in India, the Department of posts(DoP), Kolkata (West Bengal circle), has launched free digital parcel locker service in 2 post offices (the Nabadiganta IT post office in Sector 5 of Salt Lake City & at the post office in New Town’s Action Area I).

    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian state which signed the loan agreement of $80 million with World Bank to improve water management & agricultural productivity in Gram Panchayats.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Himachal Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The Government of India, Government of Himachal Pradesh(HP) & the World Bank signed a loan agreement of US$80 million (about Rs 600 crore) to improve water management practices & also to increase agricultural productivity in selected Gram Panchayats (Village Councils) in HP.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Himachal Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The Government of India, Government of Himachal Pradesh(HP) & the World Bank signed a loan agreement of US$80 million (about Rs 600 crore) to improve water management practices & also to increase agricultural productivity in selected Gram Panchayats (Village Councils) in HP.

    Answer – 3) GOKADDAL

  30. Question 30 of 50
    30. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Number of Indian Boxers qualified to Tokyo Olympics 2020 from the Asian/Oceanian Boxing Olympic Qualifiers event 2020 held at Amman, Jordan is/are ______.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 9
    Explanation:
    The Asian/Oceanian Boxing Olympic Qualifiers event 2020 was held at Amman, Jordan from march 3- 11, 2020. A total of 9 Indian boxers qualified in this event for Tokyo 2020 Olympics, which is to be held at Tokyo, Japan from 24 July, 2020 – 9 August, 2020. China emerged as top of the medals standings with 6 medals (4 gold, 2 bronze) in this event, while India ranked 9th with 8 medals (2 Silver, 6 Bronze).
    Qualified boxer of India at Asia/Oceania Tokyo 2020 Olympic boxing qualifying tournament:

    S.No Qualified boxer of India Category Medal won
    1 Amit Panghal Men’s Flyweight (52 kg) Bronze
    2 Manish Kaushik Men’s Lightweight (63 kg) –
    3 Vikas Krishan Yadav Men’s Welterweight (69 kg) Silver
    4 Ashish Kumar Men’s Middleweight (75 kg) Bronze
    5 Satish Kumar Men’s Super-heavyweight (+91 kg) Bronze
    6 Mary Kom Women’s Flyweight (51 kg) Bronze
    7 Simranjit Kaur Baatth Women’s Lightweight (60 kg) Silver
    8 Lovlina Borgohain Women’s Welterweight (69 kg) Bronze
    9 Pooja Rani Women’s Middleweight (75 kg) Bronze
    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 9
    Explanation:
    The Asian/Oceanian Boxing Olympic Qualifiers event 2020 was held at Amman, Jordan from march 3- 11, 2020. A total of 9 Indian boxers qualified in this event for Tokyo 2020 Olympics, which is to be held at Tokyo, Japan from 24 July, 2020 – 9 August, 2020. China emerged as top of the medals standings with 6 medals (4 gold, 2 bronze) in this event, while India ranked 9th with 8 medals (2 Silver, 6 Bronze).
    Qualified boxer of India at Asia/Oceania Tokyo 2020 Olympic boxing qualifying tournament:

    S.No Qualified boxer of India Category Medal won
    1 Amit Panghal Men’s Flyweight (52 kg) Bronze
    2 Manish Kaushik Men’s Lightweight (63 kg) –
    3 Vikas Krishan Yadav Men’s Welterweight (69 kg) Silver
    4 Ashish Kumar Men’s Middleweight (75 kg) Bronze
    5 Satish Kumar Men’s Super-heavyweight (+91 kg) Bronze
    6 Mary Kom Women’s Flyweight (51 kg) Bronze
    7 Simranjit Kaur Baatth Women’s Lightweight (60 kg) Silver
    8 Lovlina Borgohain Women’s Welterweight (69 kg) Bronze
    9 Pooja Rani Women’s Middleweight (75 kg) Bronze

    Answer – 4) Leh
    Explanation:

  32. Question 32 of 50
    32. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian state which is 1st in country to notify regulations to prevent the outbreak and spread of the novel coronavirus under Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Karnataka
    Explanation:
    Karnataka became the first state in the country to notify regulations titled “The Karnataka Epidemic Diseases, COVID-19 Regulations, 2020” to prevent the outbreak and spread of the novel coronavirus under the Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Karnataka
    Explanation:
    Karnataka became the first state in the country to notify regulations titled “The Karnataka Epidemic Diseases, COVID-19 Regulations, 2020” to prevent the outbreak and spread of the novel coronavirus under the Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897.

  33. Question 33 of 50
    33. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the railway station which is going to be upgraded as World Class station, first-of-its-kind project as a part of Government of India’s (GoI) plan to converting the conditions of Indian railway stations into world class one.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) New Delhi Railway Station
    Explanation:
    The New Delhi Railway Station (NDLS) will be converted into a world-class railway station with an estimated outlay of Rs 6500 crore. Ministry of Railways has entrusted the work of redevelopment of this station to Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA) under PPP mode. Station redevelopment projects at this scale in PPP mode are first of its kind and complex in nature which requires detailed techno-financial feasibility studies.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) New Delhi Railway Station
    Explanation:
    The New Delhi Railway Station (NDLS) will be converted into a world-class railway station with an estimated outlay of Rs 6500 crore. Ministry of Railways has entrusted the work of redevelopment of this station to Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA) under PPP mode. Station redevelopment projects at this scale in PPP mode are first of its kind and complex in nature which requires detailed techno-financial feasibility studies.

  34. Question 34 of 50
    34. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Central Board of State Bank of India (SBI) has approved the investment of Rs. ________ in Yes Bank as the part of RBI’s ‘Yes Bank Ltd. Reconstruction Scheme, 2020’.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) 7250 Crore
    Explanation:
    The executive committee of the central board of State Bank of India (SBI) has approved an investment of Rs 7,250 crore in Yes Bank Ltd. as a part of RBI formulated rescue plan titled “Yes Bank Ltd. Reconstruction Scheme, 2020” for the revival of Yes Bank. The SBI has not specified its shareholding the bank but it will remain under 49% of the paid up capital of the Yes Bank.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) 7250 Crore
    Explanation:
    The executive committee of the central board of State Bank of India (SBI) has approved an investment of Rs 7,250 crore in Yes Bank Ltd. as a part of RBI formulated rescue plan titled “Yes Bank Ltd. Reconstruction Scheme, 2020” for the revival of Yes Bank. The SBI has not specified its shareholding the bank but it will remain under 49% of the paid up capital of the Yes Bank.

  35. Question 35 of 50
    35. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per RBI’s report titled ‘Developments in India’s Balance of Payments during the third quarter (October-December) of 2019-20’, the Current Account Deficit (CAD) fell to ____ of GDP for Oct-Dec 2019 quarter.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) $ 1.4 Billion
    Explanation:
    According to the report “Developments in India’s Balance of Payments during the third quarter (October-December) of 2019-20”, released by Reserve Bank of India (RBI), India’s current account deficit (CAD) fell sharply to $ 1.4 billion, or 0.2 % of GDP (gross domestic product), for the October-December 2019 quarter of the current financial year (FY 2019-20) due to the lower trade deficit.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) $ 1.4 Billion
    Explanation:
    According to the report “Developments in India’s Balance of Payments during the third quarter (October-December) of 2019-20”, released by Reserve Bank of India (RBI), India’s current account deficit (CAD) fell sharply to $ 1.4 billion, or 0.2 % of GDP (gross domestic product), for the October-December 2019 quarter of the current financial year (FY 2019-20) due to the lower trade deficit.

  36. Question 36 of 50
    36. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person who heads the committee which recommended the concession of commercial operation of train services like Rajdhani/Shatabdi to private parties.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Bibek Debroy
    Explanation:
    The committee chaired by Bibek Debroy has recommended concession of commercial operation of train service like Rajdhani/Shatabdi to private parties. Already, Railways proposed to initiate 150 passenger trains through private operators in PPP (Public-private partnership) mode on 100 routes by 2022. In this regard, Ministry of Railways had constituted Group of Secretaries (GoS) under NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant in 2019 to advice on the terms and conditions for private passenger train operators regarding world-class technology and services for the Indian Railways network through PPP mode.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Bibek Debroy
    Explanation:
    The committee chaired by Bibek Debroy has recommended concession of commercial operation of train service like Rajdhani/Shatabdi to private parties. Already, Railways proposed to initiate 150 passenger trains through private operators in PPP (Public-private partnership) mode on 100 routes by 2022. In this regard, Ministry of Railways had constituted Group of Secretaries (GoS) under NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant in 2019 to advice on the terms and conditions for private passenger train operators regarding world-class technology and services for the Indian Railways network through PPP mode.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Udyam Shaki
    Explanation:
    Minister of micro, small and medium enterprises (MSME), Nitin Gadkari recently requested the members of Lok Sabha to spread the information about “Udyam Sakhi” Portal for awareness about government schemes and to facilitate the networking of women start-ups, entrepreneurs, investors, incubators, mentors, students and enterprise facilitators.

  40. Question 40 of 50
    40. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per the report titled ‘Trends in international arms transfers, 2019’ released by Stockholm International Peace Research Institute’s (SIPRI), What is India’s rank in largest arms importer during 2015-19.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 2
    Explanation:
    In accordance with the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute’s (SIPRI) annual report titled “Trends in international arms transfers, 2019”, India is the world’s second largest arms importer during 2015-19 with its global share of 9.2% after Saudi Arabia, who has topped the ranking with global share of 12%. Whereas, India ranked 23rd in the exporters list during the same period with the global share of 0.2%.

    Rank Exporters (Share of arms exports) Importers (Share of arms imports) Importers-Region Wise (Share of arms imports)
    1 United States (36%) Saudi Arabia (12%) Asia and Oceania (41%)
    2 Russia (21%) India (9.2%) Middle East (35%)
    3 France (7.9%) Egypt (5.8%) Europe (11%)
    4 Germany (5.8%) Australia (4.9%) Africa (7.2%)
    5 China (5.5%) China (4.3%) Americas (5.7%)
    23 India (0.2%)
    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 2
    Explanation:
    In accordance with the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute’s (SIPRI) annual report titled “Trends in international arms transfers, 2019”, India is the world’s second largest arms importer during 2015-19 with its global share of 9.2% after Saudi Arabia, who has topped the ranking with global share of 12%. Whereas, India ranked 23rd in the exporters list during the same period with the global share of 0.2%.

    Rank Exporters (Share of arms exports) Importers (Share of arms imports) Importers-Region Wise (Share of arms imports)
    1 United States (36%) Saudi Arabia (12%) Asia and Oceania (41%)
    2 Russia (21%) India (9.2%) Middle East (35%)
    3 France (7.9%) Egypt (5.8%) Europe (11%)
    4 Germany (5.8%) Australia (4.9%) Africa (7.2%)
    5 China (5.5%) China (4.3%) Americas (5.7%)
    23 India (0.2%)

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Andhra Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The GMR Group has secured the Andhra Pradesh Cabinet approval (in March 2020) for developing the greenfield Bhogapuram International Airport about 35 km from Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh.

  42. Question 42 of 50
    42. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    The Government reconstructs the multisectoral decision making body – National Platform for Disaster Risk Reduction (NPDRR). Name the person who has been appointed as Chairman of NPDRR.

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Home Minister
    Explanation:
    The government reconstructs the National Platform for Disaster Risk Reduction (NPDRR) a multi- stakeholder & multisectoral decision making body on disaster management & appoints Union Home Minister Amit Shah as chairman. The NPDRR is chaired by the Union Home Minister and the Minister of State in-charge of Disaster Management in the Ministry of Home Affairs.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Home Minister
    Explanation:
    The government reconstructs the National Platform for Disaster Risk Reduction (NPDRR) a multi- stakeholder & multisectoral decision making body on disaster management & appoints Union Home Minister Amit Shah as chairman. The NPDRR is chaired by the Union Home Minister and the Minister of State in-charge of Disaster Management in the Ministry of Home Affairs.

BPCL Headquarters – Mumbai, Maharashtra.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Mumbai
    Explanation:
    As per the bid document from the Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM), the Government has invited bids for the sale of its entire 52.98% stake in the country’s second biggest State-owned oil reﬁner Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL). BPCL Headquarters – Mumbai, Maharashtra.

    In Kerala, the capital city of Thiruvananthapuram is all prepared to host the Attaukal Ponkala festival which is considered as one of the world’s largest religious gathering of women on a single day.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Kerala
    Explanation:
    In Kerala, the capital city of Thiruvananthapuram is all prepared to host the Attaukal Ponkala festival which is considered as one of the world’s largest religious gathering of women on a single day.

  45. Question 45 of 50
    45. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    The Shaadi Bhagya Scheme is related to which Indian state?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Karnataka
    Explanation:
    The Karnataka government recently scrapped the Shaadi Bhagya Scheme which was launched in 2013. Earlier under the scheme, Rs. 50,000 was granted to Muslim brides for marriage expenses after submitting the Aadhar and BPL cards.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Karnataka
    Explanation:
    The Karnataka government recently scrapped the Shaadi Bhagya Scheme which was launched in 2013. Earlier under the scheme, Rs. 50,000 was granted to Muslim brides for marriage expenses after submitting the Aadhar and BPL cards.

  46. Question 46 of 50
    46. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Parivara and Talawara are tribal of which Indian state?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Karnataka
    Explanation:
    Rajya Sabha has approved the changes proposed by Lok Sabha in the Constitution (Scheduled Tribes) Order Amendment Bill, 2019. The bill seeks to include Parivara and Talawara tribal communities of Karnataka in the (Scheduled Tribes) category to ensure they get the reservation and other benefits provided by the government

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Karnataka
    Explanation:
    Rajya Sabha has approved the changes proposed by Lok Sabha in the Constitution (Scheduled Tribes) Order Amendment Bill, 2019. The bill seeks to include Parivara and Talawara tribal communities of Karnataka in the (Scheduled Tribes) category to ensure they get the reservation and other benefits provided by the government

  47. Question 47 of 50
    47. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Shivpal Singh is related to which sports?

    Correct

    Answer –3) Javelin Throw
    Explanation:
    India’s Javelin throw player Shivpal Singh (24) qualified for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics after he achieved the Olympic qualifying mark of 85m in the ACNW (Athletics Central North West) League Meeting 2020 held in Potchefstroom, South Africa. With this, he is the 2nd javelin thrower after Neeraj Chopra who will represent the country in Japan 2020 Olympics.

    Incorrect

    Answer –3) Javelin Throw
    Explanation:
    India’s Javelin throw player Shivpal Singh (24) qualified for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics after he achieved the Olympic qualifying mark of 85m in the ACNW (Athletics Central North West) League Meeting 2020 held in Potchefstroom, South Africa. With this, he is the 2nd javelin thrower after Neeraj Chopra who will represent the country in Japan 2020 Olympics.

  50. Question 50 of 50
    50. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    The Jewer Airport is located in which Indian state/UT?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Uttar Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The first phase of Jewar Airport, Uttar Pradesh (UP) has been included in the world’s 100 strategic global infrastructure projects for the year 2020. The airport, being built by Zurich Airport International AG, will be Asia’s second largest international airport after China’s Shanghai International Airport.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Uttar Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The first phase of Jewar Airport, Uttar Pradesh (UP) has been included in the world’s 100 strategic global infrastructure projects for the year 2020. The airport, being built by Zurich Airport International AG, will be Asia’s second largest international airport after China’s Shanghai International Airport.

  1. Question 1 of 50
    1. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian university, which signed MoU with the Indian Air Force (IAF) to establish the chair of excellence named “Marshal of the Air Force Arjan Singh Chair of Excellence” (Feb 2020).

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Savitribai Phule Pune University
    Explanation:
    Indian Air Force (IAF) and Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) signed a MoU (Memorandum of Understanding) to establish a Chair of Excellence named “Marshal of the Air Force Arjan Singh Chair of Excellence” at Department of Defense & Strategic Studies at Pune, Maharashtra.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Savitribai Phule Pune University
    Explanation:
    Indian Air Force (IAF) and Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) signed a MoU (Memorandum of Understanding) to establish a Chair of Excellence named “Marshal of the Air Force Arjan Singh Chair of Excellence” at Department of Defense & Strategic Studies at Pune, Maharashtra.

  2. Question 2 of 50
    2. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Muhyiddin bin Haji Muhammad Yassin has been appointed as the Prime Minister of which of the following country (March 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Malaysia
    Explanation:
    The Muhyiddin bin Haji Muhammad Yassin (former deputy PM) took oath of office as Malaysia’s 8th Prime Minister(PM) at National Palace in Kuala Lumpur. He is from Malaysian United Indigenous Party, Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM). He succeeds 94-year-old Mahathir bin Mohamad, who abruptly resigned & was in office since the general elections 2018.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Malaysia
    Explanation:
    The Muhyiddin bin Haji Muhammad Yassin (former deputy PM) took oath of office as Malaysia’s 8th Prime Minister(PM) at National Palace in Kuala Lumpur. He is from Malaysian United Indigenous Party, Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM). He succeeds 94-year-old Mahathir bin Mohamad, who abruptly resigned & was in office since the general elections 2018.

  3. Question 3 of 50
    3. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person, who has been honored with Dr. Syama Prasad Mukherjee Award for Politics in Swarajya Awards 2020.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Sarbananda Sonowal
    Explanation:
    Assam’s Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal was honoured with Swarajya Awards 2020 under the category, Dr. Syama Prasad Mukherjee Award for Politics at the 6th India Ideas Conclave at Tent City Narmada in Gujarat. The award is instituted by India Foundation & Indic Academy. He received the award for his work in integrating the nation, & to take Mukherjee’s vision & philosophy forward.
    Winners List

    Awardee Category Field
    Sarbananda Sonowal Dr S P Mukherjee Award Politics
    K Parasaran Sree Narayana Guru Award Social Work
    Bharatbala Ustad Bismillah Khan Award Culture
    N K Singh Dr B R Shenoy Award Economics
    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Sarbananda Sonowal
    Explanation:
    Assam’s Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal was honoured with Swarajya Awards 2020 under the category, Dr. Syama Prasad Mukherjee Award for Politics at the 6th India Ideas Conclave at Tent City Narmada in Gujarat. The award is instituted by India Foundation & Indic Academy. He received the award for his work in integrating the nation, & to take Mukherjee’s vision & philosophy forward.
    Winners List

    Awardee Category Field
    Sarbananda Sonowal Dr S P Mukherjee Award Politics
    K Parasaran Sree Narayana Guru Award Social Work
    Bharatbala Ustad Bismillah Khan Award Culture

  4. Question 4 of 50
    4. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who won the 27th edition of Mexican Open (Abierto Mexicano Telcel) held between February 24-29, 2020 in Men’s singles Category?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Rafael Nadal (Spain)
    Explanation:
    The 2020 Mexican Open (27th edition) officially known as Abierto Mexicano Telcel (AMT) presentado por HSBC (Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation), a lawn tennis tournament was held at Acapulco, Mexico between 24 and 29 February 2020. It was played on Outdoor Hard Court Surface. Rafael Nadal wins the Mexican open tournament for the 3rd time and it is his 85th ATP title overall (Men’s singles category).

    2020 Mexican Open Winners
    Category Winner Runner Up
    Men’s Singles Rafael Nadal Parera (Spain) Taylor Harry Fritz (America)
    Women’s Singles Heather Miriam Watson (United Kingdom) Leylah Annie Fernandez (Canada)
    Men’s Doubles Łukasz Kubot (Poland) & Marcelo Pinheiro Davi de Melo (Brazil) Juan Sebastian Cabal Valdes (Colombo) & Robert Charbel Farah Maksoud (Colombo)
    Women’s Doubles Desirae Marie Krawczyk (America) & Giuliana Marion Olmos Dick (Mexico) Kateryna Volodymyrivna Bondarenko (Ukraine) & Sharon Fichman (Canada)
    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Rafael Nadal (Spain)
    Explanation:
    The 2020 Mexican Open (27th edition) officially known as Abierto Mexicano Telcel (AMT) presentado por HSBC (Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation), a lawn tennis tournament was held at Acapulco, Mexico between 24 and 29 February 2020. It was played on Outdoor Hard Court Surface. Rafael Nadal wins the Mexican open tournament for the 3rd time and it is his 85th ATP title overall (Men’s singles category).

    2020 Mexican Open Winners
    Category Winner Runner Up
    Men’s Singles Rafael Nadal Parera (Spain) Taylor Harry Fritz (America)
    Women’s Singles Heather Miriam Watson (United Kingdom) Leylah Annie Fernandez (Canada)
    Men’s Doubles Łukasz Kubot (Poland) & Marcelo Pinheiro Davi de Melo (Brazil) Juan Sebastian Cabal Valdes (Colombo) & Robert Charbel Farah Maksoud (Colombo)
    Women’s Doubles Desirae Marie Krawczyk (America) & Giuliana Marion Olmos Dick (Mexico) Kateryna Volodymyrivna Bondarenko (Ukraine) & Sharon Fichman (Canada)
  5. Question 5 of 50
    5. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Joginder Singh Saini who passed away recently (March 2020) is a _________.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Athletics Coach
    Explanation:
    Senior athletics coach & Dronacharya awardee Joginder Singh Saini, who trained some of India’s finest track and field stars, passed away at the age of 90, in Patiala, Punjab, due to age related problems. He served as the chief national athletics coach for many years from the year 1970 to 1990.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Athletics Coach
    Explanation:
    Senior athletics coach & Dronacharya awardee Joginder Singh Saini, who trained some of India’s finest track and field stars, passed away at the age of 90, in Patiala, Punjab, due to age related problems. He served as the chief national athletics coach for many years from the year 1970 to 1990.

  6. Question 6 of 50
    6. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The theme for Zero Discrimination Day 2020 is ‘Zero Discrimination against Women & Girls’. The Zero Discrimination Day is observed annually on _______.

    Correct

    Answer – 2) March 1
    Explanation:
    Zero Discrimination is celebrated annually on March 1 to challenge the discrimination faced by women & girls, to raise awareness & mobilize action to promote equality & empowerment for women & girls. The theme for 2020 is “Zero Discrimination against Women & Girls”. The symbol for this day is Butterfly.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) March 1
    Explanation:
    Zero Discrimination is celebrated annually on March 1 to challenge the discrimination faced by women & girls, to raise awareness & mobilize action to promote equality & empowerment for women & girls. The theme for 2020 is “Zero Discrimination against Women & Girls”. The symbol for this day is Butterfly.

  7. Question 7 of 50
    7. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian digital payment platform’s subsidiary has received the Brokerage License from Insurance Regulatory and Authority of India (IRDAI)?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Paytm
    Explanation:
    Indian digital payments platform Paytm’s subsidiary, Paytm Insurance Broking, has received the brokerage licence from the Insurance Regulatory and Authority of India (IRDAI).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Paytm
    Explanation:
    Indian digital payments platform Paytm’s subsidiary, Paytm Insurance Broking, has received the brokerage licence from the Insurance Regulatory and Authority of India (IRDAI).

  8. Question 8 of 50
    8. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Recently (March 2020) State Bank of India (SBI) has switched to CBBA method from “Projected Balance Sheet (PBS)” method of Fund Based Working Capital (FBWC) limits for assessment of the working capital requirement for corporates or large advances. The ‘C’ in CBBA denotes?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Cash
    Explanation:
    State Bank of India (SBI) has switched to “Cash Budget Based Assessment (CBBA)” from “Projected Balance Sheet (PBS)” method of Fund Based Working Capital (FBWC) limits for assessment of the working capital requirement for corporates or large advances. CBBA of limits has been initiated for assessment of the FBWC limits for units with total FBWC exposure of more than ₹50 crores from the banking system.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Cash
    Explanation:
    State Bank of India (SBI) has switched to “Cash Budget Based Assessment (CBBA)” from “Projected Balance Sheet (PBS)” method of Fund Based Working Capital (FBWC) limits for assessment of the working capital requirement for corporates or large advances. CBBA of limits has been initiated for assessment of the FBWC limits for units with total FBWC exposure of more than ₹50 crores from the banking system.

  9. Question 9 of 50
    9. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development’s (OECD) report titled “OECD Interim Economic Assessment Coronavirus: The world economy at risk”, What is the estimated growth rate (GDP) of India for the year 2020?

    Correct

    Answer –3) 5.1%
    Explanation:
    Global agency Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) in its report titled “OECD Interim Economic Assessment Coronavirus: The world economy at risk” has trimmed India’s real GDP (Gross Domestic Product) growth forecast to 5.1% from the earlier projection of 6.2% for 2020 due to the impact of deadly coronavirus (COVID-19) on the domestic as well as the global economy. For 2021, India’s real GDP growth is projected at 5.6% from the earlier forcast of 6.4%. Fitch has lowered the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of India for the Fiscal Year 20 (FY20) from 5.1% to 4.9%.

    Incorrect

    Answer –3) 5.1%
    Explanation:
    Global agency Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) in its report titled “OECD Interim Economic Assessment Coronavirus: The world economy at risk” has trimmed India’s real GDP (Gross Domestic Product) growth forecast to 5.1% from the earlier projection of 6.2% for 2020 due to the impact of deadly coronavirus (COVID-19) on the domestic as well as the global economy. For 2021, India’s real GDP growth is projected at 5.6% from the earlier forcast of 6.4%. Fitch has lowered the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of India for the Fiscal Year 20 (FY20) from 5.1% to 4.9%.

  10. Question 10 of 50
    10. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian City which is going to host the 108th Indian Science Congress in 2021 (January 3-7, 2021) based on the theme ‘Science and Technology for Sustainable Development with Women Empowerment’.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Pune
    Explanation:
    The Indian Science Congress association (ISCA) announced that Pune will host the annual session of 108th Indian Science Congress on January 3-7, 2021 at Symbiosis International University’s Lavale campus with the theme,” Science and Technology for Sustainable Development with Women Empowerment”.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Pune
    Explanation:
    The Indian Science Congress association (ISCA) announced that Pune will host the annual session of 108th Indian Science Congress on January 3-7, 2021 at Symbiosis International University’s Lavale campus with the theme,” Science and Technology for Sustainable Development with Women Empowerment”.

  11. Question 11 of 50
    11. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian Ministry has launched the multi-lingual version of “Incredible India” website and mobile app in New Delhi?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Ministry of Tourism
    Explanation:
    The Minister of State (MoS) for Tourism & Culture, Shri Prahlad Singh Patel has launched the multilingual version of ‘Incredible India’ website and mobile app in New Delhi with the aim to provide more information about India’s tourist destinations, attractions, experiences, and where the value lies. The website was earlier hosted only in English & Hindi and now it has been launched in 3 new languages i.e. Chinese, Arabic and Spanish.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Ministry of Tourism
    Explanation:
    The Minister of State (MoS) for Tourism & Culture, Shri Prahlad Singh Patel has launched the multilingual version of ‘Incredible India’ website and mobile app in New Delhi with the aim to provide more information about India’s tourist destinations, attractions, experiences, and where the value lies. The website was earlier hosted only in English & Hindi and now it has been launched in 3 new languages i.e. Chinese, Arabic and Spanish.

  12. Question 12 of 50
    12. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the 1st cricketer who has played 100 matches in all three formats (Test, ODI, T20).

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Ross Taylor
    Explanation:
    During the India tour of New Zealand (Between January – March 2020), Ross Taylor became the 1st New Zealand male cricketer to play 100 matches in all three formats of cricket.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Ross Taylor
    Explanation:
    During the India tour of New Zealand (Between January – March 2020), Ross Taylor became the 1st New Zealand male cricketer to play 100 matches in all three formats of cricket.

  13. Question 13 of 50
    13. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per Ministry of Personnel, Public grievance and Pensions (MoPP&P), the fine for false complaint under Lokpal extends upto Rs.  ___________.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 1 Lakh
    Explanation:
    The Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions (MoPP&P) has issued a format for filing complaints of corruption against public servants with the Lokpal or anti-corruption ombudsman under Lokpal (Complaint) Rules, 2020. The Lokpal rules has been laid down under the Section 59 of the Lokpal and Lokayuktas Act 2013. Any false and vexatious complaint is punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year and with fine which may extend to Rs 1 Lakh.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 1 Lakh
    Explanation:
    The Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions (MoPP&P) has issued a format for filing complaints of corruption against public servants with the Lokpal or anti-corruption ombudsman under Lokpal (Complaint) Rules, 2020. The Lokpal rules has been laid down under the Section 59 of the Lokpal and Lokayuktas Act 2013. Any false and vexatious complaint is punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year and with fine which may extend to Rs 1 Lakh.

    Name the country which becomes first nation in the world to make all the public transport free from 29 February, 2020.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Luxembourg
    Explanation:
    Luxembourg, the 7th smallest country in Europe, has become the 1st country in the world to make public transport free from February 29, 2020 inorder to reduce traffic pressure on the road.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Luxembourg
    Explanation:
    Luxembourg, the 7th smallest country in Europe, has become the 1st country in the world to make public transport free from February 29, 2020 inorder to reduce traffic pressure on the road.

    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the person who has been named as the 128th winner of Commonwealth points of light award.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Jadav Payeng
    Explanation:
    Jadav Payeng, an environmental activist of Assam also known as the “Forest man of India” named as 128th winner of Commonwealth Points of Light Award. He earned the name Forest man of India by spending 30 years of his life planting trees. He was honored by the Head of Common Wealth the Queen Elizabeth II for his exceptional volunteer service in environmental conservation.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Jadav Payeng
    Explanation:
    Jadav Payeng, an environmental activist of Assam also known as the “Forest man of India” named as 128th winner of Commonwealth Points of Light Award. He earned the name Forest man of India by spending 30 years of his life planting trees. He was honored by the Head of Common Wealth the Queen Elizabeth II for his exceptional volunteer service in environmental conservation.

    18. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the food delivery business company which was acquired by Zomato for $206 million.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) UberEats
    Explanation:
    According to the Uber ‘s recent regulatory filings, Zomato, an Indian restaurant aggregator and food delivery startup has acquired Uber’s food delivery business in India, Uber Eats for $206 million, where the investment was priced at $171 million, the balance $35 million was received as a reimbursement of goods and services tax (GST) receivable from Zomato.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) UberEats
    Explanation:
    According to the Uber ‘s recent regulatory filings, Zomato, an Indian restaurant aggregator and food delivery startup has acquired Uber’s food delivery business in India, Uber Eats for $206 million, where the investment was priced at $171 million, the balance $35 million was received as a reimbursement of goods and services tax (GST) receivable from Zomato.

  20. Question 20 of 50
    20. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Public Sector Bank (PSB) which is going to be Amalgamated with Indian Bank in effect from April 1, 2020.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Allahabad Bank
    Explanation:
    The Union Cabinet has approved the mega consolidation of following ten PSBs into four which would be effective from 1.4.2020.

    Amalgamating Bank Amalgamated Bank
    Oriental Bank of Commerce (OBC) and United Bank of India (UBI) Punjab National Bank (PNB)
    Syndicate Bank Canara Bank
    Andhra Bank and Corporation Bank Union Bank of India
    Allahabad Bank Indian Bank

    The above amalgamation will be in addition to State Bank of India (SBI), Bank of Baroda (BoB), and Bank of India (BoI) comprises of 7 Big PSBs. There were 27 PSBs in 2017 and now there would be 12 (7 big PSB + 5 Small PSB). The five smaller PSBs are Central Bank of India (CBI), Indian Overseas Bank (IOB), UCO Bank, Bank of Maharashtra (BOM), and Punjab and Sind Bank.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Allahabad Bank
    Explanation:
    The Union Cabinet has approved the mega consolidation of following ten PSBs into four which would be effective from 1.4.2020.

    Amalgamating Bank Amalgamated Bank
    Oriental Bank of Commerce (OBC) and United Bank of India (UBI) Punjab National Bank (PNB)
    Syndicate Bank Canara Bank
    Andhra Bank and Corporation Bank Union Bank of India
    Allahabad Bank Indian Bank

    The above amalgamation will be in addition to State Bank of India (SBI), Bank of Baroda (BoB), and Bank of India (BoI) comprises of 7 Big PSBs. There were 27 PSBs in 2017 and now there would be 12 (7 big PSB + 5 Small PSB). The five smaller PSBs are Central Bank of India (CBI), Indian Overseas Bank (IOB), UCO Bank, Bank of Maharashtra (BOM), and Punjab and Sind Bank.

  22. Question 22 of 50
    22. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Supreme Court has lifted ban on trading in cryptocurrency by cancelling the Reserve Bank of India’s(RBI) circular in 2018. The Cryptocurrency runs on which Technology?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Blockchain
    Explanation:
    Supreme Court (SC) has lifted ban on trading in virtual currency, cryptocurrency and bitcoins by cancelling the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) 2018 circular that barred banks from serving companies dealing in cryptocurrency exchanges. The decision in this regard has been taken by the three-judge Bench headed by Justice Rohinton Fali Nariman. Cryptocurrency is used to move money between bank and a client which usually runs on a blockchain technology. Blockchain is a type of Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Blockchain
    Explanation:
    Supreme Court (SC) has lifted ban on trading in virtual currency, cryptocurrency and bitcoins by cancelling the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) 2018 circular that barred banks from serving companies dealing in cryptocurrency exchanges. The decision in this regard has been taken by the three-judge Bench headed by Justice Rohinton Fali Nariman. Cryptocurrency is used to move money between bank and a client which usually runs on a blockchain technology. Blockchain is a type of Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT).

  23. Question 23 of 50
    23. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) has introduced a scheme namely “LLP Settlement Scheme, 2020” for LLPs by allowing a one-time condonation of delay in filing forms with the Registrar of Office (ROC). The LLP denotes?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Limited Liability Partnership
    Explanation:
    The Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) has introduced a scheme namely “LLP Settlement Scheme, 2020” for limited liability partnership (LLPs) by allowing a one-time condonation of delay in filing statutorily required documents with the Registrar of Office (ROC). In simplified language, it means the scheme is providing a three-month window from 16th March, 2020 to 13th June, 2020 to LLPs for completing overdue or delayed filings of four forms which were due for filing till 31st October, 2019. Also, the additional fee on these forms is reduced to Rs. 10 from Rs. 100 per day of delay with upper cap of Rs. 5,000 per form.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Limited Liability Partnership
    Explanation:
    The Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) has introduced a scheme namely “LLP Settlement Scheme, 2020” for limited liability partnership (LLPs) by allowing a one-time condonation of delay in filing statutorily required documents with the Registrar of Office (ROC). In simplified language, it means the scheme is providing a three-month window from 16th March, 2020 to 13th June, 2020 to LLPs for completing overdue or delayed filings of four forms which were due for filing till 31st October, 2019. Also, the additional fee on these forms is reduced to Rs. 10 from Rs. 100 per day of delay with upper cap of Rs. 5,000 per form.

    Name the Indian City where the 5th edition of India Pharma 2020 and India Medical Device 2020 Conference & Exhibition conducted at.

The was inaugurated by the Chemicals & Fertilizers Minister Sadananda Gowda MoS (C&F) & Mansukh Mandviya (C&F Minister).
    Theme of the conference: “India Pharma: Meeting Challenges of Affordable and Quality Healthcare and India Medical Device: Promoting Affordable responsible and Quality Medical Device for Universal Health Care”.

    Answer – 2) Gandhinagar, Gujarat
    Explanation:
    The Department of Pharmaceuticals, Ministry of Chemicals and Fertilizers (C&F), in association with Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry- FICCI is organising India Pharma 2020 & India Medical Device 2020 Conference & Exhibition at Gandhi Nagar, Gujarat from March 5-7, 2020. The was inaugurated by the Chemicals & Fertilizers Minister Sadananda Gowda MoS (C&F) & Mansukh Mandviya (C&F Minister).
    Theme of the conference: “India Pharma: Meeting Challenges of Affordable and Quality Healthcare and India Medical Device: Promoting Affordable responsible and Quality Medical Device for Universal Health Care”.

  27. Question 27 of 50
    27. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Javier Perez de Cuellar who passed away recently (March 2020) is the former Secretary General of which world Organisation?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) United Nations Organization (UNO)
    Explanation:
    Javier Perez de Cuellar (born in Lima, Peru) was the president of the UN Security Council from 1973 to 1974 and he served as UN fifth secretary general from 1981 to 1991. He was often described as a “pacifist by vocation and nature.”

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) United Nations Organization (UNO)
    Explanation:
    Javier Perez de Cuellar (born in Lima, Peru) was the president of the UN Security Council from 1973 to 1974 and he served as UN fifth secretary general from 1981 to 1991. He was often described as a “pacifist by vocation and nature.”

    Name the Indian state which renamed Aurangabad Airport as Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Airport (March 2020).

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Maharashtra
    Explanation:
    The Maharashtra Government renamed Aurangabad Airport as Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Airport. The decision was taken at a meeting of the state cabinet, chaired by Maharashtra Chief Minister (CM) Uddhav Bal Thackeray. Earlier, Mumbai airport has been named as Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Airport while Kolhapur airport was renamed as Chhatrapati Rajaram Maharaj.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Maharashtra
    Explanation:
    The Maharashtra Government renamed Aurangabad Airport as Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Airport. The decision was taken at a meeting of the state cabinet, chaired by Maharashtra Chief Minister (CM) Uddhav Bal Thackeray. Earlier, Mumbai airport has been named as Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Airport while Kolhapur airport was renamed as Chhatrapati Rajaram Maharaj.
