    Explanation:
    Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan launched “Yodhav” (Warrior) mobile app at Kochi, Kerala, through which the public can inform police about drug abuse & its distribution.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Kerala
    Explanation:
    Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan launched “Yodhav” (Warrior) mobile app at Kochi, Kerala, through which the public can inform police about drug abuse & its distribution.

  13. Question 13 of 50
    13. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) “Statement on Developmental and Regulatory Policies” the central bank has decided to conduct Long Term Repo Operations (LTROs) for one-year and three-year tenors for up to a total amount of _______?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) 1 Lakh Crore
    Explanation:
    The RBI released “Statement on Developmental and Regulatory Policies” which stated about Long Term Repo Operations (LTROs) for improving monetary transmission. It is aimed at providing cheaper money to banks at the repo rate so that it can be used to boost credit growth. RBI decided to conduct Long Term Repo Operations (LTROs) for one-year and three-year tenors for up to a total amount of ₹ 1,00,000 crores at the policy repo rate. Simply, RBI is injecting Rs 1 lakh crore into the banking system through auctions with long term maturity periods (compared to one day repos) of 1 year and 3 years. LTRO is in addition to the existing LAF (Liquidity adjustment facility) and MSF (Marginal Standing Facility) operations. The current repo rate is 5.15%.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) 1 Lakh Crore
    Explanation:
    The RBI released “Statement on Developmental and Regulatory Policies” which stated about Long Term Repo Operations (LTROs) for improving monetary transmission. It is aimed at providing cheaper money to banks at the repo rate so that it can be used to boost credit growth. RBI decided to conduct Long Term Repo Operations (LTROs) for one-year and three-year tenors for up to a total amount of ₹ 1,00,000 crores at the policy repo rate. Simply, RBI is injecting Rs 1 lakh crore into the banking system through auctions with long term maturity periods (compared to one day repos) of 1 year and 3 years. LTRO is in addition to the existing LAF (Liquidity adjustment facility) and MSF (Marginal Standing Facility) operations. The current repo rate is 5.15%.

  14. Question 14 of 50
    14. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    With Which Bank the Government of India (GoI) signed loan agreement worth $450 Mn to support Atal Bhujal Yojana (ABHY) – National Groundwater Management Improvement Program in 7 Indian states?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) World Bank (WB)
    Explanation:
    The Government of India (GoI) and the World Bank(WB) have inked a $ 450 million (mn) loan agreement to support Atal Bhujal Yojana (ABHY) – National Groundwater Management Improvement Program that will be implemented by the Ministry of Jal Shakti in the states of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Haryana, Karnataka, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, and Uttar Pradesh (UP) and cover 78 districts.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) World Bank (WB)
    Explanation:
    The Government of India (GoI) and the World Bank(WB) have inked a $ 450 million (mn) loan agreement to support Atal Bhujal Yojana (ABHY) – National Groundwater Management Improvement Program that will be implemented by the Ministry of Jal Shakti in the states of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Haryana, Karnataka, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, and Uttar Pradesh (UP) and cover 78 districts.

  15. Question 15 of 50
    15. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who is the 1st Indian sportsman to win a Laureus world sports (Oscars of sports) award at 20th annual edition held at Berlin, Germany (Feb 17, 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Sachin Tendulkar
    Explanation:
    On February 17, 2020, Laureus World Sports Awards 2020 was held in Berlin, Germany.It was the 2nd Laureus World Sports Awards to take place in Berlin, following the 2016 ceremony which took place at the Messe Berlin. Indian former international cricketer Sachin Ramesh Tendulkar’s 2011 World Cup-winning moment was voted the Laureus Sporting Moment of 2000-2020. This moment of Sachin has been titled ‘Carried on the Shoulders of a Nation’. Vinesh Phogat is the 1st Indian to get Nominated for Laureus sport awards in 2019.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Sachin Tendulkar
    Explanation:
    On February 17, 2020, Laureus World Sports Awards 2020 was held in Berlin, Germany.It was the 2nd Laureus World Sports Awards to take place in Berlin, following the 2016 ceremony which took place at the Messe Berlin. Indian former international cricketer Sachin Ramesh Tendulkar’s 2011 World Cup-winning moment was voted the Laureus Sporting Moment of 2000-2020. This moment of Sachin has been titled ‘Carried on the Shoulders of a Nation’. Vinesh Phogat is the 1st Indian to get Nominated for Laureus sport awards in 2019.

  16. Question 16 of 50
    16. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per the US based think tank World population review’s report, what is the India’s rank in largest economy list 2019 with the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) value of $2.94 Trillion?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) 5
    Explanation:
    In accordance with the US-based think tank World Population Review, India has become the fifth-largest in the world with a GDP (Gross Domestic Product) of $2.94 trillion overtaking the UK (United Kingdom) and France in 2019. The size of the UK economy is $2.83 trillion and that of France is $2.71 trillion. The list has been topped by the United states (US) with $21.44 trillion GDP.
    Table showing Top 5 Largest Economies of World:

    Rank Country GDP
    1 United States (US) $21.44 trillion
    2 China $14.14 trillion
    3 Japan $5.15 trillion
    4 Germany $4 trillion
    5 India $2.94 trillion
    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) 5
    Explanation:
    In accordance with the US-based think tank World Population Review, India has become the fifth-largest in the world with a GDP (Gross Domestic Product) of $2.94 trillion overtaking the UK (United Kingdom) and France in 2019. The size of the UK economy is $2.83 trillion and that of France is $2.71 trillion. The list has been topped by the United states (US) with $21.44 trillion GDP.
    Table showing Top 5 Largest Economies of World:

    Rank Country GDP
    1 United States (US) $21.44 trillion
    2 China $14.14 trillion
    3 Japan $5.15 trillion
    4 Germany $4 trillion
    5 India $2.94 trillion
  17. Question 17 of 50
    17. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Department of Animal husbandry & Dairying under the Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying announced doubling of Milk processing capacities to _____ by 2025?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) 108 MT
    Explanation:
    The Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying under the Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying announced that the Government will facilitate the increase of milk processing capacity to 108 million metric tonne (MT) from 53.5 million metric tonne by 2025 .

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) 108 MT
    Explanation:
    The Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying under the Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying announced that the Government will facilitate the increase of milk processing capacity to 108 million metric tonne (MT) from 53.5 million metric tonne by 2025 .

  18. Question 18 of 50
    18. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian State government has launched ‘Nadu-Nedu’ scheme to modernize all the government hospital in 3 years with the allocated fund of 15,337cr?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Andhra Pradesh
    Explanation:
    Andhra Pradesh (AP) Chief Minister (CM) Yedugiri Sandinti JaganMohan Reddy launched the Nadu-Nedu scheme (roughly meaning then and now in Telugu) at STBC ground, Kurnool, AP. An amount of Rs 15,337 crore has been allocated to modernise all government (govt)hospitals in 3 years.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Andhra Pradesh
    Explanation:
    Andhra Pradesh (AP) Chief Minister (CM) Yedugiri Sandinti JaganMohan Reddy launched the Nadu-Nedu scheme (roughly meaning then and now in Telugu) at STBC ground, Kurnool, AP. An amount of Rs 15,337 crore has been allocated to modernise all government (govt)hospitals in 3 years.

  19. Question 19 of 50
    19. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Public Sector Bank (PSB) signed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Gujarat state government to facilitate Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) loans?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) State Bank of India (SBI)
    Explanation:
    In order to provide enough credit to entrepreneurs in the MSME (Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises) sector, the state Government of Gujarat has signed an MoU (memorandum of understanding) with State Bank of India (SBI), through which the bank will provide working capital to entrepreneurs aims to start new MSME within 15 days of making an application. In October 2019, The Gujarat state announced that MSME units will no longer be required to take various approvals to start operations for the initial 3 years period.They can start operations after getting an acknowledgment certificate from the state nodal agency by submitting ‘declaration of intent.’

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) State Bank of India (SBI)
    Explanation:
    In order to provide enough credit to entrepreneurs in the MSME (Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises) sector, the state Government of Gujarat has signed an MoU (memorandum of understanding) with State Bank of India (SBI), through which the bank will provide working capital to entrepreneurs aims to start new MSME within 15 days of making an application. In October 2019, The Gujarat state announced that MSME units will no longer be required to take various approvals to start operations for the initial 3 years period.They can start operations after getting an acknowledgment certificate from the state nodal agency by submitting ‘declaration of intent.’

  20. Question 20 of 50
    20. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which country has elected Ashraf Ghani as their president for second consecutive time in February 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Afghanistan
    Explanation:
    Afghanistan’s Incumbent president Ashraf Ghani Ahmadzai (70) wins second term as Afghanistan president as an Independent Candidate securing 50.64% votes in september 2019 election announced by the Election Commission of Afghanistan. Ashraf Ghani defeated Afghanistan’s Chief Executive Abdullah Abdullah, who gained 39.52% votes in the election.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Afghanistan
    Explanation:
    Afghanistan’s Incumbent president Ashraf Ghani Ahmadzai (70) wins second term as Afghanistan president as an Independent Candidate securing 50.64% votes in september 2019 election announced by the Election Commission of Afghanistan. Ashraf Ghani defeated Afghanistan’s Chief Executive Abdullah Abdullah, who gained 39.52% votes in the election.

  21. Question 21 of 50
    21. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who has been appointed as the Chairman of Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) by appointments committee of cabinet for 5 years or till the attainment of age 65 (Feb 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Supratim Bandyopadhyay
    Explanation:
    Supratim Bandyopadhyay was appointed as chairman of the PFRDA (Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority). The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet approved Supratim appointment for a period of 5 years from the date of assumption or till attaining the age of 65 years. He was the successor of Shri Pankaj Jain.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Supratim Bandyopadhyay
    Explanation:
    Supratim Bandyopadhyay was appointed as chairman of the PFRDA (Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority). The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet approved Supratim appointment for a period of 5 years from the date of assumption or till attaining the age of 65 years. He was the successor of Shri Pankaj Jain.

  22. Question 22 of 50
    22. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who has been appointed as next Chief Information Commissioner (CIC) of India Succeeding Sudhir Bhargava (Feb 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Bimal Julka
    Explanation:
    A high powered selection committee headed by Narendra Modi has selected former Information and Broadcasting Secretary Bimal Julka, current Information Commissioner became new Chief Information Commissioner in the Central Information Commission. Bimal Julka to succeed Sudhir Bhargava as CIC. Also, Sanjay Kothari, current Secretary to the President as the new Chief Vigilance Commissioner(CVC). Sanjay Kothari to succeed K. V. Chowdary as CVC.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Bimal Julka
    Explanation:
    A high powered selection committee headed by Narendra Modi has selected former Information and Broadcasting Secretary Bimal Julka, current Information Commissioner became new Chief Information Commissioner in the Central Information Commission. Bimal Julka to succeed Sudhir Bhargava as CIC. Also, Sanjay Kothari, current Secretary to the President as the new Chief Vigilance Commissioner(CVC). Sanjay Kothari to succeed K. V. Chowdary as CVC.

  23. Question 23 of 50
    23. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    According to Times Higher Education’s (THE) emerging economies University ranking 2020 which Indian University topped among Indian Universities in top 100?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru
    Explanation:
    According to the Times Higher Education’s (THE) Emerging Economies University Rankings 2020, which ranks a total of 533 universities from 47 countries, India has 11 institutes among world’s top 100 universities where Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru (Karnataka) emerged as India’s top-ranked institution by getting the rank 16th with the score 48.4. Tsinghua University in China has topped the list with the score of 83.8.
    Here’s the list of Top 3& Indian Universities in the ranking:

    Rank University Name Country Scores
    1 Tsinghua University China 83.8
    2 Peking University China 83
    3 Zhejiang University China 65.5
    Rank of Indian Universities in top 100
    16 Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru 48.4
    32 Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur 42.9
    34 Indian Institute of Technology Bombay 42.4
    38 Indian Institute of Technology Delhi 41.9
    58 Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee 38.4
    61 Indian Institute of Technology Indore 38.2
    63 Indian Institute of Technology Madras 37.7
    63 Indian Institute of Technology Ropar 37.7
    73 Institute of Chemical Technology 37.3
    77 Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur 37.1
    90 Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham 35.3
    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru
    Explanation:
    According to the Times Higher Education’s (THE) Emerging Economies University Rankings 2020, which ranks a total of 533 universities from 47 countries, India has 11 institutes among world’s top 100 universities where Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru (Karnataka) emerged as India’s top-ranked institution by getting the rank 16th with the score 48.4. Tsinghua University in China has topped the list with the score of 83.8.
    Here’s the list of Top 3& Indian Universities in the ranking:

    Rank University Name Country Scores
    1 Tsinghua University China 83.8
    2 Peking University China 83
    3 Zhejiang University China 65.5

  24. Question 24 of 50
    24. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    According to Economist Intelligence Unit’s (EIU) ‘The Worldwide Education for the Future Index (WEFFI) 2019 report, Finland topped the index and India’s rank in the Index is _________.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) 35
    Explanation:
    The Worldwide Education for The Future Index (WEFFI) 2019 ranked India in 35th position, whereas in 2018 it was ranked 40th position. The WEFFI report is created by The Economist Intelligence unit and commissioned by Yidan Prize foundation. The index is topped by Finland, followed by Sweden in second place and New Zealand in third place.
    Overall Ranking:

    Rank Economy
    35 India
    1 Finland
    2 Sweden
    3 New Zealand
    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) 35
    Explanation:
    The Worldwide Education for The Future Index (WEFFI) 2019 ranked India in 35th position, whereas in 2018 it was ranked 40th position. The WEFFI report is created by The Economist Intelligence unit and commissioned by Yidan Prize foundation. The index is topped by Finland, followed by Sweden in second place and New Zealand in third place.
    Overall Ranking:

    Rank Economy
    35 India
    1 Finland
    2 Sweden
    3 New Zealand
  25. Question 25 of 50
    25. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Garden Reach Shipbuilders and Engineers ltd (GRSE) delivered 4th anti-submarine warfare corvette to Indian Navy. The 4th anti-submarine warfare is named as ___________.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) INS Kavaratti
    Explanation:
    Kolkata based defence PSU (Public Sector Undertakings) GRSE (Garden Reach Shipbuilders and Engineers ltd.) has delivered its fourth and Last Anti-Submarine Warfare Corvette (ASWC) INS (Indian Naval Ship) Kavaratti to Indian Navy under Project-28. The first 3 ships under project-28 are INS Kamorta, INS Kadmatt and INS Kiltan (Participated in EX-MALABAR) are delivered to Indian Navy by GRSE.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) INS Kavaratti
    Explanation:
    Kolkata based defence PSU (Public Sector Undertakings) GRSE (Garden Reach Shipbuilders and Engineers ltd.) has delivered its fourth and Last Anti-Submarine Warfare Corvette (ASWC) INS (Indian Naval Ship) Kavaratti to Indian Navy under Project-28. The first 3 ships under project-28 are INS Kamorta, INS Kadmatt and INS Kiltan (Participated in EX-MALABAR) are delivered to Indian Navy by GRSE.

    Category: Current Affairs

    The report by EY (Ernst & Young Private Limited) titled “Today for tomorrow: realising the potential of Life Sciences 4.0” was released in 17th BioAsia 2020. The BioAsia 2020 held at?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Hyderabad, Telangana
    Explanation:
    BioAsia 2020 was held at the life science capital of India i.e. Hyderabad, Telangana from 17th- 19th February, 2020 on the theme “Today for Tomorrow”. It was hosted by the Government of Telangana in partnership with EY (Ernst & Young Private Limited). It was the 17th edition of the flagship international convention – BioAsia, whose CEO is Shakthi Nagappan. The event was attended by Piyush Goyal, Minister for Commerce and Industry. Switzerland is the partner country of the BioAsia 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Hyderabad, Telangana
    Explanation:
    BioAsia 2020 was held at the life science capital of India i.e. Hyderabad, Telangana from 17th- 19th February, 2020 on the theme “Today for Tomorrow”. It was hosted by the Government of Telangana in partnership with EY (Ernst & Young Private Limited). It was the 17th edition of the flagship international convention – BioAsia, whose CEO is Shakthi Nagappan. The event was attended by Piyush Goyal, Minister for Commerce and Industry. Switzerland is the partner country of the BioAsia 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Manipur
    Explanation:
    The northeast frontier railway construction has constructed India’s tallest railway pier bridge. It is built across the Makru river in the Tamenglong district, near Noney of Manipur.

  30. Question 30 of 50
    30. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    According to the 2nd advance estimates for crop year 2019-20 by Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers Welfare the food grain production is estimated at record of _______ (in million tonnes)?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 291.95
    Explanation:
    In accordance with the Second Advance Estimates for crop year 2019-20 by the Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers Welfare, the total foodgrain production in the country is estimated at record 291.95 million tonnes as compared to the production of foodgrain of 285.21 million tonnes in 2018-19. It should be noted that the 2019-20 production is also higher by 26.20 million tonnes than the previous five years’ (2013-14 to 2017-18) average production of foodgrain.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 291.95
    Explanation:
    In accordance with the Second Advance Estimates for crop year 2019-20 by the Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers Welfare, the total foodgrain production in the country is estimated at record 291.95 million tonnes as compared to the production of foodgrain of 285.21 million tonnes in 2018-19. It should be noted that the 2019-20 production is also higher by 26.20 million tonnes than the previous five years’ (2013-14 to 2017-18) average production of foodgrain.

  31. Question 31 of 50
    31. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    According to the report, “A future for the world’s children?” Commissioned by WHO–UNICEF–Lancet ‘Sustainability Index’ is topped by Burundi. What is rank of India in the index?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) 77
    Explanation:
    According to the report, “A future for the world’s children?” Commissioned by WHO–UNICEF–Lancet commissioned by the World Health Organization (WHO), United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) and The Lancet medical journal, India ranks 77th in terms of Sustainability Index and 131 in ‘Child Flourishing Index’ of Children’s Survival, health, education and Well-being. The Index was topped by Burundi and Qatar at bottom.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) 77
    Explanation:
    According to the report, “A future for the world’s children?” Commissioned by WHO–UNICEF–Lancet commissioned by the World Health Organization (WHO), United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) and The Lancet medical journal, India ranks 77th in terms of Sustainability Index and 131 in ‘Child Flourishing Index’ of Children’s Survival, health, education and Well-being. The Index was topped by Burundi and Qatar at bottom.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) India
    Explanation:

Palaniswami),the state government will celebrate the birth anniversary of former CM Jayaram Jayalalithaa on February 24 as ‘State Girl Child Protection Day’ in honor of the passion with which she worked for the well-being of children, especially girls.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Tamil Nadu
    Explanation:
    According to the Tamil Nadu (TN) Chief Minister(CM) ,Karuppa Gounder Palanisamy (known as Edappadi K. Palaniswami),the state government will celebrate the birth anniversary of former CM Jayaram Jayalalithaa on February 24 as ‘State Girl Child Protection Day’ in honor of the passion with which she worked for the well-being of children, especially girls.

  34. Question 34 of 50
    34. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The total outlay for Phase II of Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen) between 2020-2021 to 2024-2025 approved by cabinet is Rs. __________?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 1,40,881 crores
    Explanation:
    The Union Cabinet has approved the Phase II of the Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen), that will be implemented from 2020-21 to 2024-25 in a mission mode with a total outlay of Rs. 1,40,881 crores. Under this program, open defecation free (ODF) campaign will be continued with focus on ODF Plus and Solid and Liquid Waste Management (SLWM)will also be promoted.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 1,40,881 crores
    Explanation:
    The Union Cabinet has approved the Phase II of the Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen), that will be implemented from 2020-21 to 2024-25 in a mission mode with a total outlay of Rs. 1,40,881 crores. Under this program, open defecation free (ODF) campaign will be continued with focus on ODF Plus and Solid and Liquid Waste Management (SLWM)will also be promoted.

    38. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The 12-member ‘Technology Group’ formation proposal was approved by the cabinet on Feb 19, 2020. Who is the head of the ‘Technology Group’?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) K. VijayRaghavan
    Explanation:
    The Union Cabinet has approved the formation of 12-member “Technology Group” headed by Principal Scientific Adviser to Government of India (GoI), Prof K. VijayRaghavan. The 3 key pillars of the work of this group will include support on policy, procurement and R&D (Research & Development) proposals. This technology group will give better suggestions about latest technologies to the Government.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) K. VijayRaghavan
    Explanation:
    The Union Cabinet has approved the formation of 12-member “Technology Group” headed by Principal Scientific Adviser to Government of India (GoI), Prof K. VijayRaghavan. The 3 key pillars of the work of this group will include support on policy, procurement and R&D (Research & Development) proposals. This technology group will give better suggestions about latest technologies to the Government.

    Rank Institution Share Count
    1 Council of Scientific and industrial Research(CSIR) 142 87.74
    2 Indian Institute of science (IISC) 211 83.61
    3 Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR) 232 62.18

  40. Question 40 of 50
    40. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The American computer scientist Larry Tesler who passed away in February 2020 is the inventor of which function/command of computer?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Cut-Copy-Paste
    Explanation:
    Lawrence Gordon Tesler known as Larry Tesler was an American computer scientist who worked in the field of human–computer interaction and also the Inventor of Copy-Cut-Paste functions for computers in 1973 has passed away at the age of 74.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Cut-Copy-Paste
    Explanation:
    Lawrence Gordon Tesler known as Larry Tesler was an American computer scientist who worked in the field of human–computer interaction and also the Inventor of Copy-Cut-Paste functions for computers in 1973 has passed away at the age of 74.

  41. Question 41 of 50
    41. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Who is the Head of 15th Finance commission?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Nand Kishore (NK) Singh
    Explanation:
    The Fifteenth Finance Commission was constituted on 27 November 2017 against the backdrop of the abolition of Planning Commission (as also of the distinction between Plan and non-Plan expenditure) and the introduction of the goods and services tax (GST), which has fundamentally redefined federal fiscal relations. Nand Kishore (NK) Singh is chairman of 15th finance commission. YV Reddy is the chair of 14th finance commission.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Nand Kishore (NK) Singh
    Explanation:
    The Fifteenth Finance Commission was constituted on 27 November 2017 against the backdrop of the abolition of Planning Commission (as also of the distinction between Plan and non-Plan expenditure) and the introduction of the goods and services tax (GST), which has fundamentally redefined federal fiscal relations. Nand Kishore (NK) Singh is chairman of 15th finance commission. YV Reddy is the chair of 14th finance commission.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Ajay Tyagi
    Explanation:
    Ajay Tyagi was appointed chairman of Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) on 10 February 2017, replacing U K Sinha, and took charge of the chairman office on 1 March 2017. Headquarters of SEBI is Mumbai, Maharashtra.

    Armand Duplantis belongs to which sports?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Pole Vault
    Explanation:
    A 20-year-old US born Swedish based Pole vaulter Armand Duplantis has broken his own pole vault world record(6.17m) by clearing 6.18 m at the Indoor Grand Prix in Glasgow, Scotland. Prior to that French vaulter Renaud Lavillenie (2014) has set a record of 6.16 m.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Pole Vault
    Explanation:
    A 20-year-old US born Swedish based Pole vaulter Armand Duplantis has broken his own pole vault world record(6.17m) by clearing 6.18 m at the Indoor Grand Prix in Glasgow, Scotland. Prior to that French vaulter Renaud Lavillenie (2014) has set a record of 6.16 m.

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Indira Gandhi International Airport, Delhi
    Explanation:
    According to the GMR Group-led Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL), Delhi-based Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) has become the 1st airport in India to be completely free of single-use plastic usage.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Indira Gandhi International Airport, Delhi
    Explanation:
    According to the GMR Group-led Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL), Delhi-based Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) has become the 1st airport in India to be completely free of single-use plastic usage.

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Para Badminton
    Explanation:
    Badminton World Federation (BWF), the international governing body for the sport of badminton has organized Brazil Para badminton International 2020 in Sao Paulo, Brazil from 10 – 15 February 2020. India ended its campaign with 11 medals (4 Gold, 5 Silver,2 Bronze). Indian para-badminton player Pramod Bhagat from Odisha claimed 2 gold medals for India at the Championship.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Para Badminton
    Explanation:
    Badminton World Federation (BWF), the international governing body for the sport of badminton has organized Brazil Para badminton International 2020 in Sao Paulo, Brazil from 10 – 15 February 2020. India ended its campaign with 11 medals (4 Gold, 5 Silver,2 Bronze). Indian para-badminton player Pramod Bhagat from Odisha claimed 2 gold medals for India at the Championship.

  48. Question 48 of 50
    48. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    The Jaffna International Airport is located in which country?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Sri Lanka
    Explanation:
    India to sign Mou/agreement with Sri Lanka to develop the Jaffna’s Palaly airport (Feb 2020).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Sri Lanka
    Explanation:
    India to sign Mou/agreement with Sri Lanka to develop the Jaffna’s Palaly airport (Feb 2020).

  49. Question 49 of 50
    49. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Which is the 1st State/UT of India to run completely on renewable energy?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Ladakh
    Explanation:
    In line with the Union government’s plan to make Ladakh the first union territory (UT) to run completely on renewable energy and reduce the heavy dependence of diesel in the area, the ministry of new and renewable energy is planning to run hydrogen fuel celled buses in Leh.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Ladakh
    Explanation:
    In line with the Union government’s plan to make Ladakh the first union territory (UT) to run completely on renewable energy and reduce the heavy dependence of diesel in the area, the ministry of new and renewable energy is planning to run hydrogen fuel celled buses in Leh.

    Correct

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Uttarakhand
    Explanation:
    The 8th edition of Ganga Kayak Festival 2020 organised at Bhagirathi river at Uttarakhand.

https://affairscloud.com/february-current-affairs-2020-weekly-test-2/

---
  1. Question 1 of 50
    1. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Metro has become country’s 2nd largest operational metro recently (Feb 2020) with operational distance of 69.3 Km?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Hyderabad metro rail
    Explanation:
    Chief Minister of Telangana State Mr. K. Chandrashekhar Rao flagged off new Metro line from Jubilee Bus Station (JBS) to Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station (MGBS) connecting twin cities if Hyderabad and Secunderabad, and the stretch covering of 11-kms(Kilometers) becomes India’s 2nd largest Metro Rail Network of total operational distance of 69.2kms, only next to Delhi Metro Rail Network having an operational distance of 231kms. Karnataka’s Namma Metro rail network is India’s 3rd largest network of operational distance of 42.3kms.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Hyderabad metro rail
    Explanation:
    Chief Minister of Telangana State Mr. K. Chandrashekhar Rao flagged off new Metro line from Jubilee Bus Station (JBS) to Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station (MGBS) connecting twin cities if Hyderabad and Secunderabad, and the stretch covering of 11-kms(Kilometers) becomes India’s 2nd largest Metro Rail Network of total operational distance of 69.2kms, only next to Delhi Metro Rail Network having an operational distance of 231kms. Karnataka’s Namma Metro rail network is India’s 3rd largest network of operational distance of 42.3kms.

  2. Question 2 of 50
    2. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    According to Minister of Petroleum & Natural gas, Dharmendra Pradhan under Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) scheme the coverage of LPG has reached _____% as on Jan 1, 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 96.9
    Explanation:
    According to the Minister of Petroleum & Natural Gas, Shri.Dharmendra Debendra Pradhan, a total of about 27.5 crore LPG (Liquefied petroleum gas) or cooking gas connections in India & out of this, 8 crore connections have been provided under Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) scheme. Also the LPG coverage has reached 96.9 % as of January 1,2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 96.9
    Explanation:
    According to the Minister of Petroleum & Natural Gas, Shri.Dharmendra Debendra Pradhan, a total of about 27.5 crore LPG (Liquefied petroleum gas) or cooking gas connections in India & out of this, 8 crore connections have been provided under Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) scheme. Also the LPG coverage has reached 96.9 % as of January 1,2020.

  3. Question 3 of 50
    3. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian state has launched the Mukyamantri Parivar Samridhi Yojana which provides financial assistance of Rs. 6000 to families below the poverty line (BPL)?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Haryana
    Explanation:
    Chief Minister Mr. Manohar Lal Khattar and Deputy Chief Minister Mr. Dushyant Chautala of Haryana jointly launched Mukyamantri Parivar Samridhi Yojana scheme on the mark of successful 100 days of the present state government. The scheme is about providing financial assistance of Rs.6000 to the families below the poverty line.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Haryana
    Explanation:
    Chief Minister Mr. Manohar Lal Khattar and Deputy Chief Minister Mr. Dushyant Chautala of Haryana jointly launched Mukyamantri Parivar Samridhi Yojana scheme on the mark of successful 100 days of the present state government. The scheme is about providing financial assistance of Rs.6000 to the families below the poverty line.

  4. Question 4 of 50
    4. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Reserve Bank of India set to conduct Financial Literacy Week (FLW) from February 10 to 14, 2020. The Theme of FLW is?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Theme: “Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs)”
    Explanation:
    The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is going to conduct the Financial Literacy Week (FLW) 2020 from February 10 – February 14, 2020 based on the theme “Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs)”. The RBI will also launch a centralized mass media campaign in February 2020 to broadcast essential financial awareness messages to MSME entrepreneurs.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Theme: “Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs)”
    Explanation:
    The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is going to conduct the Financial Literacy Week (FLW) 2020 from February 10 – February 14, 2020 based on the theme “Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs)”. The RBI will also launch a centralized mass media campaign in February 2020 to broadcast essential financial awareness messages to MSME entrepreneurs.

  5. Question 5 of 50
    5. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Indian army major who developed world’s 1st bullet proof helmet which can stop AK-47 bullet from a distance less than 10 meters is ______?

    Correct

    Answer- 3) Anoop Mishra
    Explanation:
    Major in the Indian Army, Anoop Mishra has developed the world’s 1st bulletproof helmet which can stop an AK-47 bullet round from a distance of as less as 10 meters. The helmet is developed under the Indian Army’s “Abhedya” project.

    Incorrect

    Answer- 3) Anoop Mishra
    Explanation:
    Major in the Indian Army, Anoop Mishra has developed the world’s 1st bulletproof helmet which can stop an AK-47 bullet round from a distance of as less as 10 meters. The helmet is developed under the Indian Army’s “Abhedya” project.

  6. Question 6 of 50
    6. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Abigail Spears who recently handed a 22-month ban after failing dope test associated with which sports?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Tennis
    Explanation:
    American tennis player Abigail Spears (38 years) was given a 22 month doping ban by the International Tennis Federation(ITF). The ban was announced on spears after she failed the doping test from the 2019 US (United States) open match. The ban which was started from November 07, 2019, will end at midnight on September 6, 2021.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Tennis
    Explanation:
    American tennis player Abigail Spears (38 years) was given a 22 month doping ban by the International Tennis Federation(ITF). The ban was announced on spears after she failed the doping test from the 2019 US (United States) open match. The ban which was started from November 07, 2019, will end at midnight on September 6, 2021.

    7. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Roger Kahn who passed away recently (Feb 2020) is a ______?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Writer
    Explanation:
    American author Roger Kahn, known for his best-selling book in 1972 “The Boys of Summer” passed away at Nursing home in Mamaroneck, New York, U.S due to age related ailments announced by his son Gordon Jacques Kahn.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Writer
    Explanation:
    American author Roger Kahn, known for his best-selling book in 1972 “The Boys of Summer” passed away at Nursing home in Mamaroneck, New York, U.S due to age related ailments announced by his son Gordon Jacques Kahn.

    Explanation:
    On February 10, 2020, an 18-day long “Ek Bharat Shreshth Bharat Campaign”has has commenced across India with the aim of bringing various states into the thread of cultural unity. The campaign is being organised by the Information and Broadcasting Ministry, till 28th February 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Ministry of Information and Broadcasting
    Explanation:
    On February 10, 2020, an 18-day long “Ek Bharat Shreshth Bharat Campaign”has has commenced across India with the aim of bringing various states into the thread of cultural unity. The campaign is being organised by the Information and Broadcasting Ministry, till 28th February 2020.

    9. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who has won the International Olympic Committee’s (IOC) coaches lifetime achievement award in male category for the year 2019?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Pullela Gopichand
    Explanation:
    Pullela Gopichand, the Chief National coach for the Indian Badminton team has received the International Olympic Committee’s (IOC) Coaches Lifetime Achievement Award in Male Category of the year 2019 on the 3rd edition of International Olympics Committee Annual Awards, He is the 1st Indian coach to be Honoured with this Lifetime award by the Olympics Committee.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Pullela Gopichand
    Explanation:
    Pullela Gopichand, the Chief National coach for the Indian Badminton team has received the International Olympic Committee’s (IOC) Coaches Lifetime Achievement Award in Male Category of the year 2019 on the 3rd edition of International Olympics Committee Annual Awards, He is the 1st Indian coach to be Honoured with this Lifetime award by the Olympics Committee.

    10. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Ministry of External Affairs jointly with Government of India in association with governments of Australia and Indonesia conducted 4th edition of East Asia Summit (EAS) conference on maritime security cooperation 2020 at which Indian city?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Chennai
    Explanation:
    A 2-day long 4th edition of EAS (East Asia Summit) Conference on Maritime Security Cooperation 2020 was held in Chennai, Tamil Nadu (TN) from February 6-7 2020. The conference was jointly organised by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), Government of India (GoI) in association with the governments of Australia and Indonesia.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Chennai
    Explanation:
    A 2-day long 4th edition of EAS (East Asia Summit) Conference on Maritime Security Cooperation 2020 was held in Chennai, Tamil Nadu (TN) from February 6-7 2020. The conference was jointly organised by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), Government of India (GoI) in association with the governments of Australia and Indonesia.

    Explanation:
    A 2-day long 23rd edition of National Conference on e-Governance 2020 based on the theme “India 2020: Digital Transformation” with 6-sub themes was held at Mumbai, Maharashtra from February 7-8 2020. India FinTech Festival (IFF) 2020, India’s 1st home based global platform to promote Fintech innovation will be held in Mumbai, Maharashtra in March 2020. Medici is the program partner for the IFF 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Theme: “India 2020: Digital Transformation”
    Explanation:
    A 2-day long 23rd edition of National Conference on e-Governance 2020 based on the theme “India 2020: Digital Transformation” with 6-sub themes was held at Mumbai, Maharashtra from February 7-8 2020. India FinTech Festival (IFF) 2020, India’s 1st home based global platform to promote Fintech innovation will be held in Mumbai, Maharashtra in March 2020. Medici is the program partner for the IFF 2020.

    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Indian Army’s college of Military Engineering with a private firm developed low cost gunshot locators named _______ unveiled at 11th edition of DefExpo 2020 held at Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh.

    Correct

    Answer – 1) “Parth”
    Explanation:
    The Indian Army’s College of Military Engineering (CME), Pune, Maharashtra, jointly with a private firm developed gunshot locators named as “Parth”. The device is much cheaper than the imported ones. Major Anoop Mishra displayed the Parth gunshot locator at DefExpo 2020 held in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh (UP).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) “Parth”
    Explanation:
    The Indian Army’s College of Military Engineering (CME), Pune, Maharashtra, jointly with a private firm developed gunshot locators named as “Parth”. The device is much cheaper than the imported ones. Major Anoop Mishra displayed the Parth gunshot locator at DefExpo 2020 held in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh (UP).

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Haryana
    Explanation:
    On February 10, 2020 Kanwar Pal, Haryana education minister, launched ‘Reading Mission- Haryana’ to inculcate reading habits among students. Book review sessions will be organized by students once a month in educational institutions & 45-minute mass- reading Programme will be held on 4th Saturday of every month.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Haryana
    Explanation:
    On February 10, 2020 Kanwar Pal, Haryana education minister, launched ‘Reading Mission- Haryana’ to inculcate reading habits among students. Book review sessions will be organized by students once a month in educational institutions & 45-minute mass- reading Programme will be held on 4th Saturday of every month.

    Explanation:

  15. Question 15 of 50
    15. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has increased the minimum net worth criteria for pension fund managers from 25 crores to _____?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) 50 Crore
    Explanation:
    The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA), the regulator of the National Pension System (NPS), has doubled the minimum net worth criterion for pension fund managers to ₹50 crores from the ₹25 crore stipulated earlier. Provision has also been made for licenses to have indefinite validity.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) 50 Crore
    Explanation:
    The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA), the regulator of the National Pension System (NPS), has doubled the minimum net worth criterion for pension fund managers to ₹50 crores from the ₹25 crore stipulated earlier. Provision has also been made for licenses to have indefinite validity.

  16. Question 16 of 50
    16. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    According to the “Public Enterprises Survey 2018-19” prepared by Department of Public Enterprises (DPE) under Ministry of Heavy Industries & Public Enterprises, Which Indian Public Sector Undertaking (PSU) company is most profitable?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Oil and Natural Gas Corporation(ONGC)
    Explanation:
    According to “Public Enterprises Survey 2018-19”, which measures the annual economic condition of all central PSUs, ONGC, IOC and NTPC were the top three PSUs with profits in 2018-19. BSNL, Air India and MTNL saw the highest losses for the third consecutive year.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Oil and Natural Gas Corporation(ONGC)
    Explanation:
    According to “Public Enterprises Survey 2018-19”, which measures the annual economic condition of all central PSUs, ONGC, IOC and NTPC were the top three PSUs with profits in 2018-19. BSNL, Air India and MTNL saw the highest losses for the third consecutive year.

  17. Question 17 of 50
    17. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    India to host the 13th edition of Conference of Parties (CoP) of the Conservation of Migratory Species (CMS) supported by United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) in February 2020 at which Indian city?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Gandhinagar
    Explanation:
    The Union Minister for Environment, Forest and Climate Change Prakash Javadekar announced that the 13th Conference of Parties (COP) of the Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species (CMS) of Wild Animals, an Environment Treaty Supported by United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is going to hosted by India at Gandhinagar in Gujarat, from 17th – 22nd February 2020. The Great Indian Bustard (Gibi) is chosen as official Mascot of the 13th Conference of Parties (COP) of the Conservation of Migratory Species (CMS).

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Gandhinagar
    Explanation:
    The Union Minister for Environment, Forest and Climate Change Prakash Javadekar announced that the 13th Conference of Parties (COP) of the Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species (CMS) of Wild Animals, an Environment Treaty Supported by United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is going to hosted by India at Gandhinagar in Gujarat, from 17th – 22nd February 2020. The Great Indian Bustard (Gibi) is chosen as official Mascot of the 13th Conference of Parties (COP) of the Conservation of Migratory Species (CMS).

  18. Question 18 of 50
    18. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian defence manufacturing company signed pact with Larson & Toubro (L&T) for high tech drone manufacturing?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) ideaForge
    Explanation:
    Infrastructure giant Larsen & Toubro (L&T) has entered into a pact with ideaForge, domestic unmanned aerial vehicles manufacturer, to offer hi-tech drones and allied systems for defence use. They will also offer anti-drone solutions to counter the threat of malicious or unintended usage of drones.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) ideaForge
    Explanation:
    Infrastructure giant Larsen & Toubro (L&T) has entered into a pact with ideaForge, domestic unmanned aerial vehicles manufacturer, to offer hi-tech drones and allied systems for defence use. They will also offer anti-drone solutions to counter the threat of malicious or unintended usage of drones.

  19. Question 19 of 50
    19. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Ballistic missile which is being developed by the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) with the strike range of 200km?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Pranash
    Explanation:
    The Defence Research and Development Organization (DRDO) is developing Pranash, a new 200Km strike range ballistic missile which will be the advanced version of Prahaar, with the strike range of 150Km. Pranash is a single stage solid propellant surface-to-surface missile.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Pranash
    Explanation:
    The Defence Research and Development Organization (DRDO) is developing Pranash, a new 200Km strike range ballistic missile which will be the advanced version of Prahaar, with the strike range of 150Km. Pranash is a single stage solid propellant surface-to-surface missile.

    1 points

    The International Day for Women & Girls in Science 2020 with the theme “Investment in Women and Girls in Science for Inclusive Green Growth” celebrated on?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) February 11
    Explanation:
    International Day of Women & Girls in Science was observed on 11th February. The day was celebrated to achieve equal participation & access to women and girls in science. Theme: “Investment in Women and Girls in Science for Inclusive Green Growth”. The theme aims to encourage women and girls to opt for science.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) February 11
    Explanation:
    International Day of Women & Girls in Science was observed on 11th February. The day was celebrated to achieve equal participation & access to women and girls in science. Theme: “Investment in Women and Girls in Science for Inclusive Green Growth”. The theme aims to encourage women and girls to opt for science.

    Category: Current Affairs

    The 2nd BIMSTEC Disaster Management Exercise with the themes “A cultural heritage site that suffers severe damage in the Earthquake” & “Flooding or Strom” held at which Indian state (Feb 11-13, 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Odisha
    Explanation:
    The “2nd BIMSTEC Disaster Management Exercise-2020 (BIMSTEC DMEx-2020)” was held at Bhubaneswar/Puri, Odisha from 11-13 February, 2020 with themes “A cultural heritage site that suffers severe damage in the Earthquake” & “Flooding or Storm”. Organized by National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), on behalf of the Government of India, BIMSTEC DMEx-2020 was inaugurated by Chief Minister Odisha, Shri Naveen Patnaik on Feb 11, 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Odisha
    Explanation:
    The “2nd BIMSTEC Disaster Management Exercise-2020 (BIMSTEC DMEx-2020)” was held at Bhubaneswar/Puri, Odisha from 11-13 February, 2020 with themes “A cultural heritage site that suffers severe damage in the Earthquake” & “Flooding or Storm”. Organized by National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), on behalf of the Government of India, BIMSTEC DMEx-2020 was inaugurated by Chief Minister Odisha, Shri Naveen Patnaik on Feb 11, 2020.

  22. Question 22 of 50
    22. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian state hosts “CLIMFISHCON-2020” the International conference on climate change and ocean health in February 2020 with the theme “Climate change-effective adaptation for a secure Future”?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Kerala
    Explanation:
    The “CLIMISHCON” is a Four-day International Conference on changes in Hydrological cycle, Ocean ecosystem, Fisheries and Food security due to Global climate change. And the conference is going to be held at the Le Meridian Convention center in Kochi, Kerala from February 11 to February 14, 2020. the Theme for the conference is ‘Climate Change-Effective Adaptation for a Secure Future’.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Kerala
    Explanation:
    The “CLIMISHCON” is a Four-day International Conference on changes in Hydrological cycle, Ocean ecosystem, Fisheries and Food security due to Global climate change. And the conference is going to be held at the Le Meridian Convention center in Kochi, Kerala from February 11 to February 14, 2020. the Theme for the conference is ‘Climate Change-Effective Adaptation for a Secure Future’.

  23. Question 23 of 50
    23. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian state’s cabinet approves the Ground Water Act 2020 which aims to improve the falling level of the ground water level (Feb 2020)?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Uttar Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The Uttar Pradesh (UP) state Cabinet, chaired by its Chief Minister(CM) Yogi Adityanath has approved the Ground Water Act-2020 with the aim to improve the falling level of ground water. The cabinet has also approved the provisions of penalty and punishment against the person who contaminate the ground water level.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Uttar Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The Uttar Pradesh (UP) state Cabinet, chaired by its Chief Minister(CM) Yogi Adityanath has approved the Ground Water Act-2020 with the aim to improve the falling level of ground water. The cabinet has also approved the provisions of penalty and punishment against the person who contaminate the ground water level.

  24. Question 24 of 50
    24. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Union Ministry of Finance has released the notification of “Printing one-rupee currency note rules, 2020”. The One rupee note feature will have the signature of _____?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Atanu Chakraborty
    Explanation:
    The Union Ministry of Finance has notified ‘Printing of One Rupee Currency Notes Rules, 2020’ which will feature bilingual signature of Shri Atanu Chakraborty, Secretary, Ministry of Finance. It shall be rectangular 9.7 x 6.3 cms, with its paper made of 100% (cotton) rag content. The note will be 110 microns thick, weighing 90 GSM (Grams per Square Meter). The color of the note – pink green, the design surrounding will be of the Sagar Samrat, which is an oil exploration rig.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Atanu Chakraborty
    Explanation:
    The Union Ministry of Finance has notified ‘Printing of One Rupee Currency Notes Rules, 2020’ which will feature bilingual signature of Shri Atanu Chakraborty, Secretary, Ministry of Finance. It shall be rectangular 9.7 x 6.3 cms, with its paper made of 100% (cotton) rag content. The note will be 110 microns thick, weighing 90 GSM (Grams per Square Meter). The color of the note – pink green, the design surrounding will be of the Sagar Samrat, which is an oil exploration rig.

  25. Question 25 of 50
    25. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which team has won the Premier Badminton League (PBL) 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Bengaluru Raptors
    Explanation:
    Bengaluru Raptors, led by World Championships bronze medallist B. Sai Praneeth and World No. 2 Tai Tzu Ying has defeated the mixed doubles pair -Chan Peng Soon and Eom Hye Won of North Eastern Warriors to clinch the Premier Badminton League (PBL) title 2020 for the 2nd time in a row by 4–2 scores, performing best in the final of the league’s fifth season.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Bengaluru Raptors
    Explanation:
    Bengaluru Raptors, led by World Championships bronze medallist B. Sai Praneeth and World No. 2 Tai Tzu Ying has defeated the mixed doubles pair -Chan Peng Soon and Eom Hye Won of North Eastern Warriors to clinch the Premier Badminton League (PBL) title 2020 for the 2nd time in a row by 4–2 scores, performing best in the final of the league’s fifth season.

  26. Question 26 of 50
    26. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Cabinet gives in-principle approval to infusion of capital of amount Rs. ______ to three public sector general insurance companies named Oriental Insurance Company Limited (OICL), National Insurance Company Limited (NICL) and United India Insurance Company Limited (UIICL).

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 2500 Crore
    Explanation:
    Cabinet has given it’s in principle approval for capital infusion for three Public Sector General Insurance Companies (PSGICs), namely, Oriental Insurance Company Limited (OICL), National Insurance Company Limited (NICL) and United India Insurance Company Limited (UIICL). In this regard, Rs 2500 crore will be released reflecting critical financial position of these 3 PSGICs.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 2500 Crore
    Explanation:
    Cabinet has given it’s in principle approval for capital infusion for three Public Sector General Insurance Companies (PSGICs), namely, Oriental Insurance Company Limited (OICL), National Insurance Company Limited (NICL) and United India Insurance Company Limited (UIICL). In this regard, Rs 2500 crore will be released reflecting critical financial position of these 3 PSGICs.

  27. Question 27 of 50
    27. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which state police has implemented “Operation Nakail” allotting unique number for auto-rickshaw drivers to curb crime?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Uttar Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The Senior Superintendent of Police Kalanidhi Naithani has announced that the Ghaziabad police station in Uttar Pradesh has launched “Operation Nakail” under which all auto-rickshaw drivers are allotted with a unique 4-digit number and all the drivers should paint the number on front, left, right and rear side of the auto-rickshaw which is used identify/verify the driver later. Customers can file complaints using the number if they face any harassment.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Uttar Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The Senior Superintendent of Police Kalanidhi Naithani has announced that the Ghaziabad police station in Uttar Pradesh has launched “Operation Nakail” under which all auto-rickshaw drivers are allotted with a unique 4-digit number and all the drivers should paint the number on front, left, right and rear side of the auto-rickshaw which is used identify/verify the driver later. Customers can file complaints using the number if they face any harassment.

  28. Question 28 of 50
    28. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian bank has won “Most customer centric bank using technology” and “Best Payments Initiative” awards in 15th Indian Banks’ Associations’ Banking Technology awards 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) South Indian Bank
    Explanation:
    Indian Bank Association’s 15th Annual Banking Technology Conference, Expo and Awards 2020 held in Mumbai, Maharashtra in that South Indian Bank Has Bagged six Awards at the Banking Technology category. South Indian Bank emerged winner in the ‘Most Customer Centric Bank Using Technology’ category and runner up in the ‘Best Payments Initiative’ category for Small Banks.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) South Indian Bank
    Explanation:
    Indian Bank Association’s 15th Annual Banking Technology Conference, Expo and Awards 2020 held in Mumbai, Maharashtra in that South Indian Bank Has Bagged six Awards at the Banking Technology category. South Indian Bank emerged winner in the ‘Most Customer Centric Bank Using Technology’ category and runner up in the ‘Best Payments Initiative’ category for Small Banks.

  29. Question 29 of 50
    29. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which is the first Indian Aerospace Private firm to build the foreign owned satellites to the customers of Sweden and France?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Ananth Technologies
    Explanation:
    Aerospace firm Ananth technologies (ATL), Hyderabad, has signed a deal to build 6 foreign-owned satellites in India. This is the 1st time a private firm is making satellites for global customers. The firm will soon open a satellite making facility in Bengaluru. Ananth Technologies will build a foreign-owned satellite weighing between 50 kg and 250 kg for customers in Sweden and France & integrate satellites around 30% lower costs.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Ananth Technologies
    Explanation:
    Aerospace firm Ananth technologies (ATL), Hyderabad, has signed a deal to build 6 foreign-owned satellites in India. This is the 1st time a private firm is making satellites for global customers. The firm will soon open a satellite making facility in Bengaluru. Ananth Technologies will build a foreign-owned satellite weighing between 50 kg and 250 kg for customers in Sweden and France & integrate satellites around 30% lower costs.

    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    As per the world’s foremost financial site The Bakers’ ‘Top 500 Banking Brands 2020’ report which Indian Bank tops the list of ‘Highest increase in brand value’ among global banks?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) IndusInd Bank
    Explanation:
    As per the The Banker’s ‘Top 500 Banking Brands 2020’ report, India’s IndusInd Bank has topped the list of ‘Highest increase in brand value’ among global banks. It’s brand value saw an increase of 122% over the past 12 months. The bank reported total assets of Rs 3.1 lakh crore at the end of Q3 FY20.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) IndusInd Bank
    Explanation:
    As per the The Banker’s ‘Top 500 Banking Brands 2020’ report, India’s IndusInd Bank has topped the list of ‘Highest increase in brand value’ among global banks. It’s brand value saw an increase of 122% over the past 12 months. The bank reported total assets of Rs 3.1 lakh crore at the end of Q3 FY20.

    Explanation:
    Facebook launched “We Think Digital” Programme to provide digital literacy training to 1 lakh women across 7 states, including Uttar Pradesh (UP), West Bengal & Bihar. It has been launched in partnership with National Commission for Women (NCW) and Cyber Peace Foundation.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Facebook
    Explanation:
    Facebook launched “We Think Digital” Programme to provide digital literacy training to 1 lakh women across 7 states, including Uttar Pradesh (UP), West Bengal & Bihar. It has been launched in partnership with National Commission for Women (NCW) and Cyber Peace Foundation.

  33. Question 33 of 50
    33. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian City hosted the National water conference with the guidelines “Right to Water Act” and “Water Rights Act” in Feb 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Madhya Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh Shri Kamal Nath has inaugurated the National water conference at Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The conference is being held to finalize the guidelines of “Right to Water Act” or “Water Rights Act” and also discussed the water crisis in the state and also making the state a water-rich state.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Madhya Pradesh
    Explanation:
    The Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh Shri Kamal Nath has inaugurated the National water conference at Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The conference is being held to finalize the guidelines of “Right to Water Act” or “Water Rights Act” and also discussed the water crisis in the state and also making the state a water-rich state.

  34. Question 34 of 50
    34. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The World Radio Day (WRD) celebrated annually on February 13. What is the theme of WRD 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Theme: ‘Radio and Diversity’
    Explanation:
    February 13, 2020, World Radio Day (WRD) is celebrated all over the world with the theme “Radio and Diversity”. The day aims to highlights the unique power of radio which connects lives and brings people together from across the world.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Theme: ‘Radio and Diversity’
    Explanation:
    February 13, 2020, World Radio Day (WRD) is celebrated all over the world with the theme “Radio and Diversity”. The day aims to highlights the unique power of radio which connects lives and brings people together from across the world.

  35. Question 35 of 50
    35. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The Anti-Hijack Exercise was conducted by creating a mock situation to test the plans and procedures handled by various agencies during hijack threats using naval Dornier aircraft INS Dega held at which Indian City?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Visakhapatnam
    Explanation:
    The Anti-hijack exercise was conducted on February 12,2020 by creating a mock situation using a naval Dornier aircraft by INS Dega, (a naval air station of the Indian navy) at Visakhapatnam Airport, Andhra Pradesh and the main objective of the exercise was to test the plans and procedures handled by various agencies during hijack threats.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Visakhapatnam
    Explanation:
    The Anti-hijack exercise was conducted on February 12,2020 by creating a mock situation using a naval Dornier aircraft by INS Dega, (a naval air station of the Indian navy) at Visakhapatnam Airport, Andhra Pradesh and the main objective of the exercise was to test the plans and procedures handled by various agencies during hijack threats.

  36. Question 36 of 50
    36. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which is India’s 1st railway station to add 5-star hotel on the tracks built by famous hotel chain Leela group which will be completed by December 2020?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Gandhinagar railway station
    Explanation:
    According to the Chairman of the Indian Railway Board, Sri Vinod Kumar Yadav, Indian Railways has planned to prepare 5- Star Hotel on the tracks in Gandhinagar railway station of Gujarat to give passengers the experience of world class facilities.This will be the first experiment in India. The hotel, being built by the famous hotel chain Leela Group, could be completed by December 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Gandhinagar railway station
    Explanation:
    According to the Chairman of the Indian Railway Board, Sri Vinod Kumar Yadav, Indian Railways has planned to prepare 5- Star Hotel on the tracks in Gandhinagar railway station of Gujarat to give passengers the experience of world class facilities.This will be the first experiment in India. The hotel, being built by the famous hotel chain Leela Group, could be completed by December 2020.

    Category: Current Affairs

    Explanation:
    The Micro Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Department of government of Odisha has signed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) Bank Limited to provide smart banking solutions to Startups recognised by the Startup Odisha and will also extend incubation and acceleration support to all Startups, banking with them.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) HDFC Bank
    Explanation:
    The Micro Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Department of government of Odisha has signed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) Bank Limited to provide smart banking solutions to Startups recognised by the Startup Odisha and will also extend incubation and acceleration support to all Startups, banking with them.

  38. Question 38 of 50
    38. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who is the 1st Indian Hockey Player to receive the International Hockey Federation(FIH) player of the year award in 2019?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Manpreet Singh
    Explanation:
    Manpreet Singh Pawar (27), the captain of India men’s national field hockey team, has been selected as the FIH Men’s Player of the Year 2019 by the International Hockey Federation (FIH). With this he becomes the 1st Indian to receive this honor. At the same time, Netherlands women’s captain Eva de Goede (30) has been named as FIH Women’s Player of the Year 2019.
    Other winners:

    S.NO Award Name Won by
    1 FIH Men’s Goalkeeper of the Year 2019 Vincent Vanasch (Belgium)
    2 FIH Women’s Goalkeeper of the Year 2019 Rachael Lynch (Australia)
    3 FIH Men’s Coach of the Year 2019 Colin Batch (Australia)
    4 FIH Women’s Coach of the Year 2019 Alyson Regina Annan (Australia)
    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Manpreet Singh
    Explanation:
    Manpreet Singh Pawar (27), the captain of India men’s national field hockey team, has been selected as the FIH Men’s Player of the Year 2019 by the International Hockey Federation (FIH). With this he becomes the 1st Indian to receive this honor. At the same time, Netherlands women’s captain Eva de Goede (30) has been named as FIH Women’s Player of the Year 2019.
    Other winners:

    S.NO Award Name Won by
    1 FIH Men’s Goalkeeper of the Year 2019 Vincent Vanasch (Belgium)
    2 FIH Women’s Goalkeeper of the Year 2019 Rachael Lynch (Australia)
    3 FIH Men’s Coach of the Year 2019 Colin Batch (Australia)
    4 FIH Women’s Coach of the Year 2019 Alyson Regina Annan (Australia)

    Answer – 4) G Narayanan
    Explanation:
    Veteran ISRO (Indian Space Research Organization) space scientist G Narayanan has been named as the Chairman of NSIL (New Space India Limited), a Public Sector Unit (PSU) of Government of India.

  40. Question 40 of 50
    40. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    The National Aeronautics and Space Administration’s (NASA) robot which is going to study mineralogy of Mars during Mars 2020 rover mission is ________?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) SuperCam
    Explanation:
    NASA (National Aeronautics and Space Administration) is all set to send a new laser-toting robot named ‘SuperCam’ to Mars for studying mineralogy and chemistry from up to about 20 feet (7 meters) away, to help scientists in finding the signs of fossilized microbial life on the Red Planet i.e. Mars. SuperCam, a rock-vaporizing instrument is a part of seven instruments aboard the Mars 2020 rover.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) SuperCam
    Explanation:
    NASA (National Aeronautics and Space Administration) is all set to send a new laser-toting robot named ‘SuperCam’ to Mars for studying mineralogy and chemistry from up to about 20 feet (7 meters) away, to help scientists in finding the signs of fossilized microbial life on the Red Planet i.e. Mars. SuperCam, a rock-vaporizing instrument is a part of seven instruments aboard the Mars 2020 rover.

  44. Question 44 of 50
    44. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    What is the Maximum denomination of Currency Notes that can be printed in India?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Rs. 10,000
    Explanation:
    In terms of the provisions of the RBI Act 1934, notes in denominations higher than Rs 10000 cannot be issued. As per the Coinage Act, 1906, coins can be issued up to the denomination of Rs 1,000.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Rs. 10,000
    Explanation:
    In terms of the provisions of the RBI Act 1934, notes in denominations higher than Rs 10000 cannot be issued. As per the Coinage Act, 1906, coins can be issued up to the denomination of Rs 1,000.

  45. Question 45 of 50
    45. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Who is the 1st women match referee at global event in cricket?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) GS Lakshmi
    Explanation:
    India’s GS Lakshmi has been selected by the International Cricket Council (ICC) to referee in the upcoming Women’s T20 World Cup (21 February – 8 March, 2020) in Australia, making her the first-ever woman match referee in a global ICC event.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) GS Lakshmi
    Explanation:
    India’s GS Lakshmi has been selected by the International Cricket Council (ICC) to referee in the upcoming Women’s T20 World Cup (21 February – 8 March, 2020) in Australia, making her the first-ever woman match referee in a global ICC event.

  47. Question 47 of 50
    47. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Where is world’s largest railway station located at?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Uttar Pradesh
    Explanation:
    Gorakhpur Junction railway station has the world’s longest railway platform with total length of 1,366.33 m (4,483 ft). Gorakhpur station is also among the top hundred booking stations of Indian Railways. Recently Indian Railways’ started a unique initiative! To increase the plantation and natural cover across the Indian Railways network, flowering pots have been installed over the hydrant pipe at the Gorakhpur railway station.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Uttar Pradesh
    Explanation:
    Gorakhpur Junction railway station has the world’s longest railway platform with total length of 1,366.33 m (4,483 ft). Gorakhpur station is also among the top hundred booking stations of Indian Railways. Recently Indian Railways’ started a unique initiative! To increase the plantation and natural cover across the Indian Railways network, flowering pots have been installed over the hydrant pipe at the Gorakhpur railway station.

  48. Question 48 of 50
    48. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Where is the world’s highest-altitude site in the world where scientists have obtained a climate record from an ice core?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Dasuopu
    Explanation:
    Dasuopu — at 7,200 meters or 23,600 feet above sea level — is the highest-altitude site in the world where scientists have obtained a climate record from an ice core. Dasuopu is located on Shishapangma, one of the world’s 14 tallest mountains, which are all located in the Himalayas.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Dasuopu
    Explanation:
    Dasuopu — at 7,200 meters or 23,600 feet above sea level — is the highest-altitude site in the world where scientists have obtained a climate record from an ice core. Dasuopu is located on Shishapangma, one of the world’s 14 tallest mountains, which are all located in the Himalayas.

  49. Question 49 of 50
    49. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Amit Panghal is related to which sports?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) Boxing
    Explanation:
    Recently a 24-year-old world championship silver medalist boxer Amit Panghal has ranked No.1 in 52kg weight category in International Olympic Committee’s (IOC) Boxing Task Force rankings for Olympics Qualifiers with 420 points. Amit became the 1st Indian to claim a silver medal at the world championship, he also clinched gold medals at the 2018 commonwealth and Asian Games.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) Boxing
    Explanation:
    Recently a 24-year-old world championship silver medalist boxer Amit Panghal has ranked No.1 in 52kg weight category in International Olympic Committee’s (IOC) Boxing Task Force rankings for Olympics Qualifiers with 420 points. Amit became the 1st Indian to claim a silver medal at the world championship, he also clinched gold medals at the 2018 commonwealth and Asian Games.

  50. Question 50 of 50
    50. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Under the National Strategic Plan for TB Elimination, Government of India targets to end TB by which year?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) 2025
    Explanation:
    Under the National Strategic Plan for TB Elimination (NSP 2017-25), the central Government has targeted to end TB by 2025, in which it aims 80 % reduction in TB incidence and 90 % reduction in mortality by 2025 from a baseline of 2015.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) 2025
    Explanation:
    Under the National Strategic Plan for TB Elimination (NSP 2017-25), the central Government has targeted to end TB by 2025, in which it aims 80 % reduction in TB incidence and 90 % reduction in mortality by 2025 from a baseline of 2015.
