  43. Question 43 of 50
    43. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Name the world’s first patented heterogenous catalytic process that will convert multiple feed stocks into hydrocarbon liquid fuels, gas, carbon and water .

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Polycrack
    Explanation:
    Polycrack is the world’s first patented heterogenous catalytic process which converts multiple feed stocks into hydrocarbon liquid fuels, gas, carbon and water.This was in news recently because the East Coast Railway has commissioned the government’s first waste-to-energy plant which will turn ewaste and plastic into light diesel oil in 24 hours.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Polycrack
    Explanation:
    Polycrack is the world’s first patented heterogenous catalytic process which converts multiple feed stocks into hydrocarbon liquid fuels, gas, carbon and water.This was in news recently because the East Coast Railway has commissioned the government’s first waste-to-energy plant which will turn ewaste and plastic into light diesel oil in 24 hours.

  44. Question 44 of 50
    44. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Where was the world’s largest solar park, Pavagada Solar Park located ?

    Correct

    Answer – 4) Karnataka
    Explanation:
    Pavagada Solar Park, the world’s largest solar power park is located in Karnataka.This was seen in news recently because it becomes operational.It will generate 2050MW of clean energy .The park is located on land leased from farmers, utilising the drought-hit area & adding to farmers’ income.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Karnataka
    Explanation:
    Pavagada Solar Park, the world’s largest solar power park is located in Karnataka.This was seen in news recently because it becomes operational.It will generate 2050MW of clean energy .The park is located on land leased from farmers, utilising the drought-hit area & adding to farmers’ income.

  45. Question 45 of 50
    45. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Coronavirus, a new respiratory virus was 1st detected in which city ?

    Correct

    Answer – 3) Wuhan, China
    Explanation:
    Coronavirus, a new respiratory virus was 1st detected in Wuhan, China.Around 80 persons were died. Across China there have been 2,744 confirmed cases, of which 1,423 cases were in Hubei.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 3) Wuhan, China
    Explanation:
    Coronavirus, a new respiratory virus was 1st detected in Wuhan, China.Around 80 persons were died. Across China there have been 2,744 confirmed cases, of which 1,423 cases were in Hubei.

    Name the India’s first anti-satellite missile test (A-SAT) mission .

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Mission Shakthi
    Explanation:
    Mission Shakthi is the India’s 1st anti-satellite missile test (A-SAT) mission.It was launched by Defence Research Development Organisation (DRDO) in March 2019.This was seen in news recently because Anti-Satellite (A-SAT) Weapon System was displayed at Rajpath in the Republic Day parade .

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Mission Shakthi
    Explanation:
    Mission Shakthi is the India’s 1st anti-satellite missile test (A-SAT) mission.It was launched by Defence Research Development Organisation (DRDO) in March 2019.This was seen in news recently because Anti-Satellite (A-SAT) Weapon System was displayed at Rajpath in the Republic Day parade .

  50. Question 50 of 50
    50. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    David Beckham was seen in news recently, he is associated with which sport ?

    Correct

    Answer – 5) Cycling
    Explanation:
    David Beckham is associated with Cycling.He was seen in news recently because Prime Minister Narendra Modi talked about David Beckham, the 17-year-old cyclist from Andaman, who recently won a gold medal at Youth Games in Guwahati in 200m sprint event in cycling during his ‘Mann Ki Baat’ address . David got the name as his maternal uncle was a big fan of former England footballer David Beckham. David started cycling in 2017.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 5) Cycling
    Explanation:
    David Beckham is associated with Cycling.He was seen in news recently because Prime Minister Narendra Modi talked about David Beckham, the 17-year-old cyclist from Andaman, who recently won a gold medal at Youth Games in Guwahati in 200m sprint event in cycling during his ‘Mann Ki Baat’ address . David got the name as his maternal uncle was a big fan of former England footballer David Beckham. David started cycling in 2017.

https://affairscloud.com/january-current-affairs-2020-weekly-test-3/

---
  1. Question 1 of 50
    1. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Under which scheme, financial support of Rs. 15 lakh will be provided for one-time treatment of rare diseases as per the National draft policy on Rare Disease ?

    Correct

    Answer-3) Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi scheme
    Explanation:
    On January 14, 2020 the govt has released the National draft policy on Rare Disease in which financial support of Rs. 15 lakh will be provided under the Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi scheme for one-time treatment of rare diseases. Beneficiaries: The scheme benefit is limited to people below Poverty Line (BPL) and also 40% of the population eligible as per Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana(AB-PMJAY) norms for treatment in government tertiary hospitals only.

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi scheme
    Explanation:
    On January 14, 2020 the govt has released the National draft policy on Rare Disease in which financial support of Rs. 15 lakh will be provided under the Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi scheme for one-time treatment of rare diseases. Beneficiaries: The scheme benefit is limited to people below Poverty Line (BPL) and also 40% of the population eligible as per Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana(AB-PMJAY) norms for treatment in government tertiary hospitals only.

  2. Question 2 of 50
    2. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which bank has unveiled India’s largest API (Application Programming Interfaces) banking portal with nearly 250 APIs ?

    Correct

    Answer-3) ICICI Bank
    Explanation:
    On January 14, 2020, ICICI (Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India) bank,an Indian multinational banking and financial services company has launched India’s largest API (application programming interfaces) Banking portal called ‘ICICI Bank API Banking portal’(https://developer.icicibank.com/), which consists of 250 APIs & allows bank’s partner companies across the globe to sign up on it, create an application, select the application, test it out and get the sample code.

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) ICICI Bank
    Explanation:
    On January 14, 2020, ICICI (Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India) bank,an Indian multinational banking and financial services company has launched India’s largest API (application programming interfaces) Banking portal called ‘ICICI Bank API Banking portal’(https://developer.icicibank.com/), which consists of 250 APIs & allows bank’s partner companies across the globe to sign up on it, create an application, select the application, test it out and get the sample code.

  3. Question 3 of 50
    3. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Bank will provide $88 million loan pact for Assam Inland Water Transport Project ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) World Bank (WB)
    Explanation:
    On January 16, 2020 the Government of India, the Govt. of Assam and the World Bank(WB) signed a loan agreement of $88 million for implementation of the Assam Inland Water Transport Project (AIWTP) to modernize passenger ferry sector of Assam which runs on rivers including the Brahmaputra river in Assam. Loan signing: The loan agreement from the Indian side was signed by Sameer Kumar Khare, Additional Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance and by Mr Junaid Kamal Ahmad, Country Director (India), World Bank on behalf of the WB.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) World Bank (WB)
    Explanation:
    On January 16, 2020 the Government of India, the Govt. of Assam and the World Bank(WB) signed a loan agreement of $88 million for implementation of the Assam Inland Water Transport Project (AIWTP) to modernize passenger ferry sector of Assam which runs on rivers including the Brahmaputra river in Assam. Loan signing: The loan agreement from the Indian side was signed by Sameer Kumar Khare, Additional Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance and by Mr Junaid Kamal Ahmad, Country Director (India), World Bank on behalf of the WB.

  4. Question 4 of 50
    4. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who was appointed as the Chairman of 11 member Committee constituted to draft the National Water Policy ?

    Correct

    Answer-1) Dr Mihir Shah
    Explanation:
    On January 14, 2020 Dr Mihir Shah, professor at the Shiv Nadar University, Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh has been appointed as the chairman of the 11-member committee to draft the National Water Policy(NWP) and will have to submit the report within 6 months from the date of constitution. The committee was established by the Ministry of Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation of govt. of India.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Dr Mihir Shah
    Explanation:
    On January 14, 2020 Dr Mihir Shah, professor at the Shiv Nadar University, Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh has been appointed as the chairman of the 11-member committee to draft the National Water Policy(NWP) and will have to submit the report within 6 months from the date of constitution. The committee was established by the Ministry of Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation of govt. of India.

  5. Question 5 of 50
    5. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which country has appointed, Mikhail Vladimirovich Mishustin as Prime Minister on January 16, 2020 ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) Russia
    Explanation:
    On January 16, 2020 the Russian lawmakers have approved Russian President Vladimir Putin’s proposed candidate Mikhail Vladimirovich Mishustin, the head of the Federal Tax Service, as the next prime minister of the country. He replaced Dmitri Anatolyevich Medvedev who resigned from his post. Mass resignation: Putin proposed major changes in the constitution of Russia that would spread political power more evenly. Shorty after the proposed changes by Putin, Dmitri Medvedev resigned as Prime Minister (PM). Along with Medvedev the russian cabinet also made a mass resignation.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Russia
    Explanation:
    On January 16, 2020 the Russian lawmakers have approved Russian President Vladimir Putin’s proposed candidate Mikhail Vladimirovich Mishustin, the head of the Federal Tax Service, as the next prime minister of the country. He replaced Dmitri Anatolyevich Medvedev who resigned from his post. Mass resignation: Putin proposed major changes in the constitution of Russia that would spread political power more evenly. Shorty after the proposed changes by Putin, Dmitri Medvedev resigned as Prime Minister (PM). Along with Medvedev the russian cabinet also made a mass resignation.

  6. Question 6 of 50
    6. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian Cricketer, who was awarded as the ODI (One Day International) Cricketer of the Year for the first time in 16th edition of ICC awards 2019 .

    Correct

    Answer-2) Rohit Gurunath Sharma
    Explanation:
    On January 15, 2020, the International Cricket Council (ICC) has announced the list of ICC award winners for the year 2019 to recognise and honor the best international cricket players of the previous 12 months. Indian opener Rohit Gurunath Sharma became ODI (One Day International) Cricketer of the Year for the first time.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Rohit Gurunath Sharma
    Explanation:
    On January 15, 2020, the International Cricket Council (ICC) has announced the list of ICC award winners for the year 2019 to recognise and honor the best international cricket players of the previous 12 months. Indian opener Rohit Gurunath Sharma became ODI (One Day International) Cricketer of the Year for the first time.

  7. Question 7 of 50
    7. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who heads the Special Investigation Team (SIT), that probed the 1984 anti-sikh riots cases ?

    Correct

    Answer-3) SN Dhingra
    Explanation:
    On January 15,2020 The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing of the 1984 anti-sikh riots cases was headed by retired Delhi High Court judge Justice SN Dhingra. The Government has accepted the guidance of the special investigation team that had investigated 186 cases of the 1984 anti-sikh riots and appropriate actions will be taken under law. Solicitor General Tushor Mehta, appearing on behalf of the centre comprising of Chief Justice SA Bobde and Justices BR Gavai and Surya kant accepted the SIT recommendations and take appropriate action.

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) SN Dhingra
    Explanation:
    On January 15,2020 The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing of the 1984 anti-sikh riots cases was headed by retired Delhi High Court judge Justice SN Dhingra. The Government has accepted the guidance of the special investigation team that had investigated 186 cases of the 1984 anti-sikh riots and appropriate actions will be taken under law. Solicitor General Tushor Mehta, appearing on behalf of the centre comprising of Chief Justice SA Bobde and Justices BR Gavai and Surya kant accepted the SIT recommendations and take appropriate action.

  8. Question 8 of 50
    8. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    In which Air force Station, India’s 1st Sukhoi-30 fighter squadron will be inducted ?

    Correct

    Answer-4) Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu (TN)
    Explanation:
    On 12 January 2020,As per the Chief of the Indian Air Force (IAF), Air Chief Marshal Rakesh Kumar Singh (RKS) Bhadauria,the induction ceremony of a Sukhoi-30 MKIs (Su-30 MKI) squadron in the southern skies will take place in the presence of Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at Thanjavur in Tamil Nadu (TN) on January 20,2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer-4) Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu (TN)
    Explanation:
    On 12 January 2020,As per the Chief of the Indian Air Force (IAF), Air Chief Marshal Rakesh Kumar Singh (RKS) Bhadauria,the induction ceremony of a Sukhoi-30 MKIs (Su-30 MKI) squadron in the southern skies will take place in the presence of Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at Thanjavur in Tamil Nadu (TN) on January 20,2020.

  9. Question 9 of 50
    9. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian tele-communication satellite that was launched from Guiana space center, French Guiana,South America to provide high quality television, telecommunications and broadcasting services .

    Correct

    Answer-1) GSAT-30(Geosynchronous Satellites)
    Explanation:
    On January 17,2020 Arianespace, French Company launched a pair of communication satellites as its first launch in 2020. Ariane 5 rocket consists of ISRO(Indian Space Research Organization) communication satellite GSAT-30(Geosynchronous Satellites) and EUTELSAT KONNECT for the European satellite operator Eutelsat (European Organization of Telecommunication by Satellite S.A) from Guiana space center, French Guiana,South America. AIM:To provide high quality television, telecommunications and broadcasting services.The 3,357 Kg GSAT-30 derives its heritage from ISRO’s earlier INSAT/GSAT (Indian National Satellites/Geosynchronous Satellites) satellite series and will replace INSAT-4A in orbit equipped with 12 C(covers Gulf countries, Asian and Australian countries) and 12 Ku band(covers Indian mainland and island) transponders.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) GSAT-30(Geosynchronous Satellites)
    Explanation:
    On January 17,2020 Arianespace, French Company launched a pair of communication satellites as its first launch in 2020. Ariane 5 rocket consists of ISRO(Indian Space Research Organization) communication satellite GSAT-30(Geosynchronous Satellites) and EUTELSAT KONNECT for the European satellite operator Eutelsat (European Organization of Telecommunication by Satellite S.A) from Guiana space center, French Guiana,South America. AIM:To provide high quality television, telecommunications and broadcasting services.The 3,357 Kg GSAT-30 derives its heritage from ISRO’s earlier INSAT/GSAT (Indian National Satellites/Geosynchronous Satellites) satellite series and will replace INSAT-4A in orbit equipped with 12 C(covers Gulf countries, Asian and Australian countries) and 12 Ku band(covers Indian mainland and island) transponders.

  10. Question 10 of 50
    10. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the villages of Uttar Pradesh, that is set to become India’s first ‘Model Sports villages’ as a part of ‘Adarsh Khel Gram’ program of Institute of Management Technology (IMT) Ghaziabad, UP along with Non Governmental Organization,‘ Sports: A Way of Life’ .

    Correct

    Answer-4) Bahadurpur and Kheri Viran
    Explanation:
    On January 16, 2020 Two villages namely Bahadurpur and Kheri Viran of Uttar Pradesh (UP) has set to become India’s first ‘Model Sports villages’ as a part of Institute of Management Technology (IMT) Ghaziabad, UP ‘Adarsh Khel Gram’ program in association with NGO(Non Governmental Organization)‘ Sports: A Way of Life’ to evolve sports culture and increase sports literacy in the country.

    Incorrect

    Answer-4) Bahadurpur and Kheri Viran
    Explanation:
    On January 16, 2020 Two villages namely Bahadurpur and Kheri Viran of Uttar Pradesh (UP) has set to become India’s first ‘Model Sports villages’ as a part of Institute of Management Technology (IMT) Ghaziabad, UP ‘Adarsh Khel Gram’ program in association with NGO(Non Governmental Organization)‘ Sports: A Way of Life’ to evolve sports culture and increase sports literacy in the country.

  11. Question 11 of 50
    11. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of India for the year 2019-20, as per United Nations (UN)’s ‘World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP) 2020’ report ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) 5.7%
    Explanation:
    On January 16, 2020, According to the ‘World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP) 2020’ report released by the United Nations (UN), it has slashed India’s GDP (Gross Domestic Product) growth forecast for the year 2019-20 by 1.9% to 5.7%. Earlier in 2019, it had projected GDP growth rate of 7.6% for FY 2019-20. Similarly, on January 18, 2020, United Nations (UN), has revised the India’s GDP (Gross Domestic Product) growth forecast for the year 2019-20 to 5%.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) 5.7%
    Explanation:
    On January 16, 2020, According to the ‘World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP) 2020’ report released by the United Nations (UN), it has slashed India’s GDP (Gross Domestic Product) growth forecast for the year 2019-20 by 1.9% to 5.7%. Earlier in 2019, it had projected GDP growth rate of 7.6% for FY 2019-20. Similarly, on January 18, 2020, United Nations (UN), has revised the India’s GDP (Gross Domestic Product) growth forecast for the year 2019-20 to 5%.

  12. Question 12 of 50

    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What was the theme of the 10th edition of World Future Energy Summit (WFES) 2020 ?

    Correct

    Answer-1) Theme – “Rethinking Global Consumption, Production, and Investment”
    Explanation:
    Recently the 10th edition of World Future Energy Summit (WFES)2020 hosted by Masdar renewable energy company, was held at Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates(UAE) from January 13-16, 2020. The theme for the year 2020 was “Rethinking Global Consumption, Production, and Investment”.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Theme – “Rethinking Global Consumption, Production, and Investment”
    Explanation:
    Recently the 10th edition of World Future Energy Summit (WFES)2020 hosted by Masdar renewable energy company, was held at Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates(UAE) from January 13-16, 2020. The theme for the year 2020 was “Rethinking Global Consumption, Production, and Investment”.

  13. Question 13 of 50
    13. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the largest airborne exercise conducted by Indian Army in the northeastern theatre recently .

    Correct

    Answer-2) Winged Raider
    Explanation:
    On January 10, 2020 the Indian Army(IA) conducted its biggest airborne exercise ‘Winged Raider’. The exercise comprised of more than 500 soldiers of Special Forces troops in the northeastern theatre and involved all kinds of air transport platforms of the Indian Air Force (IAF). The name Winged Raider was chosen due to its multidimensional nature of the exercise and demonstrated the operational readiness of paratroopers.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Winged Raider
    Explanation:
    On January 10, 2020 the Indian Army(IA) conducted its biggest airborne exercise ‘Winged Raider’. The exercise comprised of more than 500 soldiers of Special Forces troops in the northeastern theatre and involved all kinds of air transport platforms of the Indian Air Force (IAF). The name Winged Raider was chosen due to its multidimensional nature of the exercise and demonstrated the operational readiness of paratroopers.

  14. Question 14 of 50
    14. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who received the highest civilian honour of Australia, ‘Order of Australia honour’?

    Correct

    Answer-2) Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
    Explanation:
    On January 17,2020 Australia has conferred its highest civilian honour, the Order of Australia honour to Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, founder and chairperson of bio-pharmaceutical company Biocon and appointed as an honorary member in the general division of the Order of Australia by Australia’s High Commissioner to India Ms. Harinder Sidhu at a ceremony in Leela Palace, Bengaluru, Karnataka. She is the fourth Indian citizen to be awarded Australia’s highest civilian honour. Award contribution: The award is given to foreign nationals who have extraordinarily contributed to Australia or for humanity.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
    Explanation:
    On January 17,2020 Australia has conferred its highest civilian honour, the Order of Australia honour to Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, founder and chairperson of bio-pharmaceutical company Biocon and appointed as an honorary member in the general division of the Order of Australia by Australia’s High Commissioner to India Ms. Harinder Sidhu at a ceremony in Leela Palace, Bengaluru, Karnataka. She is the fourth Indian citizen to be awarded Australia’s highest civilian honour. Award contribution: The award is given to foreign nationals who have extraordinarily contributed to Australia or for humanity.

  15. Question 15 of 50
    15. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who was appointed as the new Vice Chief of Army Staff (VCOAS) ?

    Correct

    Answer-1) Satinder Kumar Saini
    Explanation:
    On January 15, 2020 Southern Army Commander Lieutenant General Satinder Kumar Saini appointed as the new Vice Chief of Army Staff (VCOAS). He will take charge on January 25, 2020. He succeeded Lieutenant General Manoj Mukund Naravane, who was promoted as the Chief of Army Staff.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Satinder Kumar Saini
    Explanation:
    On January 15, 2020 Southern Army Commander Lieutenant General Satinder Kumar Saini appointed as the new Vice Chief of Army Staff (VCOAS). He will take charge on January 25, 2020. He succeeded Lieutenant General Manoj Mukund Naravane, who was promoted as the Chief of Army Staff.

  16. Question 16 of 50
    16. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What was the theme of the “28th edition of the New Delhi World Book Fair 2020 (NDWBF 2020)” ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) Theme – ‘Gandhi: TheWriters’ Writer’
    Explanation:
    The 28th edition of the New Delhi World Book Fair 2020 (NDWBF 2020) was held at Pragati Maidan in New Delhi from January 4-12, 2020. It was inaugurated by Union Minister of Human Resource Development (MHRD) Shri Ramesh Pokhriyal ‘Nishank’. The theme of NDWBF 2020 book fair was ‘Gandhi: TheWriters’ Writer’ celebrating 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi. Since 2013, the NDWBF is organised by National Book Trust (NBT) in association with India Trade Promotion Organisation (ITPO), Ministry of Commerce(MoC) under Memorandum of Understanding(MoU) with ITPO.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Theme – ‘Gandhi: TheWriters’ Writer’
    Explanation:
    The 28th edition of the New Delhi World Book Fair 2020 (NDWBF 2020) was held at Pragati Maidan in New Delhi from January 4-12, 2020. It was inaugurated by Union Minister of Human Resource Development (MHRD) Shri Ramesh Pokhriyal ‘Nishank’. The theme of NDWBF 2020 book fair was ‘Gandhi: TheWriters’ Writer’ celebrating 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi. Since 2013, the NDWBF is organised by National Book Trust (NBT) in association with India Trade Promotion Organisation (ITPO), Ministry of Commerce(MoC) under Memorandum of Understanding(MoU) with ITPO.

  17. Question 17 of 50
    17. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the rank of India as per the World Economic Forum (WEF)’s report “The Global Social Mobility Report 2020: Equality, Opportunity and a New Economic Imperative” ?

    Correct

    Answer-3) 76th
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 the World Economic Forum (WEF) released 1st edition of a report titled “The Global Social Mobility Report 2020: Equality, Opportunity and a New Economic Imperative”. The global social mobility index (GSMI) of 82 countries were launched in this report. As per the Index, India ranked in the 76th position with a score of 42.7.

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) 76th
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 the World Economic Forum (WEF) released 1st edition of a report titled “The Global Social Mobility Report 2020: Equality, Opportunity and a New Economic Imperative”. The global social mobility index (GSMI) of 82 countries were launched in this report. As per the Index, India ranked in the 76th position with a score of 42.7.

  18. Question 18 of 50
    18. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian city is connected with Biratnagar of Nepal through 2nd Integrated Check Post (ICP) inaugurated by Prime Minister (PM) of India, Shri Narendra Modi along with the PM of Nepal Shri Khadga Prasad Sharma Oli ?

    Correct

    Answer-3) Jogbani (Bihar)
    Explanation:
    On January 21, 2020 the Indian Prime Minister(PM) Shri Narendra Modi along with the PM of Nepal Shri Khadga Prasad Sharma Oli jointly inaugurated the 2nd Integrated Check Post (ICP) at Jogbani – Biratnagar of India (in Bihar state) and Nepal respectively through video conference. Jogbani – Biratnagar acts as an important trade point between the two nations and is equipped with modern facilities.

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) Jogbani (Bihar)
    Explanation:
    On January 21, 2020 the Indian Prime Minister(PM) Shri Narendra Modi along with the PM of Nepal Shri Khadga Prasad Sharma Oli jointly inaugurated the 2nd Integrated Check Post (ICP) at Jogbani – Biratnagar of India (in Bihar state) and Nepal respectively through video conference. Jogbani – Biratnagar acts as an important trade point between the two nations and is equipped with modern facilities.

  19. Question 19 of 50
    19. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the city, that will be made as the judicial capital of Andhra Pradesh if “Andhra Pradesh Decentralization and Inclusive development of All Regions Bill-2020” gets approval .

    Correct

    Answer-1) Kurnool
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 Andhra Pradesh (AP) Government has passed Andhra Pradesh Decentralization and Inclusive development of All Regions Bill-2020 for the tri-capital system. The bill proposes to make Visakhapatnam as the executive capital, Amaravati as the legislative capital and Kurnool as the judicial capital of Andhra Pradesh.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Kurnool
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 Andhra Pradesh (AP) Government has passed Andhra Pradesh Decentralization and Inclusive development of All Regions Bill-2020 for the tri-capital system. The bill proposes to make Visakhapatnam as the executive capital, Amaravati as the legislative capital and Kurnool as the judicial capital of Andhra Pradesh.

  20. Question 20 of 50
    20. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth of India for the year 2019 as per the International Monetary Fund (IMF), revised from 6.1% on January 20, 2020 ?

    Correct

    Answer-1) 4.8 %
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020,The International Monetary Fund (IMF),an international organization, in its World Economic Outlook 2020, has reduced India’s economic growth forecast for 2019 to 4.8 % from 6.1% predicted earlier in October 2019. The growth projections have been lowered, citing pressure from non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) and weak income growth in rural India. On January 22, 2020, India Ratings and Research (Ind-Ra),the Indian subsidiary of Fitch group, has estimated the Indian economy to grow at a 5.5% rate in fiscal year-FY 21 (2020-21), which is slightly higher than the 5% GDP(Gross Domestic Product) growth rate estimate for FY20 (2019-20).

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) 4.8 %
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020,The International Monetary Fund (IMF),an international organization, in its World Economic Outlook 2020, has reduced India’s economic growth forecast for 2019 to 4.8 % from 6.1% predicted earlier in October 2019. The growth projections have been lowered, citing pressure from non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) and weak income growth in rural India. On January 22, 2020, India Ratings and Research (Ind-Ra),the Indian subsidiary of Fitch group, has estimated the Indian economy to grow at a 5.5% rate in fiscal year-FY 21 (2020-21), which is slightly higher than the 5% GDP(Gross Domestic Product) growth rate estimate for FY20 (2019-20).

  21. Question 21 of 50
    21. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who was appointed as the Managing Director (MD) of the State Bank of India (SBI) for a period of three years on January 20, 2020 ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) Challa Sreenivasulu Setty
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 the Government of India (GOI) has appointed Challa Sreenivasulu Setty as the Managing Director (MD) of the State Bank of India (SBI) for a period of three years. He is currently serving as the Deputy Managing Director (DMD) of the SBI.The proposal of the Department of Financial Services (DFS), Ministry of Finance, GOI to appoint Setty as the MD of the SBI is approved by the Appointment Committee of Cabinet (ACC).

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Challa Sreenivasulu Setty
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 the Government of India (GOI) has appointed Challa Sreenivasulu Setty as the Managing Director (MD) of the State Bank of India (SBI) for a period of three years. He is currently serving as the Deputy Managing Director (DMD) of the SBI.The proposal of the Department of Financial Services (DFS), Ministry of Finance, GOI to appoint Setty as the MD of the SBI is approved by the Appointment Committee of Cabinet (ACC).

  22. Question 22 of 50
    22. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who was appointed as the Managing Director (MD) & Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Bank of Baroda (BoB) on January 20, 2020 ?

    Correct

    Answer-5) Sanjiv Chadha
    Explanation:
    Sanjiv Chadha was appointed as the Managing Director(MD) & Chief Executive Officer(CEO) of Bank of Baroda on January 20, 2020 . He served as the Deputy Managing Director (DMD) at State Bank of India (SBI) and will replace P.S. Jayakumar whose term came to an end after his 1 year extension ended in October 2019. Atanu Kumar Das was appointed as the Managing Director(MD) & Chief Executive Officer(CEO) of Bank of India on January 20,2020. Atanu Kumar Das served as the Executive Director (ED) of the Bank of India (BOI) and hence promoted as the MD & CEO of Bank of India (BOI) following its vacancy since july last year. Lingam Venkat Prabhakar was appointed as the Managing Director (MD) & Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Canara Bank on January 20, 2020. Prabhakar served as the Executive Director (ED) of the Punjab National Bank (PNB) and he will be replacing R A Sankara Narayanan who will be retired at the end of January 31, 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer-5) Sanjiv Chadha
    Explanation:
    Sanjiv Chadha was appointed as the Managing Director(MD) & Chief Executive Officer(CEO) of Bank of Baroda on January 20, 2020 . He served as the Deputy Managing Director (DMD) at State Bank of India (SBI) and will replace P.S. Jayakumar whose term came to an end after his 1 year extension ended in October 2019. Atanu Kumar Das was appointed as the Managing Director(MD) & Chief Executive Officer(CEO) of Bank of India on January 20,2020. Atanu Kumar Das served as the Executive Director (ED) of the Bank of India (BOI) and hence promoted as the MD & CEO of Bank of India (BOI) following its vacancy since july last year. Lingam Venkat Prabhakar was appointed as the Managing Director (MD) & Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Canara Bank on January 20, 2020. Prabhakar served as the Executive Director (ED) of the Punjab National Bank (PNB) and he will be replacing R A Sankara Narayanan who will be retired at the end of January 31, 2020.

  23. Question 23 of 50
    23. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian Cricketer, who became the fastest batsman to reach 11,000 runs in ODI cricket & also became the fastest cricketer to complete 5000 runs in ODIs as skipper surpassing MS Dhoni record .

    Correct

    Answer-2) Virat Kohli
    Explanation:
    Indian captain Virat Kohli broke the record of former captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni in the 3rd and final match of the series against Australia held in Bengaluru, Karnataka. He became the fastest captain to complete 5000 runs in ODIs. He achieved this feat by hitting a four off Mitchell Starc. Dhoni had scored 5000 runs in 127 innings. At the same time, Kohli reached in his feat by just 82nd innings. Ricky Ponting of Australia arrived in 131 innings. Indian captain Virat Kohli also held the record for being the fastest captain to score 11,000 international runs. He scored 11,208 international runs as captain, surpassed the previous record held by MS Dhoni with 11,207 runs. Kohli has played 199 innings as captain, while Dhoni had played 330.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Virat Kohli
    Explanation:
    Indian captain Virat Kohli broke the record of former captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni in the 3rd and final match of the series against Australia held in Bengaluru, Karnataka. He became the fastest captain to complete 5000 runs in ODIs. He achieved this feat by hitting a four off Mitchell Starc. Dhoni had scored 5000 runs in 127 innings. At the same time, Kohli reached in his feat by just 82nd innings. Ricky Ponting of Australia arrived in 131 innings. Indian captain Virat Kohli also held the record for being the fastest captain to score 11,000 international runs. He scored 11,208 international runs as captain, surpassed the previous record held by MS Dhoni with 11,207 runs. Kohli has played 199 innings as captain, while Dhoni had played 330.

  24. Question 24 of 50
    24. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the first Airport in India, that acquired Disabled Aircraft Recovery Equipment (DARE) from KUNZ GmbH to recover disabled aircraft up to Code F category and enabling faster resumption of operations .

    Correct

    Answer-1) Kempegowda International Airport (KIA)
    Explanation:
    On 14th January 2020, An agreement was signed by The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) to acquire Disabled Aircraft Recovery Equipment (DARE) to enhance operational capabilities and to reduce downtime during runway emergencies. The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) has signed an agreement with a German based company KUNZ GmbH to manufacture, supply, commission and maintain the specialized equipment for Kempegowda International Airport (KIA), Banglore.This will make Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) the first airport in the region to acquire such facility to recover disabled aircraft up to Code F category and enabling faster resumption of operations.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Kempegowda International Airport (KIA)
    Explanation:
    On 14th January 2020, An agreement was signed by The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) to acquire Disabled Aircraft Recovery Equipment (DARE) to enhance operational capabilities and to reduce downtime during runway emergencies. The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) has signed an agreement with a German based company KUNZ GmbH to manufacture, supply, commission and maintain the specialized equipment for Kempegowda International Airport (KIA), Banglore.This will make Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) the first airport in the region to acquire such facility to recover disabled aircraft up to Code F category and enabling faster resumption of operations.

  25. Question 25 of 50
    25. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the first state in India that implemented agricultural land leasing policy recently .

    Correct

    Answer-2) Uttarakhand
    Explanation:
    Uttarakhand has become the first state in India which has made a policy to lease agricultural land. After the approval of Rashtrapati Bhavan, the state government has issued the order. Under this leasing policy, instead of giving land on a 30-year lease, the concerned farmer will get the rent for the land. By this policy any institutions, company, firm or NGO can take farm lands of maximum 30 acres in villages for lease for a period of 30 years and the government land around farm land can be taken for lease by paying the fee with the permission of the District Magistrate.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Uttarakhand
    Explanation:
    Uttarakhand has become the first state in India which has made a policy to lease agricultural land. After the approval of Rashtrapati Bhavan, the state government has issued the order. Under this leasing policy, instead of giving land on a 30-year lease, the concerned farmer will get the rent for the land. By this policy any institutions, company, firm or NGO can take farm lands of maximum 30 acres in villages for lease for a period of 30 years and the government land around farm land can be taken for lease by paying the fee with the permission of the District Magistrate.

  26. Question 26 of 50
    26. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the country, that assumes the chairmanship of Group of 77 (G77) for the year 2020 from the State of Palestine recently.

    Correct

    Answer-1) Guyana
    Explanation:
    Guyana takes over chairmanship of the Group of 77 (G77) for the year 2020. It assumes the chairmanship of the Group from the State of Palestine. The United Nations (UN) celebrates its 75th anniversary in 2020. The G77 is the largest intergovernmental organization of developing countries in the UN. It was designed to promote its members’ collective economic interests and create an enhanced joint negotiating capacity in the UN.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Guyana
    Explanation:
    Guyana takes over chairmanship of the Group of 77 (G77) for the year 2020. It assumes the chairmanship of the Group from the State of Palestine. The United Nations (UN) celebrates its 75th anniversary in 2020. The G77 is the largest intergovernmental organization of developing countries in the UN. It was designed to promote its members’ collective economic interests and create an enhanced joint negotiating capacity in the UN.

    3.Shri Acharya Balakrishnan ( Patanjali),Social Welfare

    7.Smt.Geeta Koda (Member of Parliament MP, Lok Sabha), Social Welfare (Aspirational Districts)
    8.Shri Allu Arvind (Social welfare) – Andhra Pradesh

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Hemant Soren
    Explanation:

Award Contribution:The award is contributed to Hemant for his work in the Barhait and Dumka assembly constituencies in the state. Other awardees are:
    1.Shri Manish Shisodia (Deputy Chief Minister of Delhi),( Education)
    2.Shri Anurag Thakur (Minister of State MoS Finance & Corporate Affairs), Social Welfare
    3.Shri Acharya Balakrishnan ( Patanjali),Social Welfare

The council will provide measures to build a strong ecosystem for new innovations and start-ups in the country. AIM: The council aims to increase the economic growth and generate large scale employment opportunities in India.

    Explanation:
    On January 21,2020 The Central Government announced the structure of the National Startup Advisory Council, chaired by the Union Minister of Commerce and Industry(MoCI) Shri Piyush Vedprakash Goyal. The council will provide measures to build a strong ecosystem for new innovations and start-ups in the country. AIM: The council aims to increase the economic growth and generate large scale employment opportunities in India.

  29. Question 29 of 50
    29. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the firm that acquired Uber Eats valued at about $350 million (nearly Rs 2,485 crore) recently .

    Correct

    Answer-4) Zomato
    Explanation:
    On January 21, 2020, Zomato, an Indian restaurant aggregator and food delivery startup has acquired Uber’s food delivery business in India, Uber Eats in an all-stocks deal valued at about $350 million (nearly Rs 2,485 crore).As part of the deal, Uber will now hold only 9.99 % shares of Zomato & UberEats will discontinue operations and direct restaurants, delivery partners. Further, all of Uber Eats’ customers will be directed to Zomato platform.

    Incorrect

    Answer-4) Zomato
    Explanation:
    On January 21, 2020, Zomato, an Indian restaurant aggregator and food delivery startup has acquired Uber’s food delivery business in India, Uber Eats in an all-stocks deal valued at about $350 million (nearly Rs 2,485 crore).As part of the deal, Uber will now hold only 9.99 % shares of Zomato & UberEats will discontinue operations and direct restaurants, delivery partners. Further, all of Uber Eats’ customers will be directed to Zomato platform.

  30. Question 30 of 50
    30. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which country was affected by “Novel coronavirus (nCoV)” recently ?

    Correct

    Answer-3) China
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare(MoHFW) of govt. of India has initiated various measures as a precaution for the recent outbreak of the 2019 Novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) in China. The Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) has been asked to facilitate thermal screening at the international airports of Delhi, Mumbai(Maharashtra), Kolkata (West Bengal), Chennai(Tamil Nadu), Bengaluru (Karnataka), Hyderabad(Telangana) and Cochin (Kerala) under the guidelines of the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO).

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) China
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare(MoHFW) of govt. of India has initiated various measures as a precaution for the recent outbreak of the 2019 Novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) in China. The Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) has been asked to facilitate thermal screening at the international airports of Delhi, Mumbai(Maharashtra), Kolkata (West Bengal), Chennai(Tamil Nadu), Bengaluru (Karnataka), Hyderabad(Telangana) and Cochin (Kerala) under the guidelines of the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO).

  31. Question 31 of 50
    31. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the capital of the newly merged Union Territory (UT) Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu ?

    Correct

    Answer-1) Daman
    Explanation:
    After the parliament passed a bill to merge two Union territories(UTs) Daman and Diu, and Dadra and Nagar Haveli into a single UT, CCEA has now approved the proposed amendments/extension/repeal in the following Acts and Regulations dealing with Goods and Services Tax (GST), Value Added Tax (VAT) and State Excise, and for designation of Daman as Headquarter of UT of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu on January 26,2020. The amendments are as follows:
    Amendments/repeals/extensions:

    Current Act Name of act after being amended/repealed or extended
    Central Goods and Service Tax Act, 2017. To be amended as Central Goods and Service Tax (Amendments) Regulation, 2020.
    Union Territory Goods and Service Tax Act, 2017. To be amended as Union Territory Goods and Service Tax (Amendments) Regulation, 2020.
    Dadra and Nagar Haveli Value Added Tax Regulation, 2005. To be amended as Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu Value Added Tax (Amendments) Regulation, 2020.
    Daman and Diu Value Added Tax Regulation, 2005. To be repealed as Daman and Diu Value Added Tax (Repeal) Regulation, 2020.
    Goa, Daman and Diu Excise Duty Act, 1964. To be amended as Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu Excise Duty (Amendment) Regulation, 2020.
    Dadra and Nagar Haveli Excise Duty Regulation, 2012. Dadra and Nagar Haveli Excise Duty (Repeal) Regulation, 2020.
    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Daman
    Explanation:
    After the parliament passed a bill to merge two Union territories(UTs) Daman and Diu, and Dadra and Nagar Haveli into a single UT, CCEA has now approved the proposed amendments/extension/repeal in the following Acts and Regulations dealing with Goods and Services Tax (GST), Value Added Tax (VAT) and State Excise, and for designation of Daman as Headquarter of UT of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu on January 26,2020. The amendments are as follows:
    Amendments/repeals/extensions:

    Current Act Name of act after being amended/repealed or extended
    Central Goods and Service Tax Act, 2017. To be amended as Central Goods and Service Tax (Amendments) Regulation, 2020.
    Union Territory Goods and Service Tax Act, 2017. To be amended as Union Territory Goods and Service Tax (Amendments) Regulation, 2020.
    Dadra and Nagar Haveli Value Added Tax Regulation, 2005. To be amended as Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu Value Added Tax (Amendments) Regulation, 2020.
    Daman and Diu Value Added Tax Regulation, 2005. To be repealed as Daman and Diu Value Added Tax (Repeal) Regulation, 2020.
    Goa, Daman and Diu Excise Duty Act, 1964. To be amended as Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu Excise Duty (Amendment) Regulation, 2020.
    Dadra and Nagar Haveli Excise Duty Regulation, 2012. Dadra and Nagar Haveli Excise Duty (Repeal) Regulation, 2020.
  32. Question 32 of 50
    32. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Where did Minister of External Affairs (MEA) Shri Subrahmanyam Jaishankar inaugurated the first convention centre in Africa, “Mahatma Gandhi convention centre”(MGICC) ?

    Correct

    Answer-3) Niger
    Explanation:
    On January 21,2020 India’s Minister of External Affairs (MEA) Shri Subrahmanyam Jaishankar and Nigerian President Mahamadou Issoufau inaugurated the first convention centre in Africa namely “Mahatma Gandhi convention centre”(MGICC) established at the state of Niger in Western Africa by India to honour the memory of 150th Birth Anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi.This is the 1st centre established in Africa by India under grant assistance. Mr. Subrahmanyam Jaishankar was the first Indian-foreign Minister to visit the West-African country during his national trip visit to Niger (West Africa) and Tunisia (North Africa).

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) Niger
    Explanation:
    On January 21,2020 India’s Minister of External Affairs (MEA) Shri Subrahmanyam Jaishankar and Nigerian President Mahamadou Issoufau inaugurated the first convention centre in Africa namely “Mahatma Gandhi convention centre”(MGICC) established at the state of Niger in Western Africa by India to honour the memory of 150th Birth Anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi.This is the 1st centre established in Africa by India under grant assistance. Mr. Subrahmanyam Jaishankar was the first Indian-foreign Minister to visit the West-African country during his national trip visit to Niger (West Africa) and Tunisia (North Africa).

  33. Question 33 of 50
    33. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the 1st Indian telecom operator that has recently launched UPI (Unified Payments Interface) payments space.

    Correct

    Answer-4) Reliance Jio
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 telecom operator Reliance Jio of the Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) has become the 1st Indian telecom operator to launch UPI (Unified Payments Interface) payments space. Thus Reliance Jio will now compete with other private UPI payment providers such as Paytm, Google Pay and PhonePe.As of now, Reliance Jio is India’s largest telecom operator.As per reports, users cannot use their existing UPI ids to avail this service. Instead, they will have to create a new JIO UPI Id.

    Incorrect

    Answer-4) Reliance Jio
    Explanation:
    On January 20, 2020 telecom operator Reliance Jio of the Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) has become the 1st Indian telecom operator to launch UPI (Unified Payments Interface) payments space. Thus Reliance Jio will now compete with other private UPI payment providers such as Paytm, Google Pay and PhonePe.As of now, Reliance Jio is India’s largest telecom operator.As per reports, users cannot use their existing UPI ids to avail this service. Instead, they will have to create a new JIO UPI Id.

  34. Question 34 of 50
    34. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the 1st Woman & 13th President of Greece, who was elected on January 22, 2020 .

    Correct

    Answer-3) Katerina Sakellaropoulou
    Explanation:
    On January 22, 2020 independent candidate Katerina Sakellaropoulou(63 years), became the1st Woman President of Greece elected by the Greece’s Parliament for a period of 5 years. She will be officially sworn in as Greece’s 13th President in April, 2020. She will succeed Prokopis Pavlopoulos, the current president.Katerina is the Council of State (Supreme Administrative court of Greece) studied law in Athens(Greece) and completed her postgraduate studies at the Sorbonne in Paris,France.She was born on 30 May 1956 in Thessaloniki, Greece and the daughter of Supreme Court Judge.

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) Katerina Sakellaropoulou
    Explanation:
    On January 22, 2020 independent candidate Katerina Sakellaropoulou(63 years), became the1st Woman President of Greece elected by the Greece’s Parliament for a period of 5 years. She will be officially sworn in as Greece’s 13th President in April, 2020. She will succeed Prokopis Pavlopoulos, the current president.Katerina is the Council of State (Supreme Administrative court of Greece) studied law in Athens(Greece) and completed her postgraduate studies at the Sorbonne in Paris,France.She was born on 30 May 1956 in Thessaloniki, Greece and the daughter of Supreme Court Judge.

  35. Question 35 of 50
    35. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who was appointed as the Prime Minister (PM) of Lebanon ?

    Correct

    Answer-1) Hassan Diab
    Explanation:
    On January 22,2020 Lebanon President Micheal Naim Aoun announced formation of new Government due to anti-government protests for the last several months. The new Government (govt) will be headed by Prime Minister (PM) Hassan Diab, 60 year old professor at the American University of Beirut, Lebanon.The New Government consists of 20 member technocrats.Formation of the new government was announced after Hezbollah party & its allies made a deal to tackle the country’s worst economic crisis in decade.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Hassan Diab
    Explanation:
    On January 22,2020 Lebanon President Micheal Naim Aoun announced formation of new Government due to anti-government protests for the last several months. The new Government (govt) will be headed by Prime Minister (PM) Hassan Diab, 60 year old professor at the American University of Beirut, Lebanon.The New Government consists of 20 member technocrats.Formation of the new government was announced after Hezbollah party & its allies made a deal to tackle the country’s worst economic crisis in decade.

  36. Question 36 of 50
    36. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the state government, that secured the top spot in the ‘SKOCH State of Governance 2019’ .

    Correct

    Answer-5) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    On January 22, 2020,According to the ‘SKOCH State of Governance 2019’ report, Gujarat gained the top spot on the back of better performance in Health, Education, Power and e-Governance segments.
    Gujarat, which was ranked 5th in 2018 replaces 2018 leader West Bengal.
    The projects undertaken by the states, have performed the best in terms of rankings across 22 different parameters have been listed as STARS.
    Top 3 Star states include:

    Rank State Name Project
    1 Gujarat 104 projects
    2 Maharashtra 50 projects
    3 West Bengal 20 projects

    Gujarat is also ranked top in terms of governance category (leaving Tamil Nadu to the 2nd ) &other sectors including tourism and culture , e-Governance, Health, Education, Power Infrastructure.

    Incorrect

    Answer-5) Gujarat
    Explanation:
    On January 22, 2020,According to the ‘SKOCH State of Governance 2019’ report, Gujarat gained the top spot on the back of better performance in Health, Education, Power and e-Governance segments.
    Gujarat, which was ranked 5th in 2018 replaces 2018 leader West Bengal.
    The projects undertaken by the states, have performed the best in terms of rankings across 22 different parameters have been listed as STARS.
    Top 3 Star states include:

    Rank State Name Project
    1 Gujarat 104 projects
    2 Maharashtra 50 projects
    3 West Bengal 20 projects

    Gujarat is also ranked top in terms of governance category (leaving Tamil Nadu to the 2nd ) &other sectors including tourism and culture , e-Governance, Health, Education, Power Infrastructure.

Yash Aradhya (17 years) of Bengaluru, Karnataka created history by becoming the 1st motorsports personality to be awarded the Rashtriya Bal Puraskar.

  38. Question 38 of 50
    38. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which is the ‘most polluted Indian city’ with 322 µg/m3 (micrograms per cubic meter) of PM10 (Particulate matter) pollutants in 2018 as per the Greenpeace India report for 2018 ?

    Correct

    Answer-5) Jharia, Jharkhand
    Explanation:
    The Greenpeace India report for 2018 was released based on the National Ambient Air Quality Monitoring Programme (NAMP), on January 21, 2020. Jharia in Jharkhand which is known for Coal-belching is the most polluted Indian city with 322 µg/m3 (micrograms per cubic meter) of PM10 (Particulate matter) pollutants in 2018, according to the report analysis of 287 cities across the country. Out of 287 cities 231 cities were severely polluted.

    Incorrect

    Answer-5) Jharia, Jharkhand
    Explanation:
    The Greenpeace India report for 2018 was released based on the National Ambient Air Quality Monitoring Programme (NAMP), on January 21, 2020. Jharia in Jharkhand which is known for Coal-belching is the most polluted Indian city with 322 µg/m3 (micrograms per cubic meter) of PM10 (Particulate matter) pollutants in 2018, according to the report analysis of 287 cities across the country. Out of 287 cities 231 cities were severely polluted.

  39. Question 39 of 50
    39. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the rank of India in the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU)’s 12th edition of the ‘Democracy Index 2019: A year of democratic setbacks and popular protest’ ?

    Correct

    Answer– 2) 51st
    Explanation:
    On January 22, 2020, According to the 12th edition of the ‘Democracy Index 2019: A year of democratic setbacks and popular protest’, released by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU), India has slipped 10 ranks to 51st spot with the score of 6.90 in this index, which provides a blueprint for the current state of democracy in 167 nations.
     Top 3 & Bottom 3 countries in the Index:

    Rank Country Score
    51st India 6.9
    1 Norway 9.87
    2 Iceland 9.58
    3 Sweden 9.39
    165 Central African Republic 1.32
    166 Democratic Republic of the Congo 1.13
    167 North Korea 1.08
    Incorrect

    Answer– 2) 51st
    Explanation:
    On January 22, 2020, According to the 12th edition of the ‘Democracy Index 2019: A year of democratic setbacks and popular protest’, released by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU), India has slipped 10 ranks to 51st spot with the score of 6.90 in this index, which provides a blueprint for the current state of democracy in 167 nations.
     Top 3 & Bottom 3 countries in the Index:

    Rank Country Score
    51st India 6.9
    1 Norway 9.87
    2 Iceland 9.58
    3 Sweden 9.39
    165 Central African Republic 1.32
    166 Democratic Republic of the Congo 1.13
    167 North Korea 1.08
  40. Question 40 of 50
    40. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian city, that hosts the 3rd edition of Khelo India Youth Games (KIYG) 2020 .

    Correct

    Answer-5) Guwahati, Assam
    Explanation:
    The 3rd edition of Khelo India Youth Games (KIYG) 2020 was held at Karmabir Nabin Chandra Bordoloi Indoor Stadium in Guwahati, Assam with the participation of over 10,000 students. Vijay the Tiger and Jaya the Black buck were the mascots of the tournament. Maharashtra clinched Khelo India Youth Games 2020 champions trophy with a collection of 256 medals (78 gold, 77 silver and 101 bronze).

    Incorrect

    Answer-5) Guwahati, Assam
    Explanation:
    The 3rd edition of Khelo India Youth Games (KIYG) 2020 was held at Karmabir Nabin Chandra Bordoloi Indoor Stadium in Guwahati, Assam with the participation of over 10,000 students. Vijay the Tiger and Jaya the Black buck were the mascots of the tournament. Maharashtra clinched Khelo India Youth Games 2020 champions trophy with a collection of 256 medals (78 gold, 77 silver and 101 bronze).

    Which state celebrates the festival ‘Chapchar Kut’ recently ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) Mizoram
    Explanation:
    On January 14, 2020 Government of Mizoram along with the organizing committee under the chairmanship of Chief Minister Zoramthanga has decided to celebrate the ‘Chapchar Kut’, the biggest and most important festival of the Mizos, on March 6, 2020. The two- days festival is celebrated under the theme “Promotion of Mizos’ culture and moral code”.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Mizoram
    Explanation:
    On January 14, 2020 Government of Mizoram along with the organizing committee under the chairmanship of Chief Minister Zoramthanga has decided to celebrate the ‘Chapchar Kut’, the biggest and most important festival of the Mizos, on March 6, 2020. The two- days festival is celebrated under the theme “Promotion of Mizos’ culture and moral code”.

    Jeppe Sebastian Kofod is the foreign Minister of Denmark.He visited India to participate in 5th edition of the Raisina Dialogue 2020.He met Minister of External Affairs(MEA) of India Shri S.Jaishankar and held discussions on ‘Green Strategic Partnership’ between the two countries.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 4) Jeppe Sebastian Kofod
    Explanation:
    Jeppe Sebastian Kofod is the foreign Minister of Denmark.He visited India to participate in 5th edition of the Raisina Dialogue 2020.He met Minister of External Affairs(MEA) of India Shri S.Jaishankar and held discussions on ‘Green Strategic Partnership’ between the two countries.

  43. Question 43 of 50
    43. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Which country has operationalised the world’s largest radio telescope, “Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical radio Telescope” (FAST) recently ?

    Correct

    Answer – 2) China
    Explanation:
    China operationalised the world’s largest radio telescope with a diameter of half-a-kilometre. The “Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical radio Telescope” (FAST) is a single-dish telescope and is located in southwest China’s Guiyang city, the capital of Guizhou province. The telescope has a receiving area of around 30 football fields.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 2) China
    Explanation:
    China operationalised the world’s largest radio telescope with a diameter of half-a-kilometre. The “Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical radio Telescope” (FAST) is a single-dish telescope and is located in southwest China’s Guiyang city, the capital of Guizhou province. The telescope has a receiving area of around 30 football fields.

  44. Question 44 of 50

    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Who is the President of Guatemala ?

    Correct

    Answer – 1) Alejandro Giammattei
    Explanation:
    Alejandro Giammattei sworn in as the President of Guatemala. He won the 2019 election and assumed office on January 14, 2020.

    Incorrect

    Answer – 1) Alejandro Giammattei
    Explanation:
    Alejandro Giammattei sworn in as the President of Guatemala. He won the 2019 election and assumed office on January 14, 2020.

  45. Question 45 of 50
    45. Question
    1 points
    Category: Static GK

    Which state celebrates the “Magh Bihu festival” recently ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) Assam
    Explanation:
    On January 15,2020 Magh Bihu, an auspicious harvest festival is being celebrated in Assam. Magh Bihu falls in the local month of ‘Magh’ during mid-january. It is also called ‘Bhogali Bihu’ or ‘Maghor Bihu’ as it is celebrated with community feasts after the annual harvest takes place. The night before ‘Magh Bihu’ is called ‘Uruka’ meaning the night of feasts.The villagers make bamboo huts called ‘Bhelghor’ or community kitchen where they begin with the preparations for the festival.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Assam
    Explanation:
    On January 15,2020 Magh Bihu, an auspicious harvest festival is being celebrated in Assam. Magh Bihu falls in the local month of ‘Magh’ during mid-january. It is also called ‘Bhogali Bihu’ or ‘Maghor Bihu’ as it is celebrated with community feasts after the annual harvest takes place. The night before ‘Magh Bihu’ is called ‘Uruka’ meaning the night of feasts.The villagers make bamboo huts called ‘Bhelghor’ or community kitchen where they begin with the preparations for the festival.

  1. Question 1 of 50
    1. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What was the theme of the 107th edition of the Indian Science Congress (ISC) for the year 2020 ?

    Correct

    Answer-1) Theme – “Science and Technology: Rural Development”
    Explanation:
    Prime Minister of India Shri Narendra Modi inaugurated the 107th edition of the Indian Science Congress (ISC) also known as ISC 2020 at the University of Agricultural Sciences (UAS) in Bengaluru, Karnataka. The theme of ISC for the year 2020 was “Science and Technology: Rural Development”.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Theme – “Science and Technology: Rural Development”
    Explanation:
    Prime Minister of India Shri Narendra Modi inaugurated the 107th edition of the Indian Science Congress (ISC) also known as ISC 2020 at the University of Agricultural Sciences (UAS) in Bengaluru, Karnataka. The theme of ISC for the year 2020 was “Science and Technology: Rural Development”.

  2. Question 2 of 50
    2. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which Indian city hosts the 1st Farmer’s Science Congress recently ?

    Correct

    Answer-4) Bengaluru, Karnataka
    Explanation:
    During ISC 2020, for the 1st time Farmer’s Science Congress was conducted. It was inaugurated by Dr. Trilochan Mohapatra, Secretary of the Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE) & Director General(DG) of Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR). Some of the highlights are as follows: PM Modi’s vision of doubling of farmers’ income by 2022 was discussed during the event. Farmers were encouraged to make use of organic farming. Development of 45 types of organic farming systems in niche areas was also announced.

    Incorrect

    Answer-4) Bengaluru, Karnataka
    Explanation:
    During ISC 2020, for the 1st time Farmer’s Science Congress was conducted. It was inaugurated by Dr. Trilochan Mohapatra, Secretary of the Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE) & Director General(DG) of Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR). Some of the highlights are as follows: PM Modi’s vision of doubling of farmers’ income by 2022 was discussed during the event. Farmers were encouraged to make use of organic farming. Development of 45 types of organic farming systems in niche areas was also announced.

  3. Question 3 of 50
    3. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the Indian city, that host the 5th edition of Asia Pacific drosophila research conference (APDRC) for the first time in India .

    Correct

    Answer-2) Pune, Maharashtra
    Explanation:
    The Asia Pacific drosophila research conference (APDRC) is being conducted in India for the 1st time from January 6-10 in Pune, Maharashtra. Overall this is the 5th edition of the biennial conference and is known by the name APDRC5. It is organised by Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER). The conference aims to promote the interaction of Drosophila researchers in the Asia-Pacific region with the rest of the world.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Pune, Maharashtra
    Explanation:
    The Asia Pacific drosophila research conference (APDRC) is being conducted in India for the 1st time from January 6-10 in Pune, Maharashtra. Overall this is the 5th edition of the biennial conference and is known by the name APDRC5. It is organised by Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER). The conference aims to promote the interaction of Drosophila researchers in the Asia-Pacific region with the rest of the world.

    4. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who chaired the 2nd edition of the National GST (Goods and Service Tax) Conference of the Commissioners of State Tax and Chief Commissioners of Central Tax that held in New Delhi ?

    Correct

    Answer-3) Ajay Bhushan Pandey
    Explanation:
    On January 07, 2020 the 2nd edition of the National GST Conference of the Commissioners of State Tax and Chief Commissioners of Central Tax was held in New Delhi under the chairmanship of Dr Ajay Bhushan Pandey, Revenue Secretary of the Ministry of Finance(MoF). The conference was held to streamline the GST (Goods and Service Tax) system and also to plug revenue leakages.

    Incorrect

    Answer-3) Ajay Bhushan Pandey
    Explanation:
    On January 07, 2020 the 2nd edition of the National GST Conference of the Commissioners of State Tax and Chief Commissioners of Central Tax was held in New Delhi under the chairmanship of Dr Ajay Bhushan Pandey, Revenue Secretary of the Ministry of Finance(MoF). The conference was held to streamline the GST (Goods and Service Tax) system and also to plug revenue leakages.

  5. Question 5 of 50
    5. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of India for the year 2019-20 as per the National Statistical Office (NSO) ?

    Correct

    Answer-4) 5%
    Explanation:
    On January 07, 2020 the National Statistical Office (NSO) of the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) has released the 1st Advance estimates of the national income at both constant(2011-12) and current prices for FY(Financial Year) 2019-20.GDP growth: The growth in real GDP for 2019-20 is estimated at 5% compared to 6.8% for 2018-19.

    Incorrect

    Answer-4) 5%
    Explanation:
    On January 07, 2020 the National Statistical Office (NSO) of the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) has released the 1st Advance estimates of the national income at both constant(2011-12) and current prices for FY(Financial Year) 2019-20.GDP growth: The growth in real GDP for 2019-20 is estimated at 5% compared to 6.8% for 2018-19.

  6. Question 6 of 50
    6. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Who won the Presidential election of Croatia on January 6, 2020 ?

    Correct

    Answer-4) Zoran Milanovic
    Explanation:
    On January 6, 2020 Zoran Milanovic, 53 years old won Croatia’s presidential election. Zoran Milanovic is Croatia’s center-leftist former Prime Minister.He defeated center-right incumbent Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic(51 years old), who was the first female president of Croatia.The Presidential election was held on 22 December 2019.Milanovic belongs to the Social Democratic Party(SDP) won 52.7% vote while Grabar-kitarovic of the ruling Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ) won 47.3%.

    Incorrect

    Answer-4) Zoran Milanovic
    Explanation:
    On January 6, 2020 Zoran Milanovic, 53 years old won Croatia’s presidential election. Zoran Milanovic is Croatia’s center-leftist former Prime Minister.He defeated center-right incumbent Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic(51 years old), who was the first female president of Croatia.The Presidential election was held on 22 December 2019.Milanovic belongs to the Social Democratic Party(SDP) won 52.7% vote while Grabar-kitarovic of the ruling Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ) won 47.3%.

  7. Question 7 of 50
    7. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the satellite, that is set to be launched by Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) for communication with India’s first manned space mission ‘Gaganyaan’ .

    Correct

    Answer-1) Indian Data Relay Satellite System (IDRSS)
    Explanation:
    On January 7, 2020, The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO),the space agency of the Government of India (GoI), has planned to launch a new satellite series called “Indian Data Relay Satellite System (IDRSS)” for seamless communication for India’s first manned space mission ‘Gaganyaan’, which have a schedule to take off in 2022. IDRSS For Gangayaan Mission: It consists of 2 satellites, which will be deployed in phases. The 1st one planned to launch by the end of 2020 to track and be constantly in touch with Indian satellites, mainly with those in low-earth orbits (LEO). Then the 2nd IDRSS satellite will be launched in 2021, which will set the platform for the main mission launch in 2022.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Indian Data Relay Satellite System (IDRSS)
    Explanation:
    On January 7, 2020, The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO),the space agency of the Government of India (GoI), has planned to launch a new satellite series called “Indian Data Relay Satellite System (IDRSS)” for seamless communication for India’s first manned space mission ‘Gaganyaan’, which have a schedule to take off in 2022. IDRSS For Gangayaan Mission: It consists of 2 satellites, which will be deployed in phases. The 1st one planned to launch by the end of 2020 to track and be constantly in touch with Indian satellites, mainly with those in low-earth orbits (LEO). Then the 2nd IDRSS satellite will be launched in 2021, which will set the platform for the main mission launch in 2022.

  8. Question 8 of 50
    8. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Which state accounted for the maximum number of economic offences in 2018 as per the National Crime Record Bureau’s (NCRB) report ?

    Correct

    Answer-1) Uttar Pradesh(UP)
    Explanation:
    On January 09, 2020 National Crime Record Bureau’s (NCRB) report on Crime in India for the year 2018 was released. The report stated that Uttar Pradesh(UP) accounted for the maximum number of economic offences in 2018 with 22,822 cases recorded. It was followed by Rajasthan (21,309 cases), Maharashtra (14,854 cases), Telangana (10,390 cases) and Bihar (9,209 cases) in the 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th rank respectively.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) Uttar Pradesh(UP)
    Explanation:
    On January 09, 2020 National Crime Record Bureau’s (NCRB) report on Crime in India for the year 2018 was released. The report stated that Uttar Pradesh(UP) accounted for the maximum number of economic offences in 2018 with 22,822 cases recorded. It was followed by Rajasthan (21,309 cases), Maharashtra (14,854 cases), Telangana (10,390 cases) and Bihar (9,209 cases) in the 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th rank respectively.

    Category: Current Affairs

    Which city ranked 1st in the list of fastest growing urban regions/ fastest growing cities in the world as per Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) Malappuram, Kerala
    Explanation:
    On January 08,2020 latest ranking based on fastest growing urban regions/ fastest growing cities in the world was released by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU). as per the report 3 of the cities in Kerala were ranked in the top 10 places. Malappuram city of Kerala was ranked 1st in the list, while Kerala’s Kozhikode and Kollam cities were ranked in the 4th and 10th place respectively.

    Rank  City  Country
    1 Malappuram  (Kerala) India
    4 Kozhikode  (Kerala) India
    10 Kollam  (Kerala) India
    2 Can Tho Vietnam
    3 Suqian China
    Incorrect

    Answer-2) Malappuram, Kerala
    Explanation:
    On January 08,2020 latest ranking based on fastest growing urban regions/ fastest growing cities in the world was released by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU). as per the report 3 of the cities in Kerala were ranked in the top 10 places. Malappuram city of Kerala was ranked 1st in the list, while Kerala’s Kozhikode and Kollam cities were ranked in the 4th and 10th place respectively.

    Rank  City  Country

    10 Kollam  (Kerala) India

  10. Question 10 of 50
    10. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the rank of Indian Passport in the Henley passport Index 2020 released by Henley & Partners ?

    Correct

    Answer-4) 84th
    Explanation:
    On January 08, 2020 the Henley passport Index 2020 was released by Henley & Partners. As per the index based on the data obtained from International Air Transport Association (IATA), Indian passport ranked at the 84th spot among the world’s most powerful passports list, which is a drop by 2 places as it ranked 82nd in 2019.

    Incorrect

    Answer-4) 84th
    Explanation:
    On January 08, 2020 the Henley passport Index 2020 was released by Henley & Partners. As per the index based on the data obtained from International Air Transport Association (IATA), Indian passport ranked at the 84th spot among the world’s most powerful passports list, which is a drop by 2 places as it ranked 82nd in 2019.

  11. Question 11 of 50
    11. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    Name the app launched by HDFC Bank recently to boost digital payments in India.

    Correct

    Answer-1) ‘myApps’
    Explanation:
    On January 9, 2020,In a bid to make the business more convenient for customers, HDFC (Housing Development Finance Corporation) Bank,an Indian banking and financial services company, for the 1st time has launched ‘myApps’, which is a suite of white-label apps to benefit urban local bodies, housing societies, local clubs and gymkhanas and religious institutions. Customised in over 20 languages including Hindi and English, it will help above said organisations to entirely digitise their ecosystem by allowing customise their brand and content. Through this, large institutions can make payments for payments, fees, make online bookings for various facilities, stay updated on latest announcements, and utilise a host of other features offered by the institutions itself.

    Incorrect

    Answer-1) ‘myApps’
    Explanation:
    On January 9, 2020,In a bid to make the business more convenient for customers, HDFC (Housing Development Finance Corporation) Bank,an Indian banking and financial services company, for the 1st time has launched ‘myApps’, which is a suite of white-label apps to benefit urban local bodies, housing societies, local clubs and gymkhanas and religious institutions. Customised in over 20 languages including Hindi and English, it will help above said organisations to entirely digitise their ecosystem by allowing customise their brand and content. Through this, large institutions can make payments for payments, fees, make online bookings for various facilities, stay updated on latest announcements, and utilise a host of other features offered by the institutions itself.

  12. Question 12 of 50
    12. Question
    1 points
    Category: Current Affairs

    What is the Gross Domestic Product (GDP)of India in the year FY20 as per the World Bank (WB)’s report, “January 2020 Global Economic Prospects: Slow growth, policy challenges” ?

    Correct

    Answer-2) 5%
    Explanation:
    On January 08, 2020, World Bank (WB),an international financial institution, in its report, “January 2020 Global Economic Prospects: Slow growth, policy challenges” ,has Slashed India’s GDP(Gross domestic product) growth for financial year –FY 2020 to 5% from 6% estimated earlier in October 2019.The bank cuts the forecast due to the weakness in credit distribution of non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) in India.

    Incorrect

    Answer-2) 5%
    Explanation:
    On January 08, 2020, World Bank (WB),an international financial institution, in its report, “January 2020 Global Economic Prospects: Slow growth, policy challenges” ,has Slashed India’s GDP(Gross domestic product) growth for financial year –FY 2020 to 5% from 6% estimated earlier in October 2019.The bank cuts the forecast due to the weakness in credit distribution of non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) in India.

    1 points
